title: Commerical Cleaner
description:
## Job Overview

We are looking for a skilled Commercial Manager to oversee our commercial cleaning operations. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the cleanliness and organization of commercial spaces, maintaining high standards of cleanliness and hygiene.

## Duties

- Manage and supervise a team of cleaning staff to ensure efficient and effective cleaning operations

- Oversee the cleaning and sanitization of commercial spaces, including offices, hotels, and other facilities

-Preform estimates for future contracts

- Coordinate with clients to address specific cleaning requirements and ensure customer satisfaction

- Monitor inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment, ensuring adequate stock levels

- Conduct regular inspections to uphold cleanliness standards and identify areas for improvement

## Experience

- Prior experience in managing commercial cleaning operations or similar roles

- Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and guide a team

- Knowledge of hospitality industry practices and standards

- Experience in supervising custodial tasks and commercial cleaning procedures

- Familiarity with housekeeping management principles is advantageous

If you are a proactive leader with a background in commercial cleaning and a passion for maintaining clean and organized environments, we invite you to apply for the Commercial Manager position with us.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $19.00 - $21.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift
* Overnight shift

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* North Babylon, NY (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* North Babylon, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Support Prada Broadway
description:
Founded in 1913 in Italy, the Prada Group was built on a tradition of excellence and with a vision of innovation. The Group, a world leader in the luxury sector, operates in more than 45 countries with the PRADA, Miu Miu, Church’s and Car Shoe brands, and has employees of over 100 nationalities.
The acquisition of Pasticceria Marchesi 1824 has marked the Group’s entry into the food sector, applying the same high quality criteria. Very proactive also in the art field, the Prada Group strengthens its presence through contemporary art projects in constant evolution.
Joining our Company means working in a creative and international environment, with teams of people motivated by curiosity and the quest for excellence. The engine of our success is the importance and value that we place on the talent and passion of our people leading to their own professional growth.  

**JOB PURPOSE**  


Supporting sales Staff in providing and putting back products from stockroom to sales floor and to bring ordered items to cash desk.  


**RESPONSIBILITIES**  


* Support the sales team when serving customers
* Take products from stockroom or related area to salesperson
* Processing orders from the sales team
* Assist salesperson wrapping the merchandises.
* Serve drinks to customers when needed
* Contribute to the organization, maintenance and optimization of the warehouse
* Keep the sales floor clean and tidy

  


**KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS**  


High affinity for luxury products
High sense of responsibility, good communication and team working skills
Good knowledge of computer skills
English a must other languages a plus  


*This position will be paid an hourly rate that may range from $20.00-22.00, annualized from $45,760 - $45,760, and if applicable, may be eligible for bonuses and other incentive opportunities. The rate of pay offered may vary based on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.*
company_description: Prada S.p.A. has been concentrating its investments to pursue a long-term growth focused on the development of its owned brands and in strengthening its global retail network.

title: Assistant Manager
description:
**Who Are We?** 

LA Fitness is a privately owned fitness club chain. LA Fitness has hundreds of health clubs and millions of members across US and Canada. In an industry often equated with fad and fashion, LA Fitness has steadily increased its presence by focusing on the one lifelong benefit valued by everyone: good health.

**About Us** 

Founded in Southern California in 1984, LA Fitness continues to seek innovative ways to enhance the physical and emotional well-being of our increasingly diverse membership base.

With our wide range of amenities and highly trained staff, we provide fun and effective workout options to family members of all ages and interests.

Our mission is to help as many people as possible achieve the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. To fulfill this mission, we will create a nationwide network of sports clubs, offering our members the widest range of amenities and the friendliest service at an affordable price. To carry out this mission we are searching for standout candidates to grow within our organization who align with our vision.

**Position: General Manager** 

The General Manager position is a critical role to the company’s growth plan. The General Manager is responsible for the overall performance of the facility and member experience. Operating with an ‘owner’s mentality,’ our General Manager spearheads sales, marketing, strategic planning, and developing the next class of General Managers. Our General Managers have two direct reports; a Personal Training Director and a Fitness Director. Our General Manager role is also supported by a District and Regional leadership team to ensure our GMs are equipped with the tools they need to deliver incredible services and customer experiences at our club level!

**Key responsibilities include**:

Sales & Marketing

* Lead, coach and develop the sales team
* Plan and execute offsite marketing and sales events, partnering with other local businesses
* Continuously monitor and drive the club's financial growth targets
* Set productivity goals to achieve weekly, monthly, yearly objectives
* Effectively multi-task with tight deadlines both independently and within a team environment.

Team Management

* Manage and develop your club's Personal Training and Membership teams across sales, marketing, and member experience.
* Assist in recruitment and brand development
* Facilitate employee onboarding and training
* Evaluate employee performance and create improvement action plans
* Identify concerns set expectations, goals, and delegate tasks.
* Effectively communicate expectations to staff and create a winning culture.
* Possess excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
* Demonstrate a positive attitude and ensure all departments are providing the highest level of customer service, cleanliness with our club pride practice and financial performance.

Operations

* Create and maintain the staff schedule
* Handle member service escalations and issues
* Ensure daily operational processes are followed (member service & follow-up, cleanliness)
* Implement and roll out promotions and other corporate programs approved by LAF

**We believe a successful manager should have:** 

* A passion for helping people and delivering a great customer experience
* A passion for fitness and health
* An excitement for sales and competitive spirit
* A player/coach leader who inspires and motivates through personal action
* The capability to lead effectively and create a welcoming, positive, and fun work environment
* An energetic and friendly problem solver
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* The ideal candidate will be passionate, knowledgeable, and have a personal commitment to health and wellness.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:** 

* Salary
* Commissions
* Bonus opportunities
* Promotion/Growth opportunities within three months
* Evening and weekend hours are required.
* Position is full-time (This position requires 50 hours (about 2 days) worked each week.)
* Complimentary membership
* Medical insurance after 90

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Morning shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Township of Howell, NJ 07731: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Runner
description:
**REPORTS TO:** Restaurant Manager


**Purpose for the Position:** The runner will be responsible for cleaning and clearing tables and the restaurant area while maintaining a high standard of sanitation, cleanliness and guest service.


**Essential Responsibilities:**


* Greet guests as they are seated and bring water to the table.


* Run food to the correct tables and explain the dish.


* Clear all tables of dishes and debris; continually remove glasses, empty dinner dishes and used silverware from table.


* Carry trays of dirty dishes to dish room and break down trays according to the procedures.


* Reset tables for next guest.


* Maintain floor areas to ensure they are clean and dry.


* Clean all spills and breakage immediately.


* Ensure all windows and glass surfaces are spotless.


* Clean service stations and fill ice bins.


* Assist servers with all aspects of service as requested.


* Report any damaged or worn items in the dining room to manager.


* Clean highchairs and booster seats after each use.


**To do this kind of work, you must be able to:**


* Previous experience preferred, but not required.
* Good communication and hospitality skills.
* Carry out specific oral or written instructions, frequently following a simple routine.
* Do the same task over and over, frequently in the same way.
* Get along with all kinds of people.
* Use hands and fingers skillfully and easily.
* Stand or walk for long periods of time.
* Lift and carry things like heavy trays and tables.
* Be available on nights, weekends, and holidays.

**Physical Demands:** Lifting 50 lbs. maximum with frequent lifting and/or carrying of objects weighing up to 30 lbs. Requires walking or standing to a significant degree, reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing, seeing.


**Environmental Conditions:** Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. A job is considered "inside" if the worker spends approximately 75% or more of the time inside.


**Math Skills:**Requires mathematical development sufficient to be able to: Add and subtract.


**Language Skills:** Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read instructions, rules, etc.


**Relationships to Data, People and Things:**


**Data:** Comparing: Judging the readily observable functional, structural or compositional characteristics (whether similar to or divergent from obvious standards) of data, people or things.


**People:** Serving: Attending to the needs, requests or the expressed or implicit wishes of people. Immediate response is involved.


**Things:** Handling: Using body members, hand tools and/or special devices to work, move or carry objects or materials. Involves little or no latitude for judgment with regard to attainment of standards or in selecting appropriate tool, object or material.


**Specific Vocational Preparation:** Specific vocational training includes an occupationally significant combination of: vocational education, apprentice training, in-plant training, on-the-job training, or essential experience in less responsible jobs which lead to the higher job or serving in other jobs; anything beyond short demonstration up to and including 30 days.


(Pay range: $10.65 in addition to tips)


(ref. 79184)

title: R-047631 Outside Sales Representative
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**\\*Position Overview**\\*Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores or industries. Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests. Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts. Assists in the collection of payments and scheduling of services.

**\\*Job Responsibilities**\\*

* Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores, or industry.
* Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests.
* Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts.
* Covers sales leads in assigned territory and develops sales leads creatively for each lead furnished.
* Records accurate measurements and writes correct descriptions of property inspected.
* Prepares appropriate specifications and treating instructions in accordance with existing laws, regulations and company policy.
* Computes job-treating cost from company pricing instructions.
* Executes contracts on behalf of the company, observing company policy as to credit terms of sale.
* Manages collection effort on delinquent accounts of personal sales contracts.
* Advises customers about other products and services.
* Deals courteously with customers, leaving customer’s premises and furnishings clean and as found.
* Contacts customers after service is performed to ensure customer satisfaction and to develop additional prospects.
* Reports unusual requests from customers or questions not immediately answerable to direct supervisor.
* Maintains prospect files, call-back files and activity records.
* Maintains equipment, vehicle and personal safety equipment in clean, working order.
* Examines architectural drawings and specifications; prepares estimates for soil pre- treatment bids.
* Completes appropriate training courses as assigned.
* Aware of location and telephone number of local poison control centers.

**\\*Job Requirements**\\*

* High school diploma or general education diploma (GED) required
* Bachelor's Degree or an equivalent combination of college and experience preferred
* 2 years related experience and/or training in sales and dealing with the public; or equivalent combination of training and experience preferred Maintains knowledge of pests and chemicals used in treatment
* Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos
* Ability to write correspondence
* Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
* Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs
* Skill in creating sales leads and cross-selling company products and services
* Maintains appearance of uniform as directed by company policy
* Maintains relevant licenses as required by federal, state or local regulations for termite/pest control and any other business unit products and services
* Maintains a valid driver’s license

**\\*Physical Demands and Working Conditions**\\*The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
**Incumbent must be prepared to:**

* Move up to 10 pounds occasionally, by lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.
* Sitting for long periods of time while using office equipment such as computers, phones and etc.
* Fingering and Repetitive motions; such as movement of wrists, hands and fingers while picking, pinching and typing during your normal working environment.
* Express or exchange ideas with others through the use of spoken word, quickly, accurately, and at an easily audible volume, and receive detailed information through oral communication at usual speaking levels without correction, and/or make fine discriminations in the nature of sounds in the environment.

**Incumbent is required to have:** 

* Close visual acuity to perform detail oriented activities at distances close to the eyes, as well as visual acuity to perform activities at or within arm’s reach with skill, control, and accuracy, such as preparing and analyzing data, viewing computer screen and expansive reading.

**Incumbent will be subject to:**

* Inside working conditions: The change of building environment such as with or without air conditioning and heating.

Peepels Mechanical Corporation a Union Contractor is seeking a sheet metal operations manager whose primary responsibility is managing the daily operation of the sheet metal dept. of the company.

title: Tax Preparer
description:
***\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* WE DO NOT PROVIDE CLIENTS \\*\\*\\*\\*\\****

At R&S Tax Pros , we pretty much provide you everything you need to be successful in tax preparation, ***except for clients.*** We provide you the software (web based professional tax software), use ours or yours EFIN number, bank products, office forms, camera ready marketing material from flyers and postcards to posters and banners, a website, and our name backing you.

So please, ask yourself three questions:

1. Do you feel you can get your own clients

2. Do you feel comfortable working out of your home or a location you set up?

3. Do you have at least one year of tax preparation experience in a professional setting?

If you asked each question with a YES, this opportunity is for you.

**Job Description**

* Assisting with administrative tasks, such as answering phones and setting up appointments.
* Collecting and organizing confidential information about clients’ income, expenses, and allowances.
* Understanding the tax laws of both federal and state, including adjustments, credits, and deductions.
* Double-checking data entry and math equations to ensure they are correct.
* Working with accounting and financial software
* Reviewing previous tax returns and financial documentation to find missing or insufficient information.
* Calculating taxes due or refunds due to the client.
* Consulting tax law publications for guidance in unusual situations.

***\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* WE DO NOT PROVIDE CLIENTS \\*\\*\\*\\*\\****

title: RN Nurse Manager
description:
**Care For the Homeless** **(CFH)** is a growing not-for-profit health care and social service agency that serves the homeless population of New York City. CFH operates multiple service delivery sites in four boroughs, including Article 28 licensed health centers that provide medical and behavioral health services that serve individuals experiencing homelessness throughout four NYC boroughs. CFH also operates two homeless women’s residences where health care services are provided.

**This employee will work as part of the PCMH team with the following essential duties and responsibilities:** 

* Provide clinical supervision for new disease / care management initiatives across the CFH system of care
* Supervision and evaluation of all health center nursing and medical assistant team members
* Implement changes to policies and procedures
* Supervision of vaccine stock maintenance
* Oversee timely locking of nursing charts
* Collaborate with Director of Nursing to educate staff on annual vaccination requirements for health care workers
* Day to day management of nursing responsibilities and quality management of emergency response equipment such as banyan box and AED
* Oversee medication stock and maintain site inventory including proper discarding of expired medication.
* Actively participates in the expansion of the telemedicine and virtual visit patient access model
* Collaborate with PCP in the disease management model addressing condition-specific patient education needs
* Be able to travel across multiple sites (Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, and Manhattan) as needed
* Be able to work weekends based on organizational need for staff coverage
* Oversee the highest standard of care for the service delivery of the following:
* Reach out and engage patients with respect to their health status, substance
* abuse and social service problems;
* Assess the physical and psychosocial needs of the patient;
* Take a complete history of individual and family members;
* Make referrals to primary care provider for chronic or episodic care;
* Administer immunizations, tuberculosis tests, monitor medication;
* Advise and educate clients about their physical and mental health, self-care, prevention
* strategies, and use of medical resources;
* Work in nontraditional environments, e.g., non-clinic settings.
* Participate in scheduling and coverage needs across the health center network
* Provide direct care to support clinical staff when patient cycles are backed up and/or clinical teams are short staffed
* Ensure proper documentation and administration of vaccines in accordance with VFC and AFC standards
* Collaborate with Director of Nursing to ensure that health centers have adequate amounts of medical supplies and oversee appropriate stock maintenance
* Oversee, supervise, and train all point of care testing (e.g. HIV, Hemoglobin A1C, pregnancy tests, and EKGs) and other onsite diagnostic procedures, ensuring proper documentation including billing
* Work collaboratively with case management and health education to effectively coordinate care as directed by the primary care medical staff
* Provide clinical education and supervision for medical assistant staff
* Maintain high standards of infection control and appropriate disposal of sharps and other hazardous materials
* Oversight of all quality logs such as refrigerators and freezers

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Master’s degree in clinical or human services field from an accredited professional school.
* Clinical Training (RN). Five years of direct patient/ client care
* Three years of supervisory/ management experience working in an ambulatory health care facility.
* 2-5 years in senior management /and field experience in the development and operation of a diversified, decentralized health care facility.
* Commitment to vulnerable and disadvantaged populations.
* Flexible for hours needed and able to work in a nontraditional setting (shelter).

title: SUPERVISOR DE EQUIPO (SOLO ESPAÑOL)
description:
Buscamos un representante de ventas altamente motivado y dinámico para unirse a nuestro equipo. Como representante de ventas , usted será responsable de impulsar las ventas y construir relaciones sólidas con los clientes. Esta es una excelente oportunidad para alguien que habla español con fluidez y tiene pasión por las ventas.

Responsabilidades:

- Comercializar y vender nuestros productos y servicios a clientes potenciales.

- Proporcionar un servicio de atención al cliente excepcional a clientes nuevos y existentes.

- Realizar presentaciones técnicas de ventas para demostrar las características y beneficios de nuestros productos.

- Analizar las necesidades del cliente y recomendar soluciones adecuadas.

- Desarrollar y mantener relaciones sólidas con cuentas clave.

- Identificar nuevas oportunidades de negocio y contribuir a los esfuerzos de desarrollo empresarial.

- Colaborar con el equipo de ventas para alcanzar los objetivos de ventas.

- Manténgase actualizado con las tendencias de la industria y los competidores.

Calificaciones:

- Fluido en español (verbal y escrito).

- Experiencia comprobada en ventas, preferiblemente en ventas directas.

- Fuertes habilidades de negociación y persuasión.

- Excelente comunicación y habilidades interpersonales.

- Capacidad para analizar las necesidades del cliente y ofrecer soluciones personalizadas.

- Automotivado y con fuerte deseo de obtener resultados.

- Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.

- Licencia de conducir válida o pasaporte

Ofrecemos una compensación competitiva, que incluye un salario base más comisión, así como beneficios como seguro de viajes, planes de jubilación y tiempo libre remunerado. Si es una persona motivada, apasionada por las ventas y con la capacidad de comunicarse eficazmente en español, nos encantaría saber de usted.

Nota: Esta descripción del trabajo no pretende ser exhaustiva. El empleado puede realizar otras tareas relacionadas según lo negociado para satisfacer las necesidades continuas de la organización.

title: Manager, PR & Influencer Marketing
description:
**Company Description** **Who We Are:**


MAKE UP FOR EVER is a collective of makeup artists co-creating high-performance products and services. Through our artistry we inspire and empower people to unleash their personal edge. Since its inception in 1984, MAKE UP FOR EVER has been collaborating with professional makeup artists to stay at the cutting-edge of technological and artistic advances, while offering everyone access to all products and benefits. At MAKE UP FOR EVER, we are a team, we are your team, and everyone is welcome.

 **Job Description** **MAKE UP FOR EVER** is looking for a dynamic and creative **Manager, PR & Influencer Marketing**, based in the **New York Office** and reporting to the **Director, Communications**. The ideal candidate will be passionate about the beauty industry and will have a keen understanding of how public relations, brand activations, and influencer partnerships can elevate brand presence and drive market success. This role requires an individual who can seamlessly integrate influencer marketing strategies with broader marketing campaigns, handle product launches, and cultivate relationships with media and influencers within the beauty sector.

 **Qualifications** **What You’ll Do:**

* Leading all aspects of day-to-day communication and projects with PR agency to ensure brand is building impactful editor relationships and enhancing press opportunities for the brand through creative pitching, engaging editor events, and coordinating interviews with key executives and makeup artists
* Responsible for coordinating event execution and logistics including but not limited to, coordinating with vendors, product inventory, handling timelines, material organization, and set up/break down
* Coordinate creation of press materials including copy for press releases, educational collateral, and product mailers timed with PR calendar
* Responsible for leading all beauty awards submissions, product needs, deadlines, etc. with PR partners
* Prepare accurate materials in response to the product marketing team’s requests, including product forecasts, launch feedback, etc.
* Responsible for fulfilling all influencer, pro makeup artist, and media product requests detailed and efficiently
* Main point of contact for all influencers, makeup artists, and press; maintaining and championing relationships to elevate brand
* Develop and execute innovative PR strategies that align with the company’s brand vision and marketing objectives.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to orchestrate effective campaigns for product launches, promotions, events, and other brand initiatives
* Track emerging trends in makeup application techniques, products, digital media consumption patterns, influencer engagement strategies, etc., to keep MAKE UP FOR EVER at the forefront of the industry
* Measure campaign performance using KPIs such as reach, engagement rate, conversion rate; provide regular reports on ROI to senior management
* Collaborate with the Creative team and handle creative briefs for all collateral and digital needs
* Share key strategies and relevant updates with Global team on a regular basis
* Address public relations issues swiftly in coordination with legal or upper management if necessary.
* Track and run department budget
* Manage Communications Coordinator and team intern

 **Who You Are:**

* Minimum of 5 years experience in PR or influencer marketing role preferably within the cosmetics or fashion industry.
* High level of organization skills; able to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
* Willingness to self-start and take ownership of daily tasks with readiness and a positive attitude
* Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams as well as independently on projects/tasks without close supervision
* Creative thinker who can brainstorm innovative ideas for engaging content across different channels
* Demonstrated ability to develop strategic partnerships that have proven ROI impact.
* Strong existing relationships with beauty influencers/media is highly desirable.
* Proficient in social media analytics tools (Tribe Dynamics and MS Office applications
* Strong written and verbal communications skills
* Strong and effective in building and presenting strategy decks
* Highly engaged in industry news and media landscape
* Team managerial experience preferred

  

**Additional Information** **What We Offer:**

* Hybrid work environment
* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance Plans
* 401 (k) match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee discount + make-up allowance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Pet Insurance
* Commuter Benefits
* Work from Home equipment stipend
* Salary Range: $ 90,000 - $100,000 per year
* Competitive annual bonus potential
* Growth & development within the LVMH group

  

MAKE UP FOR EVER, LLC uses the published salary range as a guideline to provide our employees with market competitive pay while allowing for flexibility to recognize and reward various levels of experience, performance, and tenure. The bottom third of the salary range is the targeted pay level for employees developing in their role. The middle third of the salary range is the targeted pay level for employees with significant tenure in their role and are strong performers. The upper third of the salary range is the targeted pay level for employees with significant tenure in their role and are consistently high performers. While the published salary is a good faith reflection of the targeted salary level for the position, MAKE UP FOR EVER, LLC reserves the right to pay outside of the published salary range.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Furniture Retail Sales Associate
description:
Modani Furniture is looking for the "right" people to join our team. We value people who are driven, determined and who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart and creative. Those who have goals and a desire to grow and develop professionally. This is the opportunity for the "right" person to join a growing, dynamic home furnishings company who values its people and their success.

Our Sales Associates play an integral role in the design process and assessing the needs of the walk-in customer. They work in collaboration and in partnership with our showroom's clientele to ensure the design needs are not only met but also exceeded. We use the title Sales Associate and Design Consultant interchangeably to describe this role because both are vital components. They exhibit an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for building and maintaining relationships.

This is a full-time position in a fast-paced retail environment requiring multi-tasking, organization, exceptional sales skills, as well as a passion for helping people design the spaces in which they live.

Knowledge of interior design and space planning is not required. However, it is essential for your success in our showroom. Modani Furniture is a rapidly expanding retail company offering affordable modern home furnishings. Our vision at Modani is to become much more than just a furniture store.We want to help people realize our vision of a modern lifestyle of high design at an affordable price point.

FURNITURE RETAIL SALES ASSOCIATE RESPONSIBILITIES ARE (BUT NOT LIMITED TO)

-Provide excellent customer service, grow and build a strong client base.  
-Offer your design opinion as well as educate the customer on our products and offerings.  
-Suggestive sell and cross-promote our products and promotions.  
-Network and foster relationships with design and trade professionals.  
-Own all phases of the design and sales process from initial contact through delivery.  
-Stay up to date on interior design trends and our product releases.  
-Keep the showroom visually maintained to the company standard.  
-Provide product knowledge and expertise.  
-Represent our brand with a modern image with professionalism.  
-Ensure you meet and exceed sale goals

-Have a positive can-do attitude every day.

title: Communication Consultant
description:
Sr. Communication Consultant
Who we are
Corebridge Financial helps people make some of the most meaningful decisions they’re ever going to make. We help them plan and take action to protect the future they envision, and respond to some of life’s most difficult moments through the solutions and services we provide. We do this through our broad portfolio of life insurance, retirement and institutional products, offered through an extensive, multichannel distribution network. We provide solutions for a brighter future through our client centered service, breadth of product expertise, deep distribution relationships, and outstanding team of hardworking and passionate employees.
Get to know the business
Life and Retirement is a unique franchise that brings together a broad portfolio of life insurance, retirement and institutional products offered through an extensive, multichannel distribution network. It holds longstanding, leading market positions in many of the markets it serves in the U.S.
Overview of Position
As a Senior Communication Consultant you will be responsible for providing communication-consulting services to Corebridge strategic clients. In this client-facing role, you will work closely with members of the Relationship Management and Marketing Strategy teams to deliver best-in-class participant communication and education programs designed to meet our client’s retirement plan goals and objectives.
Preferred locations are Houston, Texas; Woodland Hills, CA and Jersey City, NJ.
This position can be offered fully remote for the right candidate.
Responsibilities* Provide subject matter expertise on the participant experience across platforms and services
* Provide support and development expertise for strategic streamlined initiatives such as financial wellness and financial literacy
* Provide strong project management to manage projects “end-to-end” by managing all resources to ensure the deadlines and client deliverables are met
* Coordinate team resources within Marketing Strategy and other internal and external partners to deliver on all aspects of an integrated communication and education plan for client relationships
* Analyze plan and participant data to understand behavior and educational needs to propose best practice solutions and/or custom solutions
* Understand plan-specific materials to develop knowledge of each client’s plan provisions and educate business partners as appropriate
* Engage in emerging trends in communications to remain competitive while meeting our client’s needs.


What you need to know* BA/BS required
* 5+ years’ experience in employee benefits communications and/or financial services communications strongly preferred
* 5+ years’ marketing strategy and/or relationship marketing experience preferred
* Ability to manage long-term strategic communications projects, as well as quick turn-around assignments
* Ability to analyze data and business strategies to develop communications plans and programs to meet customer needs
* High-level verbal and written communications skills necessary to consult on communication planning with all management levels and to direct development of marketing materials with project team
* Ability to work multiple projects with tight deadlines in a fast-paced, changing environment  

Must have the ability to deliver engaging and effective presentations which demonstrate and differentiate Corebridge communication and education capabilities
* Demonstrated ability in financial services/retirement services marketing
* Operate well in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision required
* Ability to articulate complex situations simply and in an engaging style
* Outstanding project management skills and ability to deliver projects on schedule
* Advanced interpersonal skills, including conflict resolution, relationship building and negotiation
* Travel: up to 25%


What our employees like most about working for Corebridge Financial Life & Retirement* We care about your professional development. Our career progression program will provide you with the opportunity to develop your skills, strengthen your productivity and be eligible to progressively advance to positions with an increased responsibility and increased compensation.
* Our “Giving Back” policy is at the core of our daily operations and guides our future progress. Don’t believe us? We put our money where our mouth is! Corebridge Financial will give you up to 16 hours a year paid time off to volunteer in the community.
* Our people are our most important asset therefore we provide a generous benefits plan and competitive pay.


Benefit package includes* Paid Time Off Corebridge Financial recognizes the importance of work life balance). We offer 24 PTO days to start. YES, 24!
* 17 paid holidays per calendar year.
* A 401(k) Retirement Plan which will be HARD TO BEAT. Our 401K - $1 for $1 match up to 6% with immediate vesting, plus Corebridge Financial automatically contributes an additional 3% into your 401K regardless of if you enroll or not.


For positions based in New Jersey or California the base salary range is $110,000-$130,000 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. In addition, we’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
Corebridge Financial, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates are committed to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and its policies and procedures reflect this commitment. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories such as sexual orientation. At Corebridge Financial, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.
To learn more please visit: www.corebridgefinancial.com
Corebridge Financial is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with physical or mental disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to complete any part of the application or hiring process, please send an email to TalentandInclusion@corebridgefinancial.com. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
**Basic Functions:**

In the IT Support Specialist role, you are expected to provide routine guidance for users of the IT system and components via phone, email and computer chat or in-person. You will maintain a deep understanding of IT concepts and stay updated with the latest tech trends. Success in this role will be demonstrated by the quick resolution of trouble tickets, avoiding downtime, and enhancing IT operations. You will ask appropriate questions and use knowledge and resources to diagnose and resolve issues.

**Essential Functions:**

The following functions of the job include, but are not limited to:

* Receives and processes user tickets requests regarding hardware, software and networking issues
* Resolves computer problems and system errors
* Sets up and configures new computer and internet equipment
* Performs routine inspection of equipment
* Updates computer software and operating systems
* Guides and assists in computer-related concerns, remotely or physically.
* Conducts remote troubleshooting; testing alternative pathways until issue is resolved
* Customizes desktop applications to meet user needs
* Records technical issues and solutions in logs
* Directs unresolved issues to the next level of support personnel
* Follow up with clients to ensure system functionality
* Reports customer feedback and potential product requests and suggestions
* Assists in creation of technical documentation and user manuals

**Employee Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
* Prior experience in desktop support technician or similar role preferred
* Proficient in MS Office 365 Suite and IT-related applications with Windows and light Mac OS environments
* Experience with Digitech Systems software products and knowledge of production scanning equipment (Canon, Kodak) preferred.
* Proficiency in Active Directory infrastructure management.
* Working knowledge of office automation products and computer peripherals, such printers and scanners
* Comfortable with hardware troubleshooting, and disassembly when needed.
* Knowledge of network security practices and anti-virus programs
* Effective time-management skills
* Careful, precise, thorough work ethic with high personal integrity
* Exceptional customer service, Interpersonal abilities, and coordination skills.
* Ability to work with a diverse population while maintaining an inclusive mindset
* Excellent problem-solving and multitasking skills

title: R-045848 Residential Sales Specialist
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**\\*Position Overview**\\*Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores or industries. Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests. Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts. Assists in the collection of payments and scheduling of services.

**\\*Job Responsibilities**\\*

* Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores, or industry.
* Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests.
* Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts.
* Covers sales leads in assigned territory and develops sales leads creatively for each lead furnished.
* Records accurate measurements and writes correct descriptions of property inspected.
* Prepares appropriate specifications and treating instructions in accordance with existing laws, regulations and company policy.
* Computes job-treating cost from company pricing instructions.
* Executes contracts on behalf of the company, observing company policy as to credit terms of sale.
* Manages collection effort on delinquent accounts of personal sales contracts.
* Advises customers about other products and services.
* Deals courteously with customers, leaving customer’s premises and furnishings clean and as found.
* Contacts customers after service is performed to ensure customer satisfaction and to develop additional prospects.
* Reports unusual requests from customers or questions not immediately answerable to direct supervisor.
* Maintains prospect files, call-back files and activity records.
* Maintains equipment, vehicle and personal safety equipment in clean, working order.
* Examines architectural drawings and specifications; prepares estimates for soil pre- treatment bids.
* Completes appropriate training courses as assigned.
* Aware of location and telephone number of local poison control centers.

**\\*Job Requirements**\\*

* High school diploma or general education diploma (GED) required
* Bachelor's Degree or an equivalent combination of college and experience preferred
* 2 years related experience and/or training in sales and dealing with the public; or equivalent combination of training and experience preferred Maintains knowledge of pests and chemicals used in treatment
* Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos
* Ability to write correspondence
* Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
* Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs
* Skill in creating sales leads and cross-selling company products and services
* Maintains appearance of uniform as directed by company policy
* Maintains relevant licenses as required by federal, state or local regulations for termite/pest control and any other business unit products and services
* Maintains a valid driver’s license

**\\*Physical Demands and Working Conditions**\\*The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
**Incumbent must be prepared to:**

* Move up to 10 pounds occasionally, by lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.
* Sitting for long periods of time while using office equipment such as computers, phones and etc.
* Fingering and Repetitive motions; such as movement of wrists, hands and fingers while picking, pinching and typing during your normal working environment.
* Express or exchange ideas with others through the use of spoken word, quickly, accurately, and at an easily audible volume, and receive detailed information through oral communication at usual speaking levels without correction, and/or make fine discriminations in the nature of sounds in the environment.

**Incumbent is required to have:** 

* Close visual acuity to perform detail oriented activities at distances close to the eyes, as well as visual acuity to perform activities at or within arm’s reach with skill, control, and accuracy, such as preparing and analyzing data, viewing computer screen and expansive reading.

**Incumbent will be subject to:**

* Inside working conditions: The change of building environment such as with or without air conditioning and heating.

Responsabilidades:

- Comercializar y vender nuestros productos y servicios a clientes potenciales.

- Proporcionar un servicio de atención al cliente excepcional a clientes nuevos y existentes.

- Realizar presentaciones técnicas de ventas para demostrar las características y beneficios de nuestros productos.

- Analizar las necesidades del cliente y recomendar soluciones adecuadas.

- Desarrollar y mantener relaciones sólidas con cuentas clave.

- Identificar nuevas oportunidades de negocio y contribuir a los esfuerzos de desarrollo empresarial.

- Colaborar con el equipo de ventas para alcanzar los objetivos de ventas.

- Manténgase actualizado con las tendencias de la industria y los competidores.

Calificaciones:

- Fluido en español (verbal y escrito).

- Experiencia comprobada en ventas, preferiblemente en ventas directas.

- Fuertes habilidades de negociación y persuasión.

- Excelente comunicación y habilidades interpersonales.

- Capacidad para analizar las necesidades del cliente y ofrecer soluciones personalizadas.

- Automotivado y con fuerte deseo de obtener resultados.

- Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.

- Licencia de conducir válida o pasaporte

Ofrecemos una compensación competitiva, que incluye un salario base más comisión, así como beneficios como seguro de viajes, planes de jubilación y tiempo libre remunerado. Si es una persona motivada, apasionada por las ventas y con la capacidad de comunicarse eficazmente en español, nos encantaría saber de usted.

Nota: Esta descripción del trabajo no pretende ser exhaustiva. El empleado puede realizar otras tareas relacionadas según lo negociado para satisfacer las necesidades continuas de la organización.

title: Nurse Practitioner - Per Diem / Part time
description:
We are looking for a professional per diem Nurse Practitioner who can deliver excellent medical care to a wide variety of patients. The Nurse Practitioner will be responsible for caring for patients and maintaining accurate and current patient records. The successful candidate will work as a team with our Physical Therapists, Chiropractors, Massage therapists, and Acupuncturists and will assist in delivering exceptional collaborative health care to each and every patient.  

  

***\\*\\*Please note, this position may require travel to our other location from Smithtown to Westhampton.\\*\\****  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**  

  

* Evaluates patients, documenting pertinent positive and negative findings.
* Diagnoses and treats disease and manages chronic illness.
* Orders appropriate laboratory and special examinations or tests; interprets results.
* Provides preventative health services, including health education and counseling.
* Collaborates with other clinicians and staff members to ensure continuity of care for patients.

**Qualifications**  

  

* Experienced Nurse Practitioner required
* Must possess strong communication skills, both oral and written.
* Comfortable with Electronic Medical Record (EMR) system and Microsoft Office
* Bachelor’s Degree required Master’s Degree preferred.
* Graduate of a Nurse Practitioner education program registered by the New York State Education Department.
* Certification as a Nurse Practitioner from a New York State approved accrediting body (ANCC) or be eligible for board certification.
* Current and unrestricted licensed Nurse Practitioner by the New York State Department of Education or be eligible for licensure.

title: Office Administrator / Community Liason
description:
**Title: District Office Administrator / Community Liaison**

The Office of New York State Senator Kevin Parker is seeking a District Office Administrator / Community Liaison to provide administrative support and ensure the efficient operation of the District Office. In addition to ensuring the office's fluid day-to-day operation, the Office Administrator/Community Liaison will represent the Senator at community meetings and events as assigned, and is expected to work extended hours and weekends as needed.

**Essential Job Functions** 

·Greet visitors and guests to ensure their visit to the office is meaningful.

·Attend evening / weekend office events and community meetings.

·Answer and direct phone calls; receive, sort and distribute office mail and correspondence.

·Coordinate the District Office schedule with the Albany Office to ensure continuity of the Senator’s schedule.

· Draft correspondence – letters, emails, memos.

· Manage and order office supplies.

· Mail letters, packages and other office correspondence.

· Schedule meetings and travel arrangements.

· Maintain office contact lists.

**Job Qualifications** 

·Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in a related field **OR** a 2+ years of administrative support or office operations experience.

·Great written and verbal communication skills and the ability to build sound professional relationships with community residents, community stakeholders and government agencies.

* Must be organized and can work in a demanding environment, both independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office products - Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
* Experience and demonstrated knowledge of community groups, organizations, and other interests that are likely to interact with the Senate office is a plus.
* Ability to communicate fluently in Creole/French is a plus.

This is a permanent, full-time, in-person position.

Compensation: $38,000 - $41,500 depending on experience + Comprehensive Benefits Package.

**Note: This job description is not intended to be a complete list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications, nor is it an implied or express contract between the New York State Senate and the potential employee.**

title: Agency - Documentation Control Clerk II
description:
**ABOUT ADVANCED ENERGY**

Advanced Energy (Nasdaq: AEIS) is a global leader in the design and manufacturing of highly engineered, precision power conversion, measurement and control solutions for mission-critical applications and processes. AE’s power solutions enable customer innovation in complex applications for a wide range of industries including semiconductor equipment, industrial, manufacturing, telecommunications, data center computing and healthcare. With engineering know-how and responsive service and support around the globe, the company builds collaborative partnerships to meet technology advances, propel growth for its customers and innovate the future of power. Advanced Energy has devoted four decades to perfecting power for its global customers and is headquartered in Denver, Colorado.

 **POSITION SUMMARY:**


This temporary position is responsible for data clean up and BOM restructuring for data transfer, processing documents and /or Engineering Change Orders (DCO / ECO) maintaining control over records that are part of the Quality System and ensuring document and record control procedures follow ISO.

  



**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Reviews data
* Performs data entry to restructure BOM’s
* Adheres to configuration control requirements, processes and procedures as well as perform ongoing configuration audits
* Works with other departments on continuous improvement of the Enterprise Change Order (ECO) process
* Plays a key role with the implementation and maintenance of Product Data Management (PDM)
* Maintains all departmental quality documentation and various configuration management software applications (e.g., iPro/SAP)
* Enforces Copy Exact policy and any other applicable policies
* Uses Configuration Management guidelines to coordinate the flow and completion of documentation associated with ECO’s and Deviations Reviews
* Coordinates with other departments in facilitating ECO’s and tracks to ensure that they are complete in a timely manner for all product changes
* Releases original issues of product data
* Releases parts and documents to production (in ERP system)
* Conducts verification on implemented ECO to ensure redline of intended change matches what was specified on the ECO request and/or obtains verification from engineers.
* Provide administrative support
* Other duties as assigned

 **WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

* Works in standard office environment and uses general office equipment (telephone, PC, copier- scanner – etc.)
* Overtime may be required

 **QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Excellent data entry skills
* Attention to detail
* Strong computer skills with the ability to adapt existing computer skill set to new computer programs
* Must display a high level of professionalism working with all levels of personnel
* Uses personal judgment with tact and diplomacy to resolve problems with limited instruction
* Ability to work well with minimal supervision
* Handles multiple priorities throughout the day
* Works well with interruptions
* Ability to effectively manage a workload in a stressful or system-critical environment
* Displays a team approach to responsibilities while balancing multiple tasks
* Ability to manage priorities and demonstrate a high level of initiative
* Knowledge of Copy Exact, ECO forms and documents (e.g., bill of material, ECR’s, engineering change notification)
* Experience with software programs including MS Office, ERP and Adobe Acrobat

 **EXPERIENCE:**

* Minimum of one year of experience in Document Control or related fields such as production planning, material control, records and information management
* Experience coordinating with different configuration control activities
* Experience in documentation and engineering drawing control, and distribution processes
* Experience with common office software applications: LAN and internal/external information network systems, including Internet and Intranet applications, ERP and Microsoft Office
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

 **EDUCATION:**

* High School diploma or GED

 **COMPENSATION:**

*As required by multiple state pay transparency laws, Advanced Energy provides a reasonable range of compensation for each job posting. Actual compensation is influenced by an array of factors including, but not limited to, skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. The range of starting pay for this role is $ to $ per year.*

 **BENEFITS:**


As part of our total rewards philosophy, we believe in offering and maintaining competitive compensation and benefits programs for our employees to attract and retain a talented, highly engaged workforce. Our compensation programs are focused on equitable, fair pay practices including market-based base pay, an annual pay-for-performance incentive plan, and discounted Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

  



In addition to our competitive compensation practices, we offer a strong benefits package in each of the countries in which we operate. In the U.S., we offer a rich benefits package that includes:

  

* Medical - 4 different health care plan options, dental, and vision
* Short and long-term disability and life insurance
* Health savings and flexible spending accounts
* Generous time off policy starting with 3 weeks of paid vacation, 7 days of paid sick time, and 12 paid holidays
* 8 hours of paid volunteer time off
* 8 weeks of paid parental leave for both Moms and Dads
* Company matched 401(k)
* Tuition reimbursement
* Expanded mental health coverage and employee assistance programs
* Other voluntary benefits include voluntary options such as critical illness, accident and hospital indemnity, pet insurance, identify theft, and legal assistance

 **Advanced Energy is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.**
company_description: Advanced Energy shapes and transforms how power is used, delivered, and managed.

description:

You will support doctors and patients through a variety of tasks related to patient care management, organization and communication. The target is to complete all activities accurately, with high quality and in a timely manner.

**Responsibilities**

* Interview patients and document basic medical history
* Organize and schedule appointments
* Update and file medical records and insurance reports
* Arrange hospital admissions and laboratory services
* Check with patients and type up patients charts
* Assist during medical examinations
* Produce and distribute correspondence memos, letters, faxes and forms
* Handle receivable and payable accounts and keep financial records
* Prepare and clean treatment rooms and medical instruments

**Skills**

* Proven working experience as a medical assistant or medical secretary
* Knowledge of medical office management systems and procedures
* Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritise work
* Social perceptiveness and service oriented
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong organisational and planning skills
* Proficiency in patient management software
* Degree in medical assistance

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: 40 – 50 per week

title: Assistant General Manager (AGM) / Manager in Training
description:
**Who Are We?**

LA Fitness is a privately owned fitness club chain. LA Fitness has hundreds of health clubs and millions of members across US and Canada. In an industry often equated with fad and fashion, LA Fitness has steadily increased its presence by focusing on the one lifelong benefit valued by everyone: good health.

**About Us**

Founded in Southern California in 1984, LA Fitness continues to seek innovative ways to enhance the physical and emotional well-being of our increasingly diverse membership base. With our wide range of amenities and highly trained staff, we provide fun and effective workout options to family members of all ages and interests.

Our mission is to help as many people as possible achieve the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. To fulfill this mission, we will create a nationwide network of sports clubs, offering our members the widest range of amenities and the friendliest service at an affordable price. To carry out this mission we are searching for standout candidates to grow within our organization who align with our vision. I am here to guide you to the path of success with the tools, skill set, talent and energy within the industry's leading organization. If you have a passion for fitness, enjoy helping others and are looking to improve your lifestyle, then you can be the perfect candidate in our district.

**Job Description:**

The Manager in Training (MIT) position is a leadership role responsible for the club's overall production and weekend success. This candidate will help a Senior General Manager ensure that the club meets or exceeds financial goals and trains and directs all club employees. This role is a temporary training position to prepare our future General Managers. The Senior General Manager will evaluate this candidate's growth on a weekly and monthly basis with the District Vice President, specifically on the leadership qualities one must possess in the position, performance, as well as the ability to adapt to our culture and business plan. Based on this candidate's influence and performance, one can expect to step into a General Manager role as soon as three months but no longer than 12 months. This is an appointed role for internal and external candidates with high potential. Once in the role, we will expect this candidate's continued support with company initiatives to help generate sales leads for continued membership growth as well as "running the play" without hesitation or alteration.

**Sales & Marketing**

* Lead, coach and develop the sales team
* Plan and execute offsite marketing and sales events, partnering with other local businesses
* Continuously monitor and drive the club's financial growth targets
* Set productivity goals to achieve weekly, monthly, yearly objectives
* Knowledge of standard office procedures and computer software.
* Ability to effectively multi-task with tight deadlines both independently and within a team environment.
* Achieve 50% or higher health club membership closing ratio.
* Generate sales reports and understand critical numbers to impact your business.
* Coach sales process daily with sales associates.

**Team Management**

* Manage and develop your club's Personal Training and Membership teams across sales, marketing, and member experience.
* Assist in recruitment and brand development
* Facilitate employee onboarding and training
* Evaluate employee performance and create improvement action plans
* Ability to identify and problem solve, set expectations, goals, and delegate tasks.
* Ability to effectively communicate expectations to staff and create a winning culture.
* Possess excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
* Demonstrate a positive attitude and ensure all departments are providing the highest level of customer service, cleanliness with our club pride practice and financial performance.

**Qualifications and Skills**

* Qualified candidates must have proven leadership ability in an educational, fitness or professional settings with 2 plus years of management experience in customer service or sales.
* Previous sales experience required
* Management experience required.
* Advertising, hospitality, or marketing experience preferred.
* Strong professional presentation, technical ability and relationship building.
* Excellent trainer and motivator.
* A passion for helping people and delivering a great customer experience
* A passion for fitness and health
* An excitement for sales and competitive spirit
* A player/coach leader who inspires and motivates through personal action
* The capability to lead effectively and create a welcoming, positive, and fun work environment
* An energetic and friendly problem solver
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* The ideal candidate will be passionate, knowledgeable, and have a personal commitment to health and wellness.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:**

* Salary
* Commissions
* Bonus opportunities
* Promotion/Growth opportunities within three months
* Evening and weekend hours are required.
* Position is full-time (This position requires 50 hours worked each week.)
* Complimentary membership
* Medical insurance after 90

If you find this unique opportunity interesting, apply!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

title: Interventional Radiology Nurse
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a compassionate and skilled Interventional Radiology Nurse to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will provide exceptional patient care in an outpatient setting, utilizing their knowledge of interventional radiology procedures and medical imaging techniques. This role is perfect for a dedicated nurse who is committed to delivering high-quality care and working collaboratively with other medical professionals.

Duties:  
- Assist with interventional radiology procedures, including ultrasound, fluoroscopy, and MRI  
- Prepare patients for procedures, including positioning and draping  
- Monitor patients during procedures and provide care as needed  
- Maintain accurate and detailed medical records  
- Collaborate with radiologists and other medical professionals to ensure seamless care  
- Participate in the development and implementation of care plans for patients  
- Provide education and support to patients and their families  
- Demonstrate a thorough understanding of medical imaging techniques and the interpretation of radiology results  
- Develop and maintain a strong understanding of hospital policies and procedures  
- Provide care for patients with a range of conditions, including those with hospice and palliative needs  
- Demonstrate a commitment to providing exceptional patient care, including care for patients with dementia and senior care needs  
- Maintain a sterile environment and adhere to sterile processing guidelines  
- Perform basic life support, including CPR and defibrillation  
- Utilize laboratory results to inform patient care  
- Maintain accurate and detailed medical documentation  
- Stay current with the latest developments in interventional radiology and medical imaging  
- Participate in ongoing education and training to expand knowledge and skills

Experience:  
- Experience in an ER or interventional radiology setting is highly preferred  
- Proven experience in medical imaging, including ultrasound, fluoroscopy, and MRI  
- A strong understanding of physiology and the ability to apply this knowledge to patient care  
- Experience working with patients with dementia and senior care needs  
- Experience with hospice and palliative medicine  
- A commitment to delivering high-quality patient care  
- The ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills  
- The ability to work collaboratively with other medical professionals  
- A willingness to learn and expand knowledge and skills.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $3,300.00 - $3,475.00 per week

Work Location: In person

title: R-050162 Account Executive
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**What do our Account Executives do?**  
Account Executives will join a results-oriented environment where they will proceed through a comprehensive training program to learn and understand our pest management services and products. They call on a full spectrum of market segments including hospitality, food & beverage processing, healthcare, and retail. This role enjoys an atmosphere of autonomy, travel, recognition, and rewards for achievement.

* Create new business opportunities through cold calling, prospecting, networking, leads, referrals, and cross-selling
* Craft territory development strategies that will result in exceeding sales targets
* Learn and maintain complete knowledge of Rentokil’s programs, protocols, pricing policies, and service offerings
* Build partnerships and collaborate effectively with internal departments to maximize growth opportunities and ensure the delivery of outstanding service solutions

**What do you need?**

* High school diploma or GED, college preferred
* Two years of experience in Business to Business sales
* Experience selling into multiple market segments
* Strong attention to detail and willingness to learn
* Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
* Excellent organization and time management skills
* Will be required to obtain any required industry licenses
* Must possess a valid driver’s license

#ZipSales

#CB  
#A1

Base pay range: $50000 - $55000 / year

In addition to the base pay, a Colleague working in this role who has completed training may be eligible to earn additional monetary compensation including overtime, incentive and/or commission pay. Total annual earning potential may vary based on performance, assigned routes and achieving Key Performance Indicators ("KPIs").

\\* 

**Why Choose Us?**

A career with the Rentokil family of companies can be a professional trajectory filled with opportunity. We pride ourselves on being a world-class team that rewards high performance, and we love to promote from within. We offer competitive pay and many of our roles offer performance incentives.

Below you'll find information about some of what we have to offer. All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits after they meet certain criteria.

Click here to read more about our Total Rewards Program which includes: 

**Professional and Personal Growth**

* Multiple avenues to grow your career

* Full-time colleagues are eligible to begin enrollment immediately upon hire with benefits starting on day 1

**Savings and Retirement**

* 401(k) retirement plan with company-matching contributions

**Work-Life Balance**

* Vacation days & sick days
* Company-paid holidays & floating holidays
* A company mindset that prioritizes health, safety, and flexibility

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you?

This company is a Drug Free workplace.

Rentokil is committed to complying with all Federal, State, and local laws related to the employment of qualified individuals with disabilities.

**Job Description:** We are seeking a highly skilled IT White Glove Support Specialist to provide top-tier technical support at our NYC office, where our senior executives are based. This role requires exceptional customer service skills, technical expertise, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

**Responsibilities:**

title: Afternoon Maintenance Site Lead (School)
description:
Company Overview:

Safety Facility Services is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

OUR VALUES:

Our company is comprised of a of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable; and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

We currently have an opportunity for a Cleaning Supervisor to join our team. This is a great opportunity for a customer focused individual to join a facilities management company, which can offer unrivalled opportunities for career progression. The primary component of this role is to supervise cleaning teams in performing cleaning duties and associated tasks. Work will be performed in accordance with the facility's maintenance requirements, and within the framework of existing schedules.

As a Cleaning Supervisor you will be responsible for:

The supervision of all cleaning staff focusing on their performance in terms of standards of cleanliness and their behavior whilst on duty

Ensuring that a first class cleaning service is delivered to all areas of the building

Reviewing work schedules

Ordering of cleaning materials

Monitoring of all cleaning activities

Ensuring all staff are aware of the Health and Safety policies and procedures

The Ideal Candidate

The successful candidate for this role will have:

Previous experience in a cleaning environment

Previous experience of managing a team

The ability to implement and adhere to standards and procedures

Health and Safety experience

Good interpersonal skills

Use of general cleaning equipment.

Requirements:

Approximately 2-3 years of experience in maintenance, housekeeping or custodial services

Floor tech/care experience (stripping, waxing and buffing)

MUST Speak English, Spanish is a plus

Ability to effectively communicate with the client and follow through with requests

1-2 YEAR MINIMUM OF LEAD and/or SUPERVISORY EXPERIENCE

We are looking for 2 Site Leads, 1 for 510 Waverly Ave and 1 for 2390 Pitkin Ave both in Brooklyn NY

Job Type:

Part-time

Schedule:

Monday - Friday

4:30PM - 10:30PM

Pay:

$22.00 per hour

Physical requirements include: walking and standing during the entire shift (often 4-8 hours), climbing stairs, kneeling to clean floors, pushing and pulling objects, lifting and moving objects (up to 50 lbs), repetitive bending and lifting, and repetitive arm movement
