title: Part-time Crew Member (Brooklyn)
description:
Since its inception in Fukuoka, Japan in 1960, ICHIRAN Ramen has focused on serving Classic Tonkotsu Ramen. With over 87 restaurants, ICHIRAN Ramen has made its American debut in October 2016 and has offered the same authentic and deliciously classic ramen in Brooklyn and Manhattan.

We are currently looking for people who can work part-time, start immediately and are excited to be a part of the great ICHIRAN team and enjoy working in our restaurant to serve our customers with an extraordinary dining experience.

***At the moment, we have part-time positions available for hiring. However, if you are interested in a full-time role, we recommend that you continue to check our job postings for updates as we may begin recruiting for full-time positions in the future.***

We have a Career Pathway Program where all eligible employees are evaluated periodically. Outstanding employees will have an opportunity to be promoted to a supervisory position and receive a merit-based wage increase based on their performance assessments.

\\*\\*We are a no tipping establishment.\\*\\*

**-Essential Job Duties-**

・Perform restaurant opening and closing tasks.

・Prepare high-quality food and drinks according to the company's standardized recipes and instructions in a timely manner.

・Ensure that food and drinks are prepared according to the orders received from the guests.

・Perform dish washing tasks such as sorting and rinsing dirty dishes, glass, tableware and other cooking utensils, placing them in racks to send them through the dish machine and stock them.

・Conduct stock inventory, check periodically and replenish items as needed.

・Maintain the kitchen and common areas clean and neat in accordance with the Health and Mental Hygiene and kitchen safety standards.

・Complete job checklist as needed.

・Greet our customers and explain Ichiran's concepts in a friendly manner.

・Take guest orders and accurately enter orders into the POS system.

・Serve menu items in an accurate and timely manner.

・Handle cash transactions with guests as a cashier.

・Clear and clean tables and seats and set up tables, paper napkins, utensils etc.

・Comply with sanitary practices for food handling and general cleanliness.

・Clean up Front of House and common areas and keep them neat at all times.

・Sell ICHIRAN's merchandise at the cash register.

※Other duties will be assigned as necessary for this position.

**-Job Requirements-**

・Able to work after 11PM

・Able to work on weekends and holidays

・At least 18 years old

・Must be legally authorized to work for any U.S. Employer

・Able to communicate in English

**-Benefits-**

・Medical Health Insurance (staff who meet the company's medical insurance eligibility terms)

・401K

・Commuter Benefits (staff who work average 30 or more hours weekly only)

・Employee Meal

・Holiday Incentive

・Length of Service Award

・Referral Program

Due to the high volume of resumes we receive daily, we regret that we will only contact applicants who are actively being considered for an interview. Applicants will not be contacted otherwise.

We truly appreciate your interest in ICHIRAN.

title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching
* Bonus based on performance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
  

  

  

Primary/urgent care practice seeks full-time Nurse Practitioner with 3-5 years' experience to work in our offices in Hunterdon County New Jersey.  

  

The Doctor Is In is a combined family practice and urgent care practice open extended hours seven days a week. Our providers see walk-in patients with minor emergencies as well as family and occupational medicine patients. No two days are ever alike.  

  

What distinguishes us from most other urgent care centers is that we are not corporate nor are we hospital owned. We are one of the few remaining independent practices that provides a collegial environment without bureaucracy. Our practice design allows our clinicians to practice more independently, offers the opportunity to continue to learn and expand their capabilities, and encourages them to develop their own patient following.  

  

NextGen EHR experience and Spanish speaking a plus.  

  

We offer an excellent clinical experience, flexibility in scheduling, and a salary and bonus plan commensurate with experience along with comprehensive benefits including malpractice, health insurance, vacation and 401K with employer matching.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
Job Overview:

We are seeking a friendly and organized Host/Host to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional guest relations, ensuring a seamless dining experience, and supporting the operations of our restaurant. This role is an essential part of our hospitality team and requires a warm and welcoming demeanor.

Responsibilities:

- Manage seating arrangements, taking into account guest preferences and special requests.  
- Handle reservations, to-go orders, and other requests with a high level of accuracy and efficiency.  
- Operate the Aloha POS system to efficiently manage orders and table assignments.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, responding promptly to guest inquiries and addressing any concerns.

- Collaborate with the kitchen and servers to ensure timely delivery of food and beverages.  
- Assist with maintaining a welcoming atmosphere, including lighting and music.  
- Provide help to guests who may need additional assistance, such as navigating the restaurant.  
- Demonstrate excellent guest relations skills, ensuring that every guest leaves feeling valued and satisfied.  
- Communicate effectively with the restaurant team to ensure seamless operations.

- Proficiency with the Aloha POS system.  
- Experience in the hospitality industry, preferably in a restaurant or hotel setting.  
- Strong customer service skills and ability to communicate effectively with guests.  
- Ability to provide help and support to guests and team members.  
- Familiarity with food service and restaurant operations.  
- Experience with guest relations and providing a welcoming atmosphere.  
- Basic knowledge of hospitality and the importance of providing exceptional customer service.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

title: House Calls Nurse Practitioner
description:
Are you looking for a career that offers personal and professional growth, flexibility, and a supportive environment? Look no further! AG Care is an innovative organization committed to investing in our employees and providing the very best care to our patients.

At AG Group our mission is to serve our community with the highest compassionate and innovative care! We are committed to building a Team of dedicated, caring, and responsible professionals, who prioritize patients’ well-being and exceptional care services. It is essential that our team members embrace and promote this mission every day in every way possible. Our House Call Nurse Practitioner is a crucial part of our mission with their primary responsibilities being to provide optimal care to patients, handle patient appointments and perform routine examinations to ensure patient health. The Nurse Practitioner will work under the supervision of the Physician and consult with Physicians when necessary.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform comprehensive physical examinations of patients.
* Communicate with patients and ask about their health for diagnosis.
* Review and maintain patients’ medical histories and records, and record patients’ progress.
* Identify changes in the patient’s symptoms and intervene in emergency situations.
* Administer medications, draw blood, and give vaccinations following appropriate guidelines.
* Monitor temperature, pulse, breathing, and blood pressure and keep accurate records.
* Participate in other treatments for patients, including cleaning and badging wounds and splinting broken bones
* Monitor and provide routine checkups for patients.
* Work with other healthcare providers to establish treatment plans for children with chronic or acute conditions.
* Orders and interprets diagnostic and therapeutic tests relative to the patient’s age-specific needs.
* Diagnose and treat acute, episodic, and/or chronic illnesses
* Prescribe all necessary medications and treatments
* Facilitate referrals to other healthcare professionals and medical facilities
* Communicate with collaborating physician or specialist regarding patient care
* Research the latest treatments, innovations, advances, and trends in the medical industry.
* Educate and counsel patients and their families.
* Prescribes appropriate pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic treatment modalities
* Assists with the provision of surgical care in accordance with facility, state, and federal regulations.
* Facilitates the patient’s transition within and between health care settings, e.g., admitting, transferring, and discharging patients.
* Collaborates with multidisciplinary team members by making appropriate referrals.
* Facilitates staff, patient and family decision making by providing educational tools.
* Other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of NP experience in Urgent Care, Emergency Room or Primary Care is preferred, but not a must
* Requires bachelor and master’s degrees from an accredited Nurse Practitioner program
* Current New York State professional license: board certification by the NCCPA and BLS certification, required.
* Ability to build rapport with patients
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong leadership qualities

**Why pick AG Care for your next career move?**

We offer:

* Free Access to Company Services
* Growth and Advancement Opportunities
* Flexible Work Arrangements
* An Energetic and Growing Organization
* Development and Training
* Paid Time Off and Bonuses
* Education Discounts
* Excellent Leadership Who Will Place a Priority on Your Well-Being

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $124,800.00 - $166,400.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee assistance program
* Malpractice insurance
* Paid time off

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Job Overview**  
The Human Resources Manager works under the direction of the Director of Human Resources. Position incumbent works collaboratively with all corporate office staff and the staff at the practices to ensure that recruitment needs are met. HR Manager manages and leads the recruitment process and assists in utilization of various Human Resource programs.

**Position Requirements**

1. MBA in Human Resources or related field.

2. Minimum 3-6 years of Human Resources and Recruitment experience

3. Excellent communication skills.

4. Knowledge of HR systems and databases

5. Excellent time management and organization skills; ability to prioritize own workload and multitask effectively and independently.

6. SHRM certification is a MUST.

7. In-depth knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.

8. People oriented and results drive

**Duties & Responsibilities**

1. Directly supervises Human Resources Team.

2. Develops, recommends and implements personnel policies and procedures.

3. Prepares and maintains employee handbook.

4. Administers benefits programs including new employee benefit enrollment, open enrollment procedures and COBRA administration.

5. Develops and maintains affirmative action programs to conform to EEO regulations.

6. Manages full life-cycle recruitment processes for all staff level employees including: Dental Assistants, Dental Hygienists and Patient Care Coordinators. May assist with other recruitment efforts from time to time.

7. Ensures compliance with all federal, state and local employment laws.

8. Drafts directives advising Office Management of company policy updates.

9. Assist Office Management with new employee orientation.

10. Keeps records of benefit plan participation, personnel transactions, performance reviews and paid time off.

11. Coordinate Office Manager training in interviewing, hiring, termination, promotions, performance reviews, safety and sexual harassment.

12. Assists in the preparation of disciplinary action documentation and conducts exit interviews for terminated employees.

13. Analyzes, prepares and inputs payroll data.

14. Assist in credentialing process for new providers.

15. Develop and maintain employees’ LMS system.

16. Support current and future business needs through the development of engagement, motivation and preservation of human capital.

17. Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance

18. Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances or other issues

19. Report to Executive Team and/or Board and provide decision support through HR metrics.

**SUPERVISION & MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY**  
Reports to Director Human Resources with a dotted line to the Chief Operating Officer.

**EVALUATIONS:**

Conducted annually by Director Human Resources and/or Chief Operating Officer.

This position description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job related instructions requested by their supervisor.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

License/Certification:

* SHRM Certified Professional (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Suffern, NY 10901 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Suffern, NY 10901: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Content Producer
description:
**Job Title: Content Producer / Social Media Manager**

**About Us:** Sellery, Inc. is a dynamic and rapidly growing livestreaming company at the forefront of the TikTok livestream selling market. As an official top-ranked shopping partner with TikTok and a leading TSP, we provide top US fashion and beauty brands with innovative livestreaming and video solutions. Our international team is passionate about e-commerce and digital media. We are committed to empowering brands to excel on TikTok and other social media platforms.

**Job Summary:** We are seeking a talented Content Manager / Social Media Manager to take charge of our TikTok account content direction, leveraging platform trends and social media strategies to drive brand growth. This full-time role involves creating engaging videos for fashion, beauty, and e-commerce brands, managing content strategies, and helping increase follower engagement and brand visibility.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Content Strategy and Management:**

* Develop and implement content strategies for TikTok and other social media platforms, focusing on brand growth and engagement.
* Oversee the direction and quality of content for brand accounts, ensuring alignment with current trends and platform best practices.

**2. Trend Analysis and Platform Expertise:**

* Stay up-to-date with TikTok trends, platform updates, and emerging social media trends to inform content creation and strategy.
* Analyze performance metrics and trends to refine content strategies and maximize audience engagement.

**3. Video Production and Content Creation:**

* Create and manage the production of high-quality videos tailored to fashion, beauty, and e-commerce brands.
* Collaborate with creative teams to produce visually appealing and engaging content that aligns with brand messaging and objectives.

**4. Brand Growth and Audience Engagement:**

* Develop strategies to increase follower count, engagement rates, and overall brand visibility on TikTok.
* Implement tactics to drive user interaction, boost engagement, and foster a strong online community.

**5. Social Media Management:**

* Manage and oversee social media accounts, including content scheduling, community management, and interaction with followers.
* Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and feedback in a timely and professional manner.

**6. Collaboration and Coordination:**

* Work closely with brands, creative teams, and marketing departments to ensure content aligns with brand goals and campaign objectives.
* Coordinate with influencers and partners to amplify content reach and engagement.

**7. Reporting and Analytics:**

* Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of content strategies and campaigns.
* Prepare and present regular reports on content performance, audience growth, and engagement metrics.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* 2 to 5 years of experience in content management, social media management, or digital marketing, with a strong focus on TikTok and social media platforms.
* Proven track record of creating engaging content and managing successful social media campaigns.
* Familiarity with TikTok trends, content creation best practices, and social media analytics tools.
* Experience in fashion, beauty, or e-commerce social media production is highly desirable.
* Strong creative skills with the ability to produce visually compelling videos and content.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and project management skills.

**Job Type**: Full-time

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Health insurance.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.

How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their resume and a portfolio of relevant work to premawang@sellery.live

Equal Opportunity Employer: Sellery, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

title: Incident Management Investigator Specialist - OPWDD
description:
FlexStaff is seeking an **Incident Management Investigator Specialist** to join our **client's** team, a leading organization that provides housing, services and programs for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

**This is a full-time, permanent, direct hire position based in Manhattan.** 

*Must be able to travel throughout the five boroughs of NYC*

Hours are **9-5pm (37.5 work week)** this is a non-exempt position

In this role, you will assist the Incident Management Investigator with conducting investigations into situations, which may violate a person’s rights and/or protections in accordance with OPWDD and Justice Center regulations.

**RESPONSIBILITES**

* Assists the Incident Management Investigator with conducting investigations into situations that may violate the rights and/or protection of people receiving services. These situations include all categories and classifications as defined by the Justice Center PPSNA (Protection of People with Special Needs Act) and OPWDD Part 624 Regulations: Reportable Abuse/Neglect, Reportable Significant, Serious Notable Occurrence, and/or 624/625 situations.
* Requests documentary evidence timely and conducts timely follow-up until documentary evidence is received within regulatory timeframes.
* Performs administrative duties as related to the assigned investigation, specifically filing investigative documents and documentation requests and completing OPWDD 149 drafts as assigned.
* Ensure investigations are timely, thorough, and address investigatory issues, as well as identify best practices in accordance with agency policies and regulatory standards.
* Ensures investigative documents are obtained in a timely manner to ensure compliance with regulatory deadlines, including tracking requests, responses, and reporting any difficulties/obstacles to obtaining documents to the Administrator of Investigations for immediate action.
* Participate in regular supervision with the Administrator of Investigations and provides investigative updates, including written notification and follow-up reports, as needed for administrative action. Prepares investigative reports and forwards completed reports to the Administrator of Investigations within required timeframes.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* BA/BS in related Human Services Field or licensure in medically related field required.
* Typing and computer proficiency, specifically experience working with Microsoft Outlook, One Drive, SharePoint, and Teams.
* Completed the approved Justice Center investigative training course
* Experience working within OPWDD programs preferred.
* Some knowledge of state regulations governing incident reporting (14 NYCCR Part 624 and 625, Article 20 of the Executive Law and Article 11
* of the Social Services Law), Protection of Individual in Programs certified by OPWDD (Part 633 regulations), and the Justice Center PPSNA (Protection of People with Special Needs Act).
* Able to review, process, and analyze evidence
* Able to multitask, prioritize, meet deadlines, and adapt to changes at any given time.
* Must have flexible hours and ability to work remotely and on site as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $26.50 per hour

Expected hours: 37.5 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10006: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Fitness Coach
description:
**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun.**  

  

If you’re reading this, you’re probably a committed fitness professional who wants to inspire others to work hard to be the best they can be. You know how to motivate to get that one more Burpee, and know when to hold back to be sure workouts are safe and effective.  

  

If that sounds like you, then keep reading because OTF is looking for Fitness Coaches to lead our coach-inspired, science-backed backed, and technology-tracked workouts.  

  

**We Offer**  

* We provide substantial paid training, certifications, and support to ensure your success
* Compensation includes competitive base pay, commission, and performance bonuses
* Free Studio Membership
* Product discounts
* Flexible schedule that works around educational or personal goals
* Fitness casual dress-code
* Passionate, collaborative work environment
* The opportunity to learn every aspect of the business to eventually become a Franchisee or Business Owner if desired

**Position Overview**  

We are looking for coaches who can make our members feel welcome, and that they’re an integral part of the hour you spend together. Coaches whose positive energy stays with a member long after they’ve left the studio, and they find themselves counting the hours till their next workout.  

Well, now’s your chance to join Orangetheory and start leading the best 1-hour full-body group workout.  

  

**As a Fitness Coach you can expect to perform the following duties:**  

* Leading and motivating members through pre-defined workouts
* Helping members set and achieve goals
* Making sure members are using correct form and offering corrections if they aren’t
* Understanding the science behind our workouts specifically, heart-rate focused training programs in general, and being aware of what the competition is doing
* Knowing how to use and demonstrate usage for every piece of equipment utilized in every workout
* Being a team player

**Additionally, you’ll need to meet these requirements:**  

* Being AED/CPR certified
* Hold and maintain a current fitness certification from an education company approved by Orangetheory Fitness

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between Orangetheory studio locations and more details can be provided by the studio’s hiring manager if you are selected to move forward in the interview process.

title: General Manager Full Time-GMB-203110
description:
**POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARY**



Oversees, directs and manages property operations of a single property to assure optimum performance and continual improvement in the Key Performance Indicators (GREAT, REACH, DANCE, DRIVE, FRESH, Making it Right, Stop the Leaks and Safewatch). Coordinates, directs and manages the staff and everyday hotel operations to achieve profitability, guest satisfaction and efficiency while maintaining standards set by the company assuring 100% guest satisfaction.



Watch **A Day in the Life** video for a General Manager https://vimeo.com/showcase/5180017/video/265597879



M**AJOR / KEY JOB DUTIES**





Ensure associates at the property are driving the Company initiatives (GREAT, REACH, DANCE, DRIVE, FRESH, Making it Right and Stop the Leaks)



Demonstrates and promotes a 100% commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and employees



Responsible for maximizing revenues and flow through to GOP to meet or exceed budgeted EBITDA



Manage labor standards and property level expenses to achieve maximum flow-through to the bottom line profit



Monitors collection of in-house guest balances and direct bill receivables, commission payments by vendors, and issuance of refund checks



Participates and monitors monthly inventory of supplies and equipment. Ensures purchases made are within budget and by approved vendors



Works with the District Manager and Regional Director of Field Sales to manage all sales activities of the property and meet revenue objectives. Activities include setting goals, completing competitive surveys, taking reservations and compiling reports



Identifies and seeks out potential business in local market. Maintains relationships with local companies and key people to increase the company's visibility within the local market



Promotes 100% guest satisfaction throughout property. Instills the 100% guest satisfaction objective to AGM and hourly associates



Ensures that all guest related issues are resolved in a manner consistent with the company's goals and objectives



Recruits qualified applicants. Trains employees in accordance with company standards



Communicates all policies and procedures to entire staff. Conducts regular meetings to provide various information including company communications, policy reviews, local property activities, goals, etc



Inspects and documents repairs and cleanliness of property with AGM to ensure optimum upkeep and repair, room cleanliness and overall property appearance



Work to build solid client relationships in the District and with Managers and staff at each assigned hotel



Upholds and Enforces ESH standards and policy compliance at the hotel level.


**OTHER DUTIES**



Adheres to federal, state and local laws employment related laws and regulations



Performs duties in all aspects of hotel operations whenever needed



Directly manages an Assistant General Manager who supervises a total of 8 to 10 employees on the Property. Is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of this unit



Actively reviews and monitors the Social Media websites to ensure timely and appropriate responses to postings.

  


**BENEFITS**

* Competitive Wages
* Great working environment
* Employee Recognition Programs
* Medical Insurance

title: Team Lead-109010
description:
**POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARY**

The Team Lead ("TL") position assists theGeneral Manager ("GM") in managing the hotel operations on a day-to-daybasis toensure optimum performance and continual improvement in the Key Performance Indicators and 100% guest satisfaction. The TL resolves guest and associate issues, and performs other duties as required to develop efficiency and profitability in all aspects of property management. The TL assumes the GM's responsibilities when required. The TL also must ensure that safety and security procedures are in place in accordance with company guidelines and standards for all associates and guests.


**MAJOR / KEY JOB DUTIES**


* Demonstrates and promotes a 100% commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests.
* Assists the GM in ensuring that associates at the property are driving company initiatives to increase revenue, lower costs and increase guest and associate satisfaction.
* Trains associates on company standards and job performance expectations when the GM is not available.
* Upholds and enforces company standards and policy compliance at the hotel level. The associate must promote compliance with company policies and procedures, including but not limited to the prompt reporting of all safety and security issues directly to the manager or to the appropriate authorities.
* Assists the GM in monitoring in-house guest balances and direct bill receivables, commission payments by vendors, and issuance of refund checks.
* Assists with monitoring monthly inventory of supplies and equipment. Ensures that day- to-day purchases are within budget and with approved vendors. Assists the GM in maximizing revenues and flow through to GOP to meet or exceed budgeted EBITDA.
* Serves as first level of contact for guest service issues. Resolves guest issues or determines necessity to escalate to the GM as needed.
* Position must embrace the company's service culture and treat all guest and associates with professionalism, respect and kindness.
* Instills 100% guest satisfaction objective to hourly associates.


**OTHER DUTIES**


* Assists with certain sales-related activities to increase occupancy, such as supporting the GM by seeking out potential business in the local market and making sales calls and other telemarketing activities.
* Provides other relief or back-up duties as needed at the hotel including front desk coverage, housekeeping, and other duties when needed to ensure optimum operation of the hotel.
* Inspects guest rooms.
* Assists with active review and monitoring of social media websites to ensure timely and appropriate responses.

**BENEFITS**
* **Weekly Pay!**
* Competitive Wages
* Great working environment
* Employee Recognition Programs
* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* Employer Paid Basic Life and AD&D Insurance

	+ Short-Term Disability

	+ Supplemental Life Insurance
	+ Dependent Life Insurance
* 401(k) Savings Plan
* Paid Time Off
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Employee Perks Progam offering discounts to major companies
**Compensation**
Pay Ranges  

Pay range information for the position you are applying for is below.  

Disclaimer: Compensation may vary based on role, level, experience, length of time in a position, and
  

location. Candidates are not guaranteed to be at the high or low end of the compensation ranges
  

presented. The Company complies with applicable federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements.

*Team Lead Full Time - $17.02 - $24.00 Hourly*  


**For New York City (Whitestone) Applicants Only:**
*Team Lead Full Time - $29.37 Hourly*Requirements:
**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIES**


* Able to comprehend fundamental instructions, write short correspondence, and memos. Solid English skills with regard to reading, writing and verbal communication to be able to communicate effectively with guests, associates, and outside vendors.
* Ability to operate the property management system technology.
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
* Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.
* Supervisory skills to oversee daily activities of 8 to 15 hourly staff**.**
* Ability to organize multiple priorities to ensure that daily operations are performed at peak efficiency.


**ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS**


* While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to remain stationary; navigate the hotel and parking lot; handle, reach, and detect objects, tools and controls; and detect scent and sounds.
* Occasionally required to position self to access low areas and traverse heights and remain stable while doing so.
* Occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
* While performing the duties of this job, the associate frequently works in outside weather conditions (depending on hotel).
* The associate occasionally works in wet humid conditions (non-weather related), near moving mechanical parts, in the presence of fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals and risk of electrical shock.
* The work environment will typically be at moderate to loud noise levels.
* Associate may be asked to travel to help additional locations within a reasonable geography.
* Associate may be asked to travel to cover additional sites during the GM's absence.


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**


* Prior hotel experience is required.
* High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**


* Previous supervisory experience is desired.

title: Chain Grocery Sales Representative
description:
The Chain Grocery Sales Representative is responsible maintaining strong retail focus to align with all company sales objectives, including but limited to Volume, Distribution, Share of Market and Customer Service. The position is responsible for growing our entire portfolio. The Chain Grocery Sales Representative reports to the Sales Supervisor. The Chain Grocery Sales Representative position hours begin at 6:00am and the position is a salaried/exempt position.

**Sales Functions**

*o\\_* Call Frequency\\_

* Responsible for regular call frequency on assigned retail accounts primarily to sell volume, increase distribution, merchandise monitor price and shelf management

*o\\_* Consultative Information Based Selling Techniques\\_

* Selling Product Features and Benefits
* Styles of Products
* Product Demographics
* Profit Margin Analysis

*o\\_* Sales Execution\\_

* Delivering against Volume targets
* Achieving Distribution / New Package gains
* Achieve Monthly Point Sheet Objectives
* Executing Supplier / Company Programs

*o\\_* Market Execution \\_

* Cold Box Management – Gaining Space
* Warm Shelf Management – Gaining Space
* Pack Out Deliveries
* Display Execution
* Pack Out of Back Room Stock
* Prime Location
* Properly Merchandised
* Rotated Product
* Establishing measures to prevent Out of Stocks. Responsible for daily decisions regarding retail inventory levels using past sales history, changes in climate, competitive activity, and special promotional activities.

*o\\_* Key Customer Planning \\_

* Establishing / Maintain Relationships
* Build business relationships with BUSCH Selling Skills and present professional sales presentations using sales histories.
* Creating localized plans to drive growth
* Understanding the target consumer by account
* Meeting Key Customers Needs

*o\\_* PTC (Price to the Consumer) Management \\_

* Managing the appropriate Price based on Cost of Goods
* Driving aggressive features based on Margin

*o\\_* Portfolio / Brand and Product Knowledge\\_

*o\\_* Solid Understanding of Technology and Tools\\_

* MOBILITY / Surveys
* Encompass Mobile
* Encompass System for Reporting
* Microsoft Outlook for Email Efficiency
* Tablet Efficient – Presentations / Profit Calculator

*o\\_* Segment/Chain Knowledge\\_

* Chain/KAM initiatives and Programming i.e. MIR/Cross Merch
* Pricing Knowledge
* Weekly Ad Sheet review

**Administrative Functions**

*o\\_* Communication and Customer Service\\_

* Frequent communication with direct line manager and sales team
* Responsible for daily paperwork and proper completion of all company documents
* Responsible for the proper communication of company credit and accounts receivable processes. Work with Credit Department to resolve credit issues including collecting past due balances.
* Provide feedback to management regarding promotional activities, market data and competitive activity.

*o\\_* Solid Understanding of Technology and Tools\\_

* MOBILITY / Surveys
* Encompass Mobile
* Encompass System for Reporting
* Microsoft Outlook for Company Communication

*o\\_* Attend Weekly Department Meetings\\_

* Discuss issues/opportunities at store level
* Rollup competitive trade activity

**Operational Functions**

*o\\_* Vehicle & Safety Requirements\\_

* Follow Safety Policies and Procedures
* Follow all policies and procedures pertaining to proper usage of a company vehicle.

The Chain Grocery Sales Representative assumes other responsibilities as assigned by Sales Supervisors, Sales Director, VPSM, General Manager and ownership. These responsibilities and objectives include but are not limited to:

* Attendance Expectations
* Quality Image and Appearance
* Professionalism

**Development of the Chain Grocery Sales Representative Position**

A Chain Grocery Sales Representative with proper development can expect opportunities to move into roles such as General Market Sales. Additional opportunities may exist in movement to the Operations Department.

* Product Knowledge – Must understand the entire Clare Rose Portfolio
* Participates in executive, management, and company staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars.
* Continued education programs when necessary.

o Sales Certification Training

o Selling Skills

o Mobility / Encompass Training

**Chain Grocery Sales Representative Requirements**

* Developed knowledge and experience in sales and company objectives.
* Excellent oral and written communications skills (Interacts well with Internal & External Customers)
* Above Average Presentation Skills
* Excellent Average interpersonal skills.
* Excellent computer skills in all sales programs.
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Enthusiastic, Team player interested in positive company growth.
* Clean, Valid NYS Driver’s License
* Must be 21+ years of age

**Education and Experience**

* A minimum of some college course work completed is required. A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Business or Marketing is preferable.
* Some sales experience is preferable.

**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations**

* All Sales Representatives are required to possess and maintain a New York State Solicitor Permit for the purpose of peddling alcoholic products.

**Physical Demands**

These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the Sales Representative’s job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions of the Sales Representative’s job.

While performing the responsibilities of the Sales Representative’s job, the employee is required to talk and listen. The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee is required to lift and manage packaged items of up to 30 lbs. freehanded and over that threshold using an appropriate lift system or lift truck. The vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

**Work Environment**

While performing the responsibilities of the Sales Representative’s job, these work environment characteristics are representative of the environment the Sales Representative will encounter. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the Sales Representative’s job.

While performing the duties of this job in the office environment, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and vehicles. The noise level in the work environment can be moderate to loud. While performing duties of this job in the field environment, the employee will be exposed on a regular basis to moving mechanical parts, motor vehicles and traffic.

Exposure while in customer locations cannot be projected. These conditions may vary, and the employee will receive adequate training to recognize and avoid hazards that cannot be described as expected.

title: Revenue Cycle Specialist
description:
**Job Summary**:

Large Orthopedic Group is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Revenue Cycle Specialist to join our Revenue Cycle Team. The ideal candidate will possess strong knowledge of third-party billing, AR follow-up and denials management. Complete understanding of all rules, policies, and protocols of assigned payors. **Worker's Comp and No-Fault experience is a plus!** 

This role is responsible for ensuring that all claims are submitted correctly, followed up in a timely manner and reimbursed according to contract.

**Responsibilities:**

* Review accounts prior to claim submission to ensure demographic data is correct.
* Monthly review of AR reports to identify "problem" accounts.
* Contacting insurance companies and other involved parties to resolve issues and secure timely and complete reimbursement.
* Complete understanding of all rules, policies, and protocols of assigned payors.
* Appealing all claims that are denied or not reimbursed according to contract and resolving issues including, but not limited to:
* Review of all physician documentation to ensure compliance with payors’ policies.
* Contacting patients and payors whenever necessary for assistance with resolution.
* Maintain current, accurate notes/documentation in the PM system for all claim's status
* Handle all related correspondence and telephone calls from carriers and patients

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* 2 years' experience in medical billing and collection for a medical office or related organization.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills.

This role offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic healthcare environment and make a meaningful impact on our organization's revenue cycle. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for medical coding and billing, we encourage you to apply.

title: Site Coordinator
description:
**Brooklyn College Community Partnership (BCCP)**

Job Title: **Program Coordinator**

Reports to: **Deputy Director**

**Position Summary**: The Program Coordinator collaborates with the CBO Supervisor, the partner school, and 21st CCLC partners to create supportive environments that help students overcome challenges to thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. The Program Coordinator is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day activities on site, ensuring that programming is linked to the goals and objectives of the grant, working closely with the school administration to collaborate on program planning including but not limited to student recruitment, engagement, and retention, data collection, and participating in CCLC meetings.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Ensure program meets enrollment requirements including student recruitment, engagement, and retention for afterschool programming
* Conduct community outreach to promote the program activities and benefits (e.g., families, local CBOs, community leaders, etc.)
* Ensure programming is linked to the goals and objectives of the grant
* Together with the CBO Supervisor, schedule and participate in quarterly collaborative planning meetings with program stakeholders
* Assist with collection of data in preparation for NYSED report
* Implement required activities and manage day-to-day operations of the program at the partner school
* Attend 21st CCLC/DOE meetings, workshops, and related program events
* Evaluate staff and meet regularly to discuss and problem-solve challenges
* Enter program data and track student progress in program database system

· Oversee the maintenance of supplies and materials at the site

**Work Schedule** (program schedule is based on NYC DOE school year calendar)

* Part-time, 25 hours per week
* Monday – Friday (12pm-5:30pm)

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum 3 years experience in youth development program management in NYC DOE public schools
* Strong leadership and communication skills, high interest in the arts, youth development, community service, and social justice
* **Bilingual** **in Spanish preferred**

**Salary and fringe benefits**

· $27 - $35 per hour

· Health insurance and other benefits

**Work Location**: WATCH High School, 400 Pennsylvania Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11207

**About BCCP:**

The Brooklyn College Community Partnership (BCCP) is a youth development program bridging Brooklyn College to Brooklyn neighborhoods through a comprehensive range of after-school and extracurricular initiatives in under-resourced public schools and at our Brooklyn College Arts Lab (BCAL). Our commitment to providing quality programming lies in delivering holistic and interdisciplinary activities, diligently crafted, to empower students and meet their unique academic and social-emotional needs.

Expected hours: 25 per week

title: Heavy Duty Wrecker and Rotator Operator
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Paid time off

  

**Twin Towing stands as a premier service provider in the towing and recovery industry, contracted not only by the NJ State Police and NJ Turnpike Authority but also by numerous local municipalities. Specializing in both light and heavy-duty towing alongside extra-heavy duty recovery operations, our fleet includes multiple rotators and a variety of heavy-duty wreckers. We are leaders in our field, welcoming both full-time and part-time professionals who are a fit for our dynamic team.**  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

* Perform heavy-duty tows and operate a rotator on recovery scenes as required.
* Be available for on-call duties, with commission provided for on-call availability. A strong commitment to being readily available for recoveries whenever called out is essential.
* Ensure safety and efficiency in all towing and recovery operations, maintaining a professional demeanor and upholding the company's commitment to customer satisfaction.

**Requirements:**  

  

* Valid Class A CDL & DOT medical card with a clean driving record.
* **A minimum of 3 years of experience in heavy-duty towing, with specific expertise in rotator operations for heavy recoveries highly preferred.**
* Familiarity with local roadways and the agility to respond quickly to calls.
* Extensive experience handling various types of heavy equipment.
* Robust understanding of local roadways.
* Wreckmaster rotator certification beneficial but not essential.

**We Offer:**  

  

* Competitive pay, including commission for on-call availability.
* A dedicated truck assigned to you for your duties, fully equipped with all necessary tools and equipment to tackle the job.
* Comprehensive benefits package, which encompasses medical, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, a 401k plan, and paid time off.
* Uniforms provided to ensure a professional appearance at all times.


  

**Join us as a Heavy Duty Tow Truck and Rotator Operator and bring your extensive experience and passion for heavy-duty towing to our team.**  

  

**For interest or inquiries, please contact Joe at (973) 390-2088.**

title: Front Desk Sales Associate
description:
**Job Summary:**  
StretchLab Bayside is currently seeking a high energy, passion filled and sales motivated individual that is fitness minded and has a love for community and our brand!

Founded in 2015 in Venice, California, StretchLab is the industry leader in offering one-on-one assisted stretching. With Co-Founders coming from the Personal Training industry, Stretch Lab has created a variety of offerings to empower clients to ‘Live Long’. StretchLab has gathered a team of experts already certified in an array of related fields – physical therapy, chiropractic medicine, yoga, Pilates, and more – and brought in the world’s leading authority on stretching and flexibility to deliver on the promise of having the finest team of stretching professionals gathered anywhere. StretchLab’s proprietary flexologist ™ training ensures that their client’s receive a world class stretching session.

**Position:**

The purpose of the Sales Representative is to assist the General Manager with new membership sales by bringing new members to the studio and booking them into Intro Classes. The Sales Representative also assists with retaining current members. Fitness knowledge or background is preferred but not required.

**Requirements:**

* Excellent sales, communication, and customer service skills required
* Goal-oriented with an ability to achieve sales in memberships for one-on-one and group assisted stretch and retail
* Ability to learn and use a CRM software system (ClubReady)
* Ability to stand or sit for up to 8 hours throughout the workday
* Must be fluent in English and have excellent communication skills via in person, phone and email
* Must be able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
* Must have proficient computer skills
* Daily and/or occasional travel may be required for pop-ups and community outreach

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist the General Manager with the sales process of lead generation, follow up, and close
* Book and confirm intro classes
* Manage the front desk to greet and check-in clients and prospects when they enter the studio
* Conduct tours of the facility while establishing a relationship and targeting individual’s needs and wants
* Maintain acceptable level of personal sales production
* Emphasize and enforce objectives of the club as a fitness and wellness provider
* Present available services to current or prospective members
* Book quality appointments to achieve monthly sales quota and follow-up with leads and missed intro classes
* Participate in special events (health fairs, grand openings, marathons, and community and hospital events) to promote the club
* Ensure studio is clean and tidy
* Other duties as assigned

**Compensation and Perks:**

* Competitive compensation based on experience
* In addition to base pay, earn lucrative commission on sales
* Free or discounted memberships
* Opportunity for bonus based on performance.
* Huge opportunities for growth within the studios, including additional sales and management opportunities

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

* Why are you interested in working at StretchLab?

Experience:

* Sales: 1 year (Required)

title: Facilities Manager/Superintendent
company: Temple Emanuel of the Pascack Valley
description:
The Facilities Manager's role is hands-on maintaining and operating the building and grounds. They will be primarily and directly responsible for the daily maintenance and operation of the physical plant and its equipment & technology. Saturdays, Jewish Holidays, and major congregational events are busy times and are considered workdays. The Synagogue also has a licensed day care program and building operations is a crucial component of that function. The role is a hands-on worker, responsible for setup and breakdown of rooms for functions and routine maintenance and repairs of all systems. While they will oversee contract custodians, this is NOT a desk or management job. The Facilities Team Leader reports to the Executive Director.

**SKILLS:**

* Experience in building maintenance and repairs
* Oversight of custodial staff
* Forward-thinking trouble shooter, solutions oriented
* Knowledge of building systems (HVAC, Plumbing, electrical, etc.)
* Ability to make minor repairs to building systems, furniture, and equipment
* Ability to lift 50lbs
* Respect for Jewish practices, including the Sabbath and the Jewish calendar and festivals.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus
* Basic knowledge of pertinent laws and codes regarding building construction, operation, and safety

**SUPERVISES**

* Custodial Staff/Contractor
* Trades and Contractors

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Ensuring the facility is maintained in an appropriate state of readiness for all scheduled services and events
* Schedules, directs, and supervises oversees contract custodial staff
* Proactively identifies issues and problems with machinery and equipment
* Makes recommendations for and maintains records of repairs, preventive maintenance, and capital investment to insure a good state of repair for all building systems
* Organizes, orders, and maintains inventory of supplies
* Schedules and oversees all repairs and maintenance, including supervising all trades contractors and work performed
* Supervises and works with custodial staff in set-up/break-down and staffing for events
* Ensures that all building safety, fire safety, and regular working procedures are adhered to
* Makes minor repairs to building systems; installs equipment and furniture
* Supervises and works with custodial staff on snow removal and salting on paths and sidewalks.
* Interfaces with membership, professional staff, and volunteer workers in a friendly and effective manner.
* Assures coverage of Friday nights, Saturday mornings, and Sunday mornings, including working these days as needed.
* Assures coverage for special events (comp day provided); available for emergencies during off-hours. Flex-time available
* Computer and smart-phone literate

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Paid time off

* Driver's License (Required)

title: Community Outreach Coordinator - Queens, Jamaica, Jackson Heights, Corona
description:
**Job Summary:** The Community Outreach Coordinator is responsible for developing, maintaining, and strengthening relationships on the field with new and existing referral sources who can refer clients to our company. He/she is the key member of our Business Development team and helps lead the creation and implementation of referrals that will increase patient census, branding and company awareness.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Community Partnerships:** Collaborate with local food pantries, senior centers, faith-based organizations, and other community resources to foster partnerships and expand outreach efforts. Actively participate in community events and initiatives to strengthen relationships and enhance visibility.
* S**ales Presentation in group setting:** Conduct engaging and informative sales presentations in group settings, including but not limited to community centers, senior centers, and faith-based organizations, to educate audiences about the benefits of home care services and the CDPAP program.
* **Street Marketing:** Implement creative and effective street marketing strategies to increase awareness of home care services and the CDPAP program within the community. This may include distributing flyers, hosting informational booths, and engaging with community members directly.
* **Community Engagement and Promotion:** Promote home care services within the community, leveraging language skills to effectively communicate with diverse populations. Develop and nurture new referral sources within the community through targeted outreach efforts.
* **Relationship Strengthening:** Conduct daily visits to various organizations, physician offices, hospitals, assisted living facilities, and adult day care centers to educate and inform referral sources and patients about available home health services.
* **Availability to Close:** Demonstrate the ability to effectively close deals and convert leads into referrals for the Consumer Directed Personal Assistance Program (CDPAP).

**Event Coordination and Representation:** Coordinate and actively participate in health fairs, awareness days, cultural functions, and religious events to raise awareness and establish connections within the community.

**Requirements:**

* Fluent in English and Spanish with 1 year of experience in outreach sales or a related field preferred. Must possess reliable transportation and driving skills. Medicare agents/brokers welcome; We offer a competitive salary along with the opportunity to meet weekly referral targets, enabling you to earn competitive compensation for each successful referral.

title: Associate - Futures, Brand & Innovation
description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
Title: Associate - Futures, Brand & Innovation
Location: Hybrid - NYC
Work Authorization: This role does not support visa sponsorship now or in the future.
About the Company:
Kantar is the world’s leading marketing data and analytics company. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies and strategic consulting, Kantar’s 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world’s leading organizations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar: we provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.
About the Team:
We help clients find new sources of growth through strategic foresight, brand strategy, cultural insight, and innovation. We help brands understand the current and future needs of consumers and guide them in how to meet those needs and make significant connections. Our clients span the Fortune 500 across diverse sectors (think: Mayo Clinic, Ford, Google, PepsiCo, and Merck).
We pride ourselves on being an engine of growth for our clients, and strategic foresight is a critical part of how we do it. We are looking for an extraordinarily dedicated, passionate, and experienced foresight / futures specialist to join our team, and make their mark on how we talk, think and deliver foresight at Kantar.
About the Role:
As an Associate, you will specialize in strategic foresight engagements and have the opportunity to work alongside and collaborate with an eclectic mix of innovation, brand, qual and quant professionals from across Kantar.
The Associate role is an intensive training ground to building consulting, marketing, and sales skills. Associates bring open-mindedness and challenge our status quo. They fully engage in our business, taking on project roles to grow their skills. With guidance and support, they contribute to quality client deliverables.
This role sits within an award-winning team that is recognized for its unique approaches and shown client impact by Kantar globally and will be well-suited to individuals who are eager to influence the direction of the practice for Kantar through offer innovation, business development, and unparalleled client delivery.
The Associate will be a significant force in driving our business forward:* Handling multiple, simultaneous projects and supporting more senior-level consultants to ensure high-quality client deliverables
* Contributing to client engagements through the delivery of high-quality work to team members and demonstrating green shoots of critical thinking and storytelling
* Analyzing proprietary Kantar consumer data and external sources to identify, interpret and translate it for use in our foresight/scenario, innovation, and brand strategy projects
* Synthesizing data from a wide variety of sources and distill relevant insights into strategic recommendations for our clients (e.g., marketing communications, brand strategy/positioning, consumer targeting, corporate strategy, innovation and new product/service development, category or portfolio strategy, etc.)
* Scouting trends, cultural shifts and product inspiration to identify opportunities for growth
* Contributing to collaborative brainstorms, creative ideation and problem-solving
* Presenting future-facing insights, implications and recommendations to our clients


What do we look for in an Associate?
A hard-working multi-tasker who brings energy, expertise, and discipline to our projects, ensuring everyone knows what must happen next * - all while adding their own voice and ideas to our client deliverables
* An insatiable curiosity, open-minded and willingness to learn – always on the lookout for innovative ideas and inspiration, new ways of working, frameworks and thinking that can inspire our team
* A keen interest in the interplay among people, culture and business as well as social, technological, economic, environmental, human and political change
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a desire to collaborate with others
* Strong writing skills, with the ability to crystalize complex shifts into clear, compelling storylines
* Collaborative, yet independent and proactive – comfortable with sharing thoughts and opinions to build on ideas and contribute to collaborative brainstorms, creative ideation and problem-solving


Essential Capabilities:* Work experience: 1-2 years’ work experience, with experience in a trend / foresight / innovation consultancy or comparable work experience a plus
* Time Management: Ability to support multiple projects at once, managing your own time effectively and able to work independently to effectively complete briefed tasks
* Delivery of strategic outputs: Ability to add value to client deliverables by conducting research, identifying quality insights, developing compelling presentations, and playing an active role in client briefings, meetings and workshops.
* Storytelling: Ability to synthesize and translate data (soft and hard) from primary research and other sources into a cohesive and compelling storyline; excellent written and verbal communication skills with a creative approach to storytelling and visual presentation of information; ability to think strategically and support the development of insights, implications and recommendations for our clients


Nice to Have Capabilities:* Semiotics/Cultural Insights: Experience helping distill where culture is headed and how this shows up visually through emerging design, fashion, branding, and other visual media
* Innovation: Experience of strategic front-end innovation methodologies, from opportunity scoping and development to ideation and facilitation


Kantar Benefits:
We provide a comprehensive, highly competitive benefits package, including* Medical plans with comprehensive, affordable coverage for a range of health services
* Health Savings Account/FSA
* Dental, Vision and benefits to cover unique healthcare needs
* Wellness Program
* 401k with matching
* Tuition Reimbursement, Commuter benefits
* Unlimited PTO


At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.
At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.
*The salary range for this role in New York is 72,800.00 - 121,400.00 USD Annual. Your final base salary will be determined based on several factors which may include but are not limited to location, work experience, skills, knowledge, education and/or certifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.*
Privacy and Legal Statement
PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (“Kantar”). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager.
Location
New York, World Trade CenterUnited States of America
Kantar Rewards Statement
At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.  

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.  

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.  

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.
Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

title: Assistant Vice President, Data Analytics
description:
Assistant Vice President, Data Analytics

Job Number:

 3257388


POSTING DATE: Sep 5, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New Jersey-Jersey City
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Assistant Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley Smith Barney, LLC seeks an Assistant Vice President, Data Analytics in Jersey City, NJ  



Create a comprehensive and consistent reporting and visualization suite for cross-sell campaigns performance. Develop insights, measurement capabilities, and KPIs to enable regular executive updates and benchmark creation. Partner with the data science team to provide predictive targeting capabilities (response models, product propensity models, Lifetime Value prediction) to enable and inform cross-sell strategy. Partner with data strategy and infrastructure leads to drive continuous improvement in processes and platforms, enabling continuous focus on driving strategy through analytics. Partner with marketing and digital product to ensure we provide consistent, measurable customer experience across channels.  



Salary: Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $145,000 and $145,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.  


QUALIFICATIONS


Requirements:  



Requires a Master’s degree in Management Science and Engineering, Data Science, or a related field of study and three (3) years of experience in the position offered or three (3) years as a Manager, Trainee Decision Scientist, or a closely related occupation. Requires three (3) years of experience with: SQL, Python, R, SAS; Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Powerpoint, Microsoft Access, and VBA; Tableau, and PowerBI; Hadoop, Hive, and Microsoft SQL Server; Statistical and Analytics Techniques including Regression, Clustering, Time Series Forecasting, Significance Testing, A/B testing and measurement, and Segmentation.

title: Respite Assistant- WEEKENDS
description:
**Respite Program Assistant**

**Overall Description:**

The above staff are responsible for carrying out all program related responsibilities assigned by Program Director.

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

· Support at all times all assigned program participants.

· Ensure the safety of the participants.

· Promote the DSP Core Competencies by using a person-centered approach

· Implement effective instructional/prompting techniques with the participants as indicated by Supervisor and/or Program Director.

· Follow individualized positive reinforcement plans as indicated by Supervisor and/or Program Director.

· Ensure clock-in and clock-out times in Paychex are accurate and completed in a timely manner.

· Sign all required staff sign-in time card sheets on same day that services are rendered.

· Ensure intern sheet is signed by Supervisor and submitted to Program Director upon completion of hours.

· Communicate any family/participant problems/concerns to Supervisor and/or Program Director.

· Complete all occurrences (injuries) and reportable incident forms accurately and submit to Supervisor and/or Program Director in a timely manner.

· Communicate any safety issues or concerns to Supervisor and/or Program Director.

· Maintain an open and positive relationship with participants and family members to meet the needs of the participant.

· Complete annual in-service training and other trainings as needed.

· Complete all assignments as directed by Supervisor and/or Program Director.

**Minimum Requirements:**

· High School Student for Interns/Volunteers and High School Diploma/GED for Assistant.

· Interest in pursuing ASD field

· Pursuing a Graduate or Undergraduate degree in the field of human services a plus.

· Some experience working with children.

· Good communication skills.

· High level of professionalism working with participants.

title: RN-Hospital At Home
description:
Overview **RN-Hospital at Home (PART-TIME) 10K Bonus**

**Shift available:**

**7a-1p (4 weekdays and either a Sat or Sun)**

  

**Shift differential for weekends**

  

**Uber provided at company expense to patient's home**

  

**BENEFITTED POSITIONS FOR 30 HOURS AND OVER WEEKLY**

  

Are you a highly skilled and compassionate RN looking for a rewarding career providing acute care in the patient's home? If so, we invite you to join the team at Mt. Sinai, in partnership with Contessa, an Amedisys company. Amedisys is one of the largest and most trusted home health and hospice companies in the U.S.

  



**Attractive pay**


* $57-$59/hourly

  

**Enjoy great perks and benefits**

* A full benefits package with choice of affordable PPO or HSA medical plans.
* Paid time off.
* Up to $1,300 in free healthcare services paid by Amedisys yearly, when enrolled in an Amedisys HSA medical plan.
* Up to $500 in wellness rewards for completing activities during the year. Use these rewards to support your wellbeing with spa/massage/salon services, gym memberships, fitness classes, sports, hobbies, pets and more. \\*
* Mental health support, including up to five free counseling sessions per year through the Amedisys Employee Assistance program.
* 401(k) with a company match.
* Family support with infertility treatment coverage\\*, adoption reimbursement, paid parental and family caregiver leave.
* Fleet vehicle program\\*\\* and mileage reimbursement.
* And more.


*Please note: Benefit eligibility can vary by position depending on shift status.** *To participate, you must be enrolled in an Amedisys medical plan.*

*\\*\\*For full-time caregivers meeting certain requirements.*  

**What's in it for you**


* Community-based care centers with a supportive and inclusive work environment.
* Better work/life balance and increased flexibility compared to other settings.
* Job stability and the opportunity to advance with a growing company.
* The opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of patients and their families providing much needed care where they want to be - in their homes.

  

**Don't just take it from us - see what our caregivers love about Amedisys**


*"I have worked here just shy of a year and it's the best job I've ever had! We have an awesome team and administration is very supportive. I never felt so appreciated. Your time off is really yours."* - Amedisys caregiver  



  

**Why Amedisys**
  

Amedisys is a leading provider of home health, hospice and high-acuity care, dedicated to helping patients and families navigate the complex healthcare system. With a focus on compassionate, patient-centered care, you would be joining a team of professionals committed to improving the lives of those they serve.

  



  

Responsibilities  

* Responsible for starting the patient's care, including nursing assessment, medication reconciliation, safety assessments and implementing standardized protocols.
* Administers prescribed medications (typically intravenously), obtains blood samples, inserts foley catheters and provides therapeutic interventions.
* Educates patient on how to manage their illness, prescribed medications, nursing interventions, and care plan.
* Identifies and acts on changes in patient's condition.
* Evaluates and revises care plans/assessments based on changes in patients and/or their environments.
* Documents all assessments, interventions and care coordination details.
* Participates in regular, in-service or special case orientations as needed.
* Participates in on-call rotation.
* Performs all other duties as assigned.

  

Qualifications  

* Associate of Science in nursing.
* Current RN license, specific to the state(s) you are assigned to work.
* One year of adult acute inpatient medical, or medical/surgical care experience within the last five years.
* Current CPR certification.
* Valid d river's l icense.
* Reliable transportation and company required liability insurance.
Preferred


* Bachelor of Science in nursing.
* Experience providing RN services in the home, community or clinic.
* Adult medical critical care.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets and may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.


*Amedisys is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified employees and applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, sexual orientation, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.*

Teaching classes with energy and enthusiasm

Keeping up-to-date on safety and fitness trends
  
Reporting any equipment/facility problems to the management team

Attends all scheduled meetings
  
Attends schedules professional trainings.
  
Other duties as assigned

title: Automotive Customer Service Advisor
description:
**Position Summary**



Contribute to the growth of the organization across all lines of business through customer engagement, expert product and service knowledge, follow-up, and follow through at the service desk, on the sales floor, and at the register.


**Duties & Responsibilities**

* First point of contact for customers on the phone and in the store. Responsible for engaging customers, scheduling appointments, building trust, understanding needs, communicating processes and timelines, and selling parts and service that make the customer's car run at peak efficiency; adheres to Company Customer Care standards to meet customer expectations.
* Responsible for the organization and productivity of the service business through work order and register transactions, thorough vehicle inspections, and service and replacement part knowledge.
* Under the direction of Management, assists in various aspects of customer care, work order and register assistance, facility maintenance, and Outside Purchase (OP) ordering.
* Follow all policies and procedures related to cash, credit, check, refund and return policies. Works with the management team to react to customer service issues, customer complaints, and/or business opportunities.
* Conduct and participate in routine express automotive services, including tire mounting, balancing, rotations, and repair; oil changes, fluid top-offs, lubrications, filter and bulb replacement; battery installation, starting and charging system testing; cosmetic car services, and thorough vehicle inspection.
* Primary driving force behind the implementation and constant execution of safety procedures, ensuring wheel torque and oil/fluid services are performed per standard operating procedure directives.
* Partner with Management to produce a safe and health work environment that complies with all local, state, and federal laws, as well as with company policies and procedures.
* Effectively communicate with all associates, management, and customers; interprets and retains information and applies knowledge appropriately.
* In designated locations, may be a secondary key carrier responsible for basic and detailed opening and closing responsibilities.
* Maintain an organized and neat shop.
* Adhere to all company policies, procedures, safety and environmental rules.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Valid Driver's License.
* One year of related experience in the automotive service environment.
* One year of sales experience preferred.
* Must have basic knowledge and understanding of mathematical concepts such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, percentages, and fractions. Ability to apply mathematical formulas to calculate commissions and discounts.
* Strong verbal communication skills.
* Strong customer service skills.
* Ability to work Days, Nights, Weekends, Holidays.

description:

The Master Technician requires experience and technical expertise to diagnose drivability, air conditioning and electrical systems. It is expected to use leadership and mentoring skills to drive a team to increase customer care and satisfaction A successful Master Technician will have direct interaction with customers and deliver superior service through educating the customer on the problems and proposed solutions for their vehicle.

Diagnose and repair to specifications * - brake and hydraulic, exhaust, primary and/or advanced fuel ignition and electrical, suspension and alignment, air conditioning and computer systems.
* Perform job duties of all lower job descriptions (Technician A, Technician B, Mechanic, General Service Technician)
* Adequately explain technical diagnoses and needed repairs to non-mechanical individuals which may include employees and customers on an as-required basis.
