title: College Counselor
description:
**Company Description**  

Pharos Academy Charter School is a K-12 urban public education institution that prepares Bronx students for success in college and the innovation economy.

 **Job Description** **College Access Counselor Vision**


The High School College Access Counselor is responsible for ensuring students graduate on time from high school by providing comprehensive guidance, mentoring, outreach, and support services. Using intrusive advising and a data-driven approach, the High School College Access Counselors will take a proactive approach and try to anticipate issues and roadblocks that can prevent scholars from being successful. It is the expectation that the College Access Counselor monitors, tracks, communicates, and creates action plans around cohort performance. College Access Counselors manage a caseload of approximately 120 students to monitor the progress towards high school completion and college access.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Scholar Academic Success
	+ Uses all relevant data to identify student who are at-risk of falling behind or dropping out of high school. Meet with at-risk scholars and create individualized success plans (Quarterly).
	+ Monitors students' grades and attendance weekly through student information system and reports data to advisors and parents. Constantly assessing student progress (Attendance, Behavior, Grades and communicating results to your manager, families, and students.
	+ Implements appropriate preventative measures and interventions for students and families to ensure student success.
	+ Communicate regularly with Advisors and grade teams as needed to meet the needs of the students in their grade.
	+ Create lists of students for standardized testing (number of students who need to re-take Regents, etc.) in a timely manner and disseminate results to families as needed
	+ In consult with Special Education and AIS staff, facilitate the placement of academically struggling students in academic support programs
* 4-Year Graduation Monitoring & Support
	+ Tracks the progress of individual and subpopulations of students as they progress toward graduation.
	+ Create and maintain the academic programs (Students Schedules) for the students in their cohorts in full compliance with New York State graduation requirements and that are aligned with the student’s interests and learning profile. This includes the updating of student records each semester.
	+ Ensure school adheres to the Academic Policy guidelines at all times and routinely audits students’ grades, credits, and programs.
* Family Engagement
	+ Assist in coordinating the High School parent teacher (student- led) conferences.
	+ Ensure progress reports are updated and mailed/ electronically sent to all families.
	+ Communicate regularly with parent(s)/guardian(s), to discuss academic progress, programs, obstacles and needed efforts by students and parents; should include face-to-face contact, phone, email, semester newsletter, and other as needed communication opportunities.
* College & Career Counseling
	+ Counsel each student through a combination of individual and small group meetings around academics, school attendance, behavior, post-secondary, and workforce opportunities.
	+ Work with admin & College/Career team to identify postsecondary plan for students.
	+ Work with team to coordinate college/university trips & partnerships.
	+ Assist students filling out application forms for school, financial aid and jobs.
	+ Write recommendations on behalf of students for colleges, technical schools, scholarships, special awards and military service.
	+ Prepare student transcripts for schools, employers, etc.
	+ Send out applications, transcripts and recommendations to schools and agencies.

**Key Outcomes**

* 90% of students on caseload meet yearly credit accumulation goals (10 credits).
* 100% of all at-risk students have comprehensive plans with wrap-around services.
* 100% of all SPED and ESL students have comprehensive plans with wrap-around services.
* 90% of parents, when surveyed, agree or strongly agree that they were sufficiently informed about their child’s progress throughout the school year.
* 90% of students, when surveyed, agree or strongly agree that they understand the requirements to graduate from high school.

**The College Access Counselor Qualities:**

* Be relentless and a barrier-remover.
* Be data-driven with a laser focus on sub-populations.
* Be relentlessly committed to the mission of preparing every student for college and post-secondary success.
* Be a culture carrier and work well with parents and teacher advisors.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's Degree in School Counseling, or related pathway, from an accredited college or university.
* Experience working in a post-secondary role as a college advisor, or extensive experience in college & career counseling required.
* Certified as a NYS School Counselor, or working towards certification preferred.
* Bilingual (Spanish) speaker required.

**Starting Salary Range:** $80,000 - $$90,000, commensurate with experience.

 **Additional Information** *Pharos Academy is committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment for all teachers and staff members. As an equal opportunity employer, we hire without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability.*

title: Watchmaker
description:
**Position Overview:**

The **Watchmaker** is responsible for providing in-store watch maintenance, service, and performing quality control checks on watches in a timely manner to satisfy the needs of our customers. This role requires formal training and experience performing full-service repairs on mechanical and automatic movements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● Conduct quality control on same-day serviced watches and advice Service/Sales Professionals if additional servicing is required.  
● Perform quality repairs on all assigned client-owned merchandise, including complex quartz and mechanical watches.  
● Assist other Watchmakers in resolving challenging repairs.  
● Identify and requisition parts necessary for repairs.  
● Communicate status updates to administrative staff and report areas of concern to  
management.  
● Comply with all company policies and procedures, including departmental processes and  
best practices, such as Internal Audit, Human Resources, and Occupational Safety.  
Qualifications:  
● At least 5 years of work experience in watchmaking or relevant certifications.  
● Demonstrated ability to learn on the job.  
● Willingness to be hands-on and work collaboratively with the team.  
● A passion for watches and excellence in service.  
● Detail-oriented with a mechanical aptitude.  
● Technical school training (minimum of 2 years) and/or professional experience (minimum of 3-5 years).

**Working Conditions:**

● This position requires meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining high standards of craftsmanship.  
● The work environment is collaborative, and the Watchmaker will work closely with other team members to achieve common goals.  
● The role demands excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot issues  
efficiently

title: Customer Sales Support Representative
description:
Richards Resolutions is a leader in delivering innovative products and services designed to enhance our customers' lives. We are dedicated to excellence and customer satisfaction, and we're seeking a dedicated Customer Sales Support Representative to join our Hicksville, NY team and help us continue to grow and succeed.

**Job Description:**

Are you enthusiastic about helping people and providing exceptional customer service? As a Customer Sales Support Representative at Richards Resolutions, you will be instrumental in enrolling and signing up new customers for our products and services. You’ll be the friendly and knowledgeable face of our company, ensuring a smooth and positive experience for every customer.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Customer Enrollment:** Facilitate the process of signing up customers for new products and services, ensuring a seamless experience.
* **Product Knowledge:** Gain a thorough understanding of our offerings to provide accurate information and assist customers effectively.
* **Sales Support:** Identify customer needs and recommend appropriate solutions to enhance their experience with our products.
* **Problem Resolution:** Address and resolve customer concerns during the enrollment process to maintain high satisfaction levels.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and enrollments using our CRM system.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work with team members to improve processes and contribute to overall success.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Prior experience in customer service, sales, or a related field is a plus but not required. We value enthusiasm and a willingness to learn!
* **Communication Skills:** Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to build rapport with customers.
* **Customer-Focused:** A genuine desire to help others and deliver outstanding service.
* **Organizational Skills:** Detail-oriented with the ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently.
* **Tech-Savvy:** Comfortable using CRM software and other digital tools.

**Pay:** $16 to $18 per hour, based on experience and performance.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Competitive Hourly Pay:** Attractive pay rate with opportunities for performance-based increases.
* **Benefits:** Comprehensive benefits including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
* **Career Growth:** Opportunities for advancement and professional development within a growing company.
* **Supportive Environment:** A collaborative and inclusive work culture where your contributions are valued.

title: Service Dispatcher
description:
Are you interested in taking your career to the next step with an industry leader? Do you have a knack for scheduling, organizing, and planning? Then we have a job for you! We are a leading home services provider and due to our continued growth we are looking for responsible and reliable individuals to serve as Service Dispatchers.



As a Service Dispatcher, you will be the person our customers rely on to get service when they need it! You will prepare records and distribute work orders to Service Technicians in response to customer requests using our scheduling and mapping technology. We offer competitive compensation, benefits for full time roles as well as overtime opportunities. You may also find room for advancement with us. If this sounds like the kind of career move you've been wanting to make and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!


**Responsibilities:**

As a Service Dispatcher, you will use your communication and active listening skills to devise the most efficient solutions.


**Specific duties include:**


* Scheduling service calls and providing work orders for Service Technicians according to urgency
* Reviewing jobs in the service monitor to ensure they are dispatched and assigned as required
* Communicating with other Dispatchers, Service Technicians and other departments


**Requirements:**



As a Service Dispatcher, you must be pleasant, professional and possess the ability to function equally well both independently and in a team environment. You must also be highly detail-oriented and focused with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and active listening skills as well as the ability to interact effectively with both customers and coworkers.


**Specific qualifications include:**


* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* 1 -2 years prior dispatch experience preferred
* Prior experience in a customer service setting a plus
* Proven problem solving skills
* Ability to work well in a fast paced environment
* Proficiency with the MS Office Suite, MS Outlook and Web navigation


**Benefits:**



As a Service Dispatcher, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are, of course, one of the main keys to our continued success and so, we are committed to your professional development. In addition, you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility with us.



Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:



. Medical coverage (F/T staff)



. Dental coverage (F/T staff)



.Retirement Savings



.Plus more!





The hourly pay rate is $20.50 per hour.


***Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!***


***Apply now!***


***We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.***

title: Director, FP&A
description:
**Description**
---------------


When you join Corporate Services FP&A, you’ll be part of a high achieve team that helps to drive optimal business outcomes in the pursuit of our long-term financial objectives using fact-based, actionable advice wile ensuring governance and transparency for Gartner and its stakeholders. We are performance driven and focused on delivering high quality services and business insights.


Our Strategic objectives are as follows.


* Ensure well planned forecasting with tools and resources to improve accuracy and efficiency
* Develop global processes and leverage standardized tools to enable effectiveness and efficiency
* Deliver accurate, transparent efficient timely planning and reporting
* Expand reporting capability and toolkit of available resources. Continuous evaluation of world class tool
* Attract, retain and develop the right talent
* Develop culture of continuous improvement

Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, inclusive culture where all employees can bring their whole selves to work. If you like working with a generous, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is where you want to be.


**About this role:**

As a Finance Director, you will be a business partner in transforming this world class organization and support Gartner's continued growth and success. This position will perform a key role in providing business analysis, decision support and thought leadership. This includes developing forecasts and analyses, generating internal management reports, monitoring key performance indicators and driving the system automation of this information for the IT organization. We are looking for ambitious individuals with outstanding, proven analytical capabilities and intellectual curiosity who enjoy partnering with business leaders to grasp large complex data sets and develop clear business solutions. You are a well-rounded problem solver with the ability to drive results in a high-energy growth environment.


IT is a key enabler for all of Gartner and helps to drive the strategy for the company. This role will also be responsible for helping to drive IT activities to rest of FP&A.


**What you will do:**

* Contribute to key aspects of Gartner Corporate Finance processes including monthly forecasting and results analysis and preparation of Senior leader presentations
* Perform business unit’s budgeting and forecasting processes
* Provide reporting and detailed analyses to help business leaders make timely, fact-based decisions, and understand business performance
* Develop models and analysis and collaborate with planners to drive understanding of business unit performance
* Provide senior management with monthly financial results and analysis
* Help drive automation and reporting visualization
* Develop models and analysis and collaborate with planners to drive understanding of business unit performance
* Provide ad hoc analysis and finance support in addition to recurring accountabilities

**What you will need:**

* Trusted, collaborative and proactive business partner
* Motivated, high-potential performer, with demonstrated ability to influence and lead.
* Strong communicator with excellent interpersonal skills.
* Able to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected change
* Interest in constant performance improvement and comfort with change.
* Excellent organization, prioritization & time management skills and ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously

#LI-CJ1


**Who are we?**


At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.


Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.


Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.


**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**


Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.


We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.


Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.


We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work .


**What do we offer?**


Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.


In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.


Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.


Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 116,000 USD - 164,220 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.  

  

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.


Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .


Job Requisition ID:92485
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

title: Freelance Videographer
description:
**Job Title: Freelance Videographer**

**Location:** 25E 21ST 6F, New York, NY (Onsite)

**Company: Sellery, Inc.**

**About Us:** Sellery, Inc. is a dynamic and rapidly expanding livestreaming company at the forefront of the TikTok livestream selling market. As an official top ranked shopping partner with TikTok and a leading TSP, we support top US fashion and beauty brands with innovative livestreaming and video solutions. Our international team is passionate about e-commerce and digital media. We are dedicated to empowering brands to excel on TikTok and other social media platforms.

**Job Summary:** We are looking for a creative and skilled Freelance Videographer to join our team onsite in New York, NY. The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, shooting, and editing engaging video content for fashion, beauty, and e-commerce brands. This role involves collaborating with our team to produce high-quality videos that align with brand messaging and campaign objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Video Content Planning and Conceptualization:**

* Collaborate with the content team to conceptualize and plan creative video content that aligns with brand goals and campaign strategies.
* Develop storyboards and shot lists to guide video production and ensure cohesive storytelling.

**2. Video Shooting and Production:**

* Operate professional camera equipment to capture high-quality video footage for fashion, beauty, and e-commerce brands.
* Set up and manage lighting, sound, and other production equipment to ensure optimal video quality.

**3. Video Editing and Post-Production:**

* Edit video footage using industry-standard editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) to create polished and engaging final products.
* Apply creative effects, transitions, and sound design to enhance video content and align with brand aesthetics.

**4. Creativity and Innovation:**

* Bring creative ideas and fresh perspectives to video content creation, exploring new formats, styles, and techniques to engage audiences.
* Stay updated with industry trends and incorporate innovative approaches into video production.

**5. Collaboration and Coordination:**

* Work closely with the content team, designers, and other stakeholders to ensure video content meets project requirements and deadlines.
* Communicate effectively to gather feedback and make necessary revisions to meet client expectations.

**6. Brand and E-commerce Focus:**

* Tailor video content to effectively represent fashion, beauty, and e-commerce brands, highlighting their products and messaging.
* Ensure that all video content aligns with brand guidelines and marketing objectives.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a videographer, with a strong portfolio showcasing video content for fashion, beauty, or e-commerce brands.
* Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar tools.
* Creative flair with a keen eye for detail and storytelling.
* Strong understanding of video production techniques, including lighting, camera operation, and sound recording.
* Familiarity with current video trends and best practices on platforms like TikTok.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with brand and e-commerce video content is highly desirable.

**Job Type: Freelance/Part-time**

How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their resume and a link to their portfolio or examples of previous work to premawang@sellerylive.com

Equal Opportunity Employer: Sellery, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

description:
**Program: Day Habilitation Without Walls**

**· $250 Sign-on bonus.**

**Exemption Status: Non-Exempt**

Reports To: Assistant Director of Day Habilitation Services

**General Summary:**

Provides direct support and care for adults with developmental disabilities. Facilitates attainment of person-centered goals for program participants. Responsible for documenting the provision of supports.

**Major Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Drives City Access New York vehicle to transport participants to and from homes to community-based program settings.

· Chaperones participants into the community on a daily basis and maintains close supervision of them.

· Collects data for written program plans, i.e. daily notes, behavior plans, treatment plans.

· Writes case notes and provides information on incidents as required.

· Provide necessary program support/coverage.

· Participates in community-based activities, to provide support and supervision of participants.

· Provide physical and programmatic aid to participants where assigned.

· Aids in daily operation of assigned program areas.

· Assists with supervision of participants in assigned areas.

· Initiates precautions within established framework to assure that work is completed in a manner free from recognized hazards.

· Notifies supervisor of any problems with the vehicle.

· Participates in case conferences as needed.

· Serves as member of interdisciplinary team.

· Attends periodic supervisory conferences and required staff meetings.

· Participates in in-service training programs.

· Substitutes in other groups as needed.

· Performs pre-trip inspection of vehicle in accordance with City Access New York policy.

· Maintains vehicle log of mileage time and ensures that it is kept clean.

· Performs other related duties as requested.

**Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:**

High School Diploma or GED.

At least one year of comparable driving experience. Six months of related direct care experience preferred.

**License/Certification:**

Valid New York State Driver’s License, maintained in good standing. Completion of Drivers Safety Course is mandatory upon hire.

**Skills and Abilities Required:**

· Good oral and written communication skills.

· Good interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively with coworkers, employees, participants, families and outside contacts.

· Ability to anticipate, analyze, and develop responses to program logistics and interpersonal relationship problems

· Must be able to maintain the strictest confidentiality.

**Physical Demands:**

· Ability to maintain focus and safety while driving.

· Ability to provide reasonable assistance to participants’ physical needs.

· Stooping, bending, kneeling and pushing and pulling of heavy objects.

**Working Conditions:**

· As needed, providing personal care assistance to participants.

· May be transferred to another program site to meet CANY needs.

· Occasional extension of shift to cover the health and safety needs of participants as emergencies and/or other situations warrant.

· May at times be required to work overtime.

· May need to take special precautions in the handling of body fluids.

Work Remotely

title: Fix Restoration Implant Specialist
description:
**ProDirect Laboratory**

PRODIRECT Dental Lab is known for providing our dentists with the resources and experience of a national dental lab with the personalized service of local boutique labs. We are a global organization with over 35 years of experience in providing world class service and products to our customers.

Let's redefine excellence, together.

We are rapidly expanding our US team and are seeking a successful, enthusiastic, and self-motivated Customer Success Specialist. title: Digital Marketer
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are dedicated to creating innovative and impactful marketing strategies that drive engagement and success across multiple platforms. We are seeking a creative and data-driven **Digital Marketing Specialist** to join our team and lead our efforts in content creation, video marketing, drip campaigns, and gamification.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Digital Marketing:** Develop, execute, and optimize digital marketing campaigns across platforms such as Google, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and TikTok.
* **Video Marketing:** Plan and produce engaging video content that tells our brand story, promotes our products/services, and drives conversions.
* **Content Creation:** Craft compelling content for websites, blogs, social media, and email marketing campaigns that resonate with target audiences.
* **Drip Campaigns:** Design and implement automated email and SMS drip campaigns to nurture leads, build relationships, and increase conversion rates.
* **Gamification Marketing:** Integrate gamification elements into campaigns to boost user engagement and retention.
* **Analytics & Reporting:** Monitor campaign performance and create detailed reports to optimize results and improve ROI.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales and product, to align marketing efforts with business goals.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in **digital marketing** with a focus on video, content creation, and drip campaigns.
* Strong knowledge of platforms like Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and various social media tools.
* Experience with marketing automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign).
* Familiarity with **gamification marketing** and how to apply it in digital strategies.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to analyze marketing data and provide actionable insights.
* Creative mindset with a passion for innovation in marketing.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Experience in multi-channel marketing campaigns across various industries.
* Graphic design skills and familiarity with tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (a plus).

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for professional development and growth
* A collaborative and dynamic team culture

Join our team and contribute to innovative digital marketing campaigns that drive results!

title: Corporate Traveler - Marketing Coordinator - New York, NY
description:
**Apply now**


**Job no:** 523169  

**Brand:** Corporate Traveler (US)  

**Work type:** Full time  

**Location:** New York  

**Categories:** Marketing, Web, Creative & UX, Corporate & Group Travel  


**Marketing Coordinator**



A world where tech and people work collectively to make corporate travel simpler, faster and easier.



Corporate Traveler is one of Flight Centre Travel Group’s (FCTG) most successful brands, globally. Our mission is to dominate the SME market, making the end-to-end travel experience faster, simpler and easier for our customers and to demonstrate ongoing value to decision-makers, travelers and bookers. We provide our customers with the perfect blend of personal, local service blended with our expert technology suite and the great choice and value which comes with being part of the FCTG family. For decades, we’ve been helping go-getter businesses grow through travel.



Corporate Traveler has offices across a global network that spans Australia, Canada, USA, UK, South Africa and New Zealand. The brand has been part of the Flight Centre Travel Group for more than 26 years and is a key contributor to the ongoing strength of FCTG’s corporate travel division. Award winning, forward thinking and fun to work for – this is a business for people who love travel, are team players and customer service oriented.



To learn more about Corporate Traveler please click HERE


**About The Opportunity**



Corporate Traveler USA is seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Marketing Coordinator to join our marketing team. The Marketing Coordinator will play a critical role in supporting the development and execution of marketing strategies and campaigns that drive brand awareness, engagement, and business growth. This role requires a creative thinker with strong organization, excellent communication, and great collaboration skills.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Support the marketing leads in establishing and evaluating marketing strategy by assembling performance reports and managing budget tracking and reporting.
* Assist in the creation and coordination of content in partnership with the content team, including blogs, emails, and other marketing materials, ensuring alignment with our brand messaging.
* Support the growth of partner marketing initiatives, including managing affiliate relationships, tracking performance, and optimizing campaigns.
* Collaborate with the product marketing team to support product launches, messaging, and promotional activities.
* Assist in managing and optimizing digital channels, including website content updates, SEO initiatives, and performance tracking.
* Coordinate product, event, or content email marketing campaigns, including copy development, scheduling, testing, and database management.
* Assist with developing paid and organic content, including webinars, thought leadership, research reports, and more.
* Maintain inventory of sales support materials, ensuring all are current and accurate, and coordinate the creation of new materials when necessary.
* Support the coordination and execution of marketing events, including overseeing logistics, managing registrations, coordinating with vendors, creating itineraries, and ordering marketing collateral.
* Assist with budgeting and invoicing for marketing activities, ensuring accurate tracking and reporting.


**Experience & Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* 1-3 years of experience in marketing or a related field, preferably in a B2B environment.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing channels including content marketing and email marketing.
* Experience in content creation and management, including writing, editing, and collaborating with content teams.
* Familiarity with partner marketing and experience in managing affiliate or partner relationships is a plus.
* Proficiency in marketing tools and platforms such as Google Analytics, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), and email marketing platforms (e.g., Eloqua)
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, generate insights, and make data-driven recommendations.
* Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus.
* Ability to work collaboratively across teams, demonstrating strong interpersonal skills and a proactive attitude.
* Experience with budget management and reporting is an advantage.


**Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:**



FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.


* **Enjoy the freedom and flexibility** of a hybrid work structure that combines both remote and in-person work.
* **Have fun:** At the heart of everything we do at Flight Centre is a desire to have fun.
* **Reward & Recognition:** Celebrate the success of yourself and others at our regular Buzz Nights and at the annual Global Gathering - You'll have to experience it to believe it!
* **Use your smarts:** Our people use their quick thinking, expertise, and tenacity to always figure things out.
* **Love for travel:** We were founded by people who wanted to travel and want others to do the same. That passion is something you can’t miss in our people or service.
* **Personal connections:** We are a big business founded on personal relationships.
* **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
* Diversity Day: paid leave to observe holiday or cultural celebration of your choice
* Employee Resource Groups (Racial Equity, Gender Equity, LGBTQ2IA+, Accessibility, Environmental Justice)
* DEI education
* Commitment to fair practices such as regular equity assessments and inclusive recruitment protocols
* **A career, not a job:** We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve
* **We back our people all the way:** We are strongly committed to supporting every single employee in their professional and personal development.
* **Giving Back:** Proud Corporate Social Responsibility program supporting nominated charities through volunteering and fundraising.
* Office Environmental Program
* Many of our offices are Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED®) Gold certified buildings
* 1 Volunteer Day per Calendar Year


**Benefits Include:**


* Paid Time Off \\*
* Up to 15 Vacation Days accrued per year - prorated upon hire and increased by tenure after 2 years of employment (up to 25 days)
* 5 Sick Days accrued per year
* 3 Personal Days
* 1 Diversity Day
* 1 Volunteer Day
* 8 Recognized Holidays
* Travel perks/discounts
* Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
* National/International Award Nights and Conferences
* Health benefits including, medical, dental, vision, gender affirming care, and fertility care
* Insurance including hospital indemnity, AD&D, critical illness, long-term and short-term disability
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401k program with partial match
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Employee Share Plan – Ability to purchase company stock on Australian Stock Exchange with partial company match, subject to terms and conditions
* Global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses


* Vacation, Personal, and Sick time accrual rates will vary based on full-time or part-time employee status. Recognized Holidays are either paid time off or, if required to work due to job requirements, holiday pay rate, and may vary depending on state.



#LI-DE1#CTUS#LI-Hybrid



Location – New York, NY



If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then .



This role can be performed onsite or on a hybrid schedule, in compliance with the Company’s Remote and Flexible Work Policy.



For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $65,000. Base salary is dependent on relevant factors, including experience, geographic location, and job requirements.



We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.



Our number one philosophy? Our people. Flight Centre Travel Group USA’s promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversity of our society.



We are an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment process. title: Assistant Studio Manager
description:
**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun.**  

A little quiz: What do Batman and Robin, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Hermoine Granger and Harry Potter, and Venus and Serena Williams have in common?  

Answer: Each member of the pair makes the other stronger.  

That’s how it is with an Orangetheory Studio Manager and Assistant Studio Manager (ASM). They’re a doublet, a duo, a dyad. And while the manager is ultimately in charge, without that able-bodied sidekick, the studio wouldn’t run nearly as smoothly.  

So if you’d like to be half of such a pair, to know the ropes as well as you know your members’ names, to step in when your manager steps out, to balance each other’s strengths, to set goals and surpass them...then Orangetheory just might be looking for you.  

Every day will be different but, you’ll be representing the Orangetheory brand as you share the science of this workout you want everyone to love as much as you do.  

Maybe you’ll use this post as a stepping stone in your management career or maybe this is where you want to be forever. But if you’ve been at even one Orangetheory class, you feel the warmth, the enthusiasm, the genuine sense of being where you need to be — feelings you’ll be hard-pressed to find anywhere but here.  

  

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between Orangetheory studio locations and more details can be provided by the studio’s hiring manager if you are selected to move forward in the interview process.  

Acknowledgement \\*



I understand that I am applying for a position with an employer that is an independently owned and operated Orangetheory® Fitness franchisee, not the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF). With respect to any position with a franchisee, I understand and agree that any information I provide in this application will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all employment related matters in their studio. This means, among other things, that the independent franchisee is solely responsible for and unilaterally makes all decisions concerning my employment, including hiring, firing, discipline, supervision, staffing and scheduling. OTFF will not receive a copy of my application, will have no control over whether I receive an interview and/or am ultimately hired, does not control and is not responsible for the employment policies and practices of independent franchisees, and does not employ independent franchisee’s employees. If I am hired to work at an independent franchisee’s studio, the independent franchisee, and not OTFF, will be my employer. By submitting my application and resume, I am confirming that I am agreeing and consenting to the foregoing.



Orangetheory values your privacy, so we want to keep you informed as to how your personal information is handled. With respect to the personal information you provided in this application, that information will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all privacy and data protection matters related to their studio. For any inquiries regarding how the independent franchisee may collect and process your personal information, please refer to that franchisee’s privacy policy or contact them directly. For all other information about how the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF), may collect and process personal information, please https://www.orangetheory.com/en-us/privacy-policy.

**RiseWell Community Services is seeking Full-Time Licensed Master Social Worker to join as the Program Supervisor of the Community Oriented Recovery and Empowerment (CORE) program**

Possession of valid NYS LMSW license during employment. Minimum 3 years of experience in a treatment or rehabilitation setting. Valid and clean NY State driver license, fingerprinting, criminal record check, and approval from NYS required.

**JOB FUNCTION:**

Supervision of non-clinical Community Oriented Recovery and Empowerment (CORE) staff who provide services to eligible adults with mental illness/ and/or substance use disorder in their own home, community and telehealth.

There are other job functions such as:

Running monthly reports, completing intakes, coordinating referrals, etc.

**We Offer a wide range of rewarding employment opportunities along with a generous benefits package. We offer the following to eligible Employees:**

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

**ABOUT US:**

Founded in 1972, RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is an innovative, multi-service, community-based social wellness agency. title: Pest Technician Trainee - Hiring Now!
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**Creepy crawlies and contented customers. Intrigued?** **You might be just who we're looking for.**  
Busting bugs has its benefits. Company-provided truck, gas, and phone. Benefits including a 401(k) with a company match. Amazing earning potential. But it’s more than that. It’s serving with a smile. It’s having your teammates’ backs. It’s going above and beyond and making a difference. We step in and step up when people have problems they can’t fix, and they need the pros. We crush their pest problems and lift their spirits.

Back to you. Are you a hard worker? Can you follow direction, adapt to change, and solve problems? Are you organized, friendly, and motivated to succeed? That’s a great place to start.

**As a Pest Control Technician, here’s what you can expect** 

* You won’t be tied to a desk. You’ll be out and about — mobile, independent, and growing your career with a clear view of next steps. You’ll be the face of Terminix to your local community (with the backing of a national brand), and your clients will count on you to protect their businesses, their homes, and their families.
* When you first join Terminix Nation, you’ll spend a few months in training. Once you’ve got that and some state required licenses and certificates under your belt, you’ll take the lead with your own customers.
* You’ll get rewarded with competitive pay and robust benefits to cover you and your family. As a teammate, you will be eligible for a 401(k) with company match, company-paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, and a generous student loan repayment program. You put in the work, and you’ll reap the rewards.
* You’ll be part of a community — bonus points if you’re already a leader in yours. Our bonds are strong at Terminix Nation and the relationships we develop in the communities we serve are unparalleled. Our teammates give back through volunteering, donations, scholarships, and more.
* You’ll be onboarded and trained by the best of ‘em. You’ll get paid to get licensed, something you’ll have for a lifetime. You’ll know how to bust bugs at home, too.

**What your days will look like**

* Roll up your sleeves and get ready to learn how we take care of customers. You’ll become an expert in applying our company products so they’re safe and effective.
* Are you a good driver? As a technician, your office is the cab of your Terminix truck. You’ll use it on calls and take it home, too. Same goes for your Terminix phone. We trust our technicians.
* You’ll be responsible for building relationships with customers, scheduling and confirming their appointments, helping with sales to current customers, and expanding our product to new customers.
* Does technology scare you? That’s okay. We provide training and support to ensure you’re comfortable using state-of-the-art tools. You’ll also need to have strong communication skills so that you can email, text, call, talk, and write effectively. Oh, and sometimes there’s paperwork.
* There’s an opportunity to grow into a role you’re passionate about and fits your skillset — whether that’s management, a move to sales, or another opportunity at Terminix.

**Some non-negotiables**  
There are some things you’ll just need to have or know to join Terminix Nation as a Pest Control Technician.

* High school diploma or GED; or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Solid reading, writing, and verbal communication skills and the ability to present information in both internal and external settings.
* Some basic math skills — add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. You’ll need to be able to follow instructions for mixing on product labels.
* With the help of Terminix (and with the company footing the bill), you’ll need to maintain the licenses/certificates as required by federal, state, and/or local regulations. And you’ll need a valid driver’s license.

**Straight talk about the physical demands of our work**  
We’re not going to sugarcoat it. The essential functions of this job have some physical demands (of course, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.) Here’s what we mean:

* You’ve got to be able to move up to 10 lbs. regularly and 11–20 lbs. frequently, whether that’s lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.
* You’ll move around a lot — regularly sitting, climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and crawling. You’ll go up and down stairs, ladders, scaffolding, ramps, and poles. And you’ll need to keep your balance when walking, standing, or crouching on narrow, slippery, or moving surfaces. (You’ll definitely get your steps in.)
* You must be able to safely operate a motor vehicle and make sure it and all other equipment is kept clean.
* The vision to perform detail-oriented activities at distances close to the eyes or within arm’s reach.
* Sometimes you’ll need to wear personal protective equipment (PPE), like an OSHA-compliant respirator, and you’ll need to be okay with regularly working in confined spaces, narrow aisles, or passageways (you know, where critters live).

**Work conditions**  
Pests don’t always live in nice places — and that’s where we do our work. But don’t worry – we’ll prepare you with all you need to do the work as safely and as comfortably as possible.

* You’ll need to be able to work both inside and outside in your local climate in company-provided weather gear.
* You’ll sometimes be working around mechanical parts, vehicles, electrical current, heights and scaffolding, fumes, dust, and chemicals, and we’ll train you how to handle all of these conditions safely.
* This is kind of a no-brainer — you’ll be around animals and insects.
* And you’ll have to be okay with working in tight, confined spaces, narrow aisles, or passageways — like you might find in crawl spaces. We work where the critters live.

To join Terminix Nation, you’ll need to meet state and federal regulations and company safety requirements.

This position offers a base pay plus commission.

· $18.00 - $22.00 during training

**Why Choose Us?**

A career with the Rentokil family of companies can be a professional trajectory filled with opportunity. We pride ourselves on being a world-class team that rewards high performance, and we love to promote from within. We offer competitive pay and many of our roles offer performance incentives.

Below you'll find information about some of what we have to offer. All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits after they meet certain criteria.

Click here to read more about our Total Rewards Program which includes: 

**Professional and Personal Growth**

* Multiple avenues to grow your career
* Training and development programs available
* Tuition Reimbursement benefits (for FT Colleagues)

**Health and Wellness**

* Full-time colleagues are eligible to begin enrollment immediately upon hire with benefits starting on day 1
* Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance plus much more

**Savings and Retirement**

* 401(k) retirement plan with company-matching contributions

**Work-Life Balance**

* Vacation days & sick days
* Company-paid holidays & floating holidays
* A company mindset that prioritizes health, safety, and flexibility

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you?

This company is a Drug Free workplace.

**Our companies are proud to be Affirmative Action (AA) and Equal Opportunity Employers (EOE) inclusive of veterans and those with disabilities.**

title: Hosts/Runners (Part-Time St. James Theater)
description:
**COMPANY AND POSITION OVERVIEW**



Are You a Theatre Enthusiast with a Passion for Hosting? A leading Broadway theatre owner-operator is looking for enthusiastic **Hosts/Runners** who live and breathe theatre. Join our team and play a crucial role in creating unforgettable experiences for our guests.



The role of **Host/Runner** will consist of greeting and escorting VIP guests to their tables in one of our VIP Lounges, collaborating with the Customer Experience Director and Bar team to provide an excellent experience for our VIPs in one of our exclusive Lounges. Monitoring the Lounges, overseeing staff, and ensuring a courteous and efficient operation to guarantee guest satisfaction are key elements of this role. You will also manage Lounge lines and provide service in line with ATG Entertainment's Core Values and Commitments.



Join a high-energy, detail-focused team that plays a crucial role in the smooth operation of one of our five theatres (the St. James, the Al Hirschfeld, the August Wilson, the Eugene O’Neill, or the Walter Kerr) and the attractions within. You'll be part of a collaborative, respectful, and driven company dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences for both theatergoers and theatre-makers on Broadway.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Greet and escort guests to tables in one of our VIP Lounges.
* Monitor dining and lounge areas, ensuring a courteous and efficient operation.
* Oversee staff and guest interactions to maintain high standards of service and satisfaction.
* Previous experience in a restaurant environment is preferred.
* Knowledge of food and sanitation standards is desirable.
* Ability to walk up and down stairs and stand for extended periods.
* Capability to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.


**Personal Attributes***:*


* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Flexibility and a positive attitude towards diverse work situations.
* Ability to handle colleague and team interactions with patience and tact.
* Motivated problem-solver with a “find the yes” approach for both internal and external partners.
* Resourceful team player who can work independently and take initiative.
* Commitment to diversity and fostering an inclusive and respectful environment.


**Bonus Skills:**


* Food Handler’s and TIPs certification
* Being multilingual is a plus.


**Commitment**


* Must be available to work nights, weekends, and holidays.


**Compensation**


* Hourly rate: $19 per hour.


**About ATG Entertainment:** ATG Entertainment leads the live entertainment industry, delivering exceptional performances and hospitality across our landmark venues. We manage 64 venues across Britain, the US, and Germany, and process over 18 million tickets annually. Our in-house production team, ATG Productions, creates critically acclaimed work for Broadway, the West End, and beyond.


**Our Values:** We are Ambitious, Collaborative, Passionate, and Smart.


* Ambitious: We strive to exceed expectations.
* Collaborative: We support each other to reach our goals.
* Passionate: We love our work, business, and industry.
* Smart: We seek simple, efficient, and innovative solutions.


**Website Resources**



https://www.jujamcyn.com/ https://careers.broadway/


*ATG Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.*

title: White Glove Support Specialist
description:
**Job Title : White Glove Support Specialist**

**Location : NYC, NY (Onsite)**

**Duration : 12 Months** 

**Job Description**

We are seeking a highly skilled IT White Glove Support Specialist to provide top-tier technical support at our NYC office, where our senior executives are based. This role requires exceptional customer service skills, technical expertise, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

**Responsibilities**

* Provide high-quality, personalized IT support to the CEO and senior executives.
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues promptly.
* Set up and configure devices, including laptops, mobile phones, and tablets.
* Ensure seamless operation of video conferencing and presentation systems.
* Manage and support office IT infrastructure, including printers, network devices, and security systems.
* Maintain detailed records of support requests and resolutions.
* Collaborate with the broader IT team to implement and support new technologies.
* Conduct regular system audits and updates to ensure optimal performance and security.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT support, with at least 2 years in a white glove support role.
* Strong knowledge of Windows and macOS operating systems.
* Proficiency in supporting Microsoft Office Suite, email clients, and other productivity tools.
* Experience with mobile device management (MDM) and remote support tools.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and handle high-pressure situations with professionalism.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Certifications such as CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), or Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) are a plus.

Job Type: Contract

Shift:

* Day shift

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10001 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10001: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Front of Desk Fitness Sales Associate
description:
**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun!**  

  

If you mention fitness within moments of meeting someone...if you encourage friends and family to get off the couch and get active...if you know and enthusiastically share the importance of fitness as a part of a healthy lifestyle - well, we just may want you to turn your passion for fitness into a paying career.  

We’re looking for enthusiastic individuals eager to share our story and our success with everyone who walks through that door or who calls for more information or who expresses even the slightest bit of interest in improving themselves.  

Are you passionate, positive, and can talk to anyone? Do you thrive on being part of a team? Does your zest for being part of a world-class growing fitness company get you out of bed with a smile and determination to change more lives - physically, mentally, emotionally? Do you have excellent communication skills, whether face-to-face or on paper?  

Then keep reading. Here’s more of what the position entails:  

* Greeting everyone who enters the studio with enthusiasm, energy and knowledge
* Presenting the OTF concept to any interested consumers, also known as “intros”
* Working at our front desk which includes answering phones and talking to members among other tasks
* Giving studio tours
* Working hand-in-hand with trainers to guide intros through their first Orangetheory workout
* Selling memberships to help the studio thrive
* Following up on prospective clients
* Handling members’ concerns in a professional and objective manner with the goal of resolution
* Participating in marketing and outreach events
* Ensuring all areas of the studio are kept clean and organized

So if you have a passion for fitness and would like to help us in our mission to spread More Life to our members and community, we would like to hear from YOU!  

  

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between Orangetheory studio locations and more details can be provided by the studio’s hiring manager if you are selected to move forward in the interview process.  

Acknowledgement \\*



I understand that I am applying for a position with an employer that is an independently owned and operated Orangetheory® Fitness franchisee, not the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF). With respect to any position with a franchisee, I understand and agree that any information I provide in this application will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all employment related matters in their studio. This means, among other things, that the independent franchisee is solely responsible for and unilaterally makes all decisions concerning my employment, including hiring, firing, discipline, supervision, staffing and scheduling. OTFF will not receive a copy of my application, will have no control over whether I receive an interview and/or am ultimately hired, does not control and is not responsible for the employment policies and practices of independent franchisees, and does not employ independent franchisee’s employees. If I am hired to work at an independent franchisee’s studio, the independent franchisee, and not OTFF, will be my employer. By submitting my application and resume, I am confirming that I am agreeing and consenting to the foregoing.



Orangetheory values your privacy, so we want to keep you informed as to how your personal information is handled. With respect to the personal information you provided in this application, that information will be submitted directly to the independent franchisee, who is solely responsible for all privacy and data protection matters related to their studio. For any inquiries regarding how the independent franchisee may collect and process your personal information, please refer to that franchisee’s privacy policy or contact them directly. For all other information about how the franchisor, OTF Franchisor, LLC or any of its affiliates (OTFF), may collect and process personal information, please https://www.orangetheory.com/en-us/privacy-policy.
company_description: MORE results. MORE confidence. MORE Life. More than a gym. Because you shouldn’t live to exercise. You should exercise to live.

title: Program Aide (GDH)
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**

High School diploma or GED equivalent and dependable with regard to time frameworks. Able to assist residents in maintaining well kept personal hygiene and able to deal directly with issues of resident grooming. Able to travel on public transportation. Ability to write reports. Must be able to lift at least 40 lbs.

**Additional Desired Qualifications**  
Bilingual (Spanish/English). One year experience as a personal care worker or in the field of home care. Valid New York City driver’s license. Certified in basic First Aid and CPR, Food Handlers Certification. Experience working with older adults, formerly homeless, or the mentally ill.

**Job Description**  
This position reports to the Shift Supervisor. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

· Escort residents to/from meetings, doctor visits, etc.

· Assist residents with self-administration of medication (prompting resident of time, logging medication in book, opening container).

· Supervise residents in maintaining well-kept personal hygiene including grooming (care of hair, ordinary care of nails, teeth, mouth, and shaving).

· Conduct daily bed/bath check; make regular rounds in facility.

· Light cleaning of residents’ rooms, bathrooms and kitchen.

· Aid in preparation and serving of food, and in cleaning of dining area after meals.

· Participate in weekly program aide meetings and occasional staff meetings/trainings

· Plan and lead group work activity with residents (e.g., birthday party celebrations, holiday events, current events, arts & crafts, etc.)

· Keep a running inventory of linens, property storage, hygiene kits and record archives.

· Distribute hygiene kits, laundry detergent and other supplies to clients as needed.

· Assist in providing crisis intervention when necessary

· Prepare incident reports.

· Update client attendance and report changes to DHS at census (as applicable).

· Be available to cover other shifts on an emergency basis.

· Take on Acting Shift Supervisor duties temporarily.

· Other duties as needed.

\\*\\*\\*Multiple shifts available (3pm-11pm, 11pm-7am)

title: Daycare Teacher
description:
Join Our Team at The Learning Experience of Livingston!

We are currently on the lookout for nurturing infant, toddler and preschool teachers to join our TLE family! With a strong and experienced team in place, we are excited to add new members to our growing school!

**We are independently owned and operated by two caring franchisees, with locations in Livingston, Cedar Grove, Bloomfield, South Orange, Roseland. We are hiring across all six locations in our infant, toddler and preschool rooms (positions will vary among locations).** If you're interested in any of these locations or other age groups, please reach out and we'll be happy to find you position that best suits your needs!

Learn more about us at https://thelearningexperience.com

*All of our administration teams began their careers in the classroom. We believe it is important to promote from within our company and advance our people's careers.*

If you are passionate about early childhood education, we would love to hear from you. Get in touch for more information or to apply!

Thank you for considering The Learning Experience. Let's make a difference together!

Salary: $37,440.00 - $43,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Affordable Health Insurance (optional)
* Dental/Vision (full automatic coverage)
* Life Insurance
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* 3-6 hour shift (afternoons only)

**We're not simply seeking to fill positions; we're on the lookout for exceptional individuals dedicated to Early Childhood Education. If you're fueled by passion and motivated to propel your career forward, we encourage you to apply.**

* Life insurance

* Relocation assistance
* Tuition reimbursement

* 8 hour shift

Best,  
Liz

title: Associate Marketing Manager, Golf Digest
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Your New Role...**


The Associate Marketing Manager will join the Golf Digest Marketing team and is responsible for the development of media and sponsorship packages for our commercial revenue line of business.

 **Your Role Accountabilities...**

* Develop revenue-generating, multi-platform sponsorship proposals for the marketplace and specific clients
* Create compelling, persuasive presentations and decks to pitch new ideas, plans and partnerships to potential advertising sales clients
* Collaborate with internal teams such as editorial, video production, and events to develop innovative and creative solutions that build on the Golf Digest brand equity
* Oversee creation of market/category specific marketing collateral (i.e. audience one-sheets) for sales to communicate with current and prospective clients
* Partner with the strategy and insights team for category, market and golf specific research to position Golf Digest as the golf media market leader

**Qualifications & Experiences...**

* A minimum of 2+ years of working in linear and digital advertising sales marketing and/or relevant integrated marketing experience (such as advertising agency, media sales/marketing, event marketing, client side marketing)
* Ability to think creatively and innovatively
* Ability to project manage/prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong communication skills, and comfortable promoting the merits of new ideas to multiple stakeholders
* Demonstrated self-starter with the ability to meet deadlines and thrive independently in a fast paced environment
* Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
* Familiarity with Keynote and Microsoft Suite
* Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, communications or a related field, or equivalent combination of skills, training and experience is required.
* Experience in Sports and/or Golf is preferred

 **How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $52,500.00 - $97,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: HoH Social Programmer (Temporary)
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Your New Role**

**House of Highlights** is a key part of the Bleacher Report/Turner Sports portfolio, representing one of the most influential media brands for the Gen-Z audience. With over 75 Million followers, HoH is the heartbeat of the Gen Z sports fan, who gravitate to the brand because of its authentic voice which remains celebratory, relatable and inclusive. Everything HoH does - from the original content we create, to our collaborations with leagues, creators and brands, to the viral clips we curate from across the world - aligns with these 3 core brand pillars, and it has created a connection with fans that feels more like a close friend than an inaccessible brand or publisher.


House of Highlights is seeking a Temp Social Programmer I who will work to curate content from multiple sources to post on our social accounts, with a primary focus on UGC content and TikTok output. The Social Programmer will be primarily responsible for surfacing, curating, packaging and distributing various types of social content, including captions.


An ideal candidate would be described as someone that is a fast learner, hustles like crazy, has ideas and isn’t afraid to share them or push the HoH voice in new exciting directions. The ideal candidate is fluent in all things NBA and demonstrated experience programming on TikTok, including editing.

**Your Role Accountabilities**

* Contribute to the daily programming of HoH social channels – discover and curate social content that aligns with the House of Highlight brand pillars and engages with the Gen Z audience
* Cover full slates of NBA game schedule, covering multiple games at once to find standout content
* Be a master of finding UGC and new content first
* Think creatively about new opportunities to create more of what we curate – identify emerging formats and packaging tactics that can help HoH grow in differentiated ways
* Work closely with other programmers to check copy and properly distribute content

**Qualifications & Experiences**

* Deep understanding of TikTok-native and IG-native content, trends and creators
* Deep understanding and passion for NBA, NBA Twitter and basketball culture
* A strong understanding of House of Highlights’ voice and brand
* Experience with social content discovery and an interest in emerging social platforms
* Ability to work nights and weekend hours
* A strong understanding of House of Highlights’ voice and brand

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**

Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

title: Urgent Care Nurse Practitioner (Accepting New Grads)
description:
This is a brand new facility opening in September. We only have day shifts available between the hours of 8am-8pm.

We are seeking a dedicated Nurse Practitioner to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong medical background and be capable of providing high-quality patient care in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

- Conduct comprehensive physical examinations on patients  
- Diagnose and treat common acute and chronic health conditions  
- Order, perform, and interpret diagnostic tests such as medical imaging and spinal taps  
- Develop and implement treatment plans  
- Administer medications and treatments as prescribed  
- Maintain accurate and detailed medical documentation using ICD-9 coding  
- Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure optimal patient care  
- Provide patient education on disease prevention and health maintenance

Skills:

- Proficient in medical documentation and electronic health records systems like Cerner  
- Knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathophysiology  
- Experience in memory care, pediatrics, and geriatrics  
- Ability to perform procedures like botulinum toxin treatments  
- Familiarity with lifting techniques for patient care  
- Competency in diagnosing and treating various medical conditions  
- Understanding of medical terminology and pharmacology  
- Strong interpersonal skills for effective patient communication

If you are a compassionate Nurse Practitioner with a passion for delivering exceptional healthcare services, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and make a difference in the lives of our patients.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $139,952.41 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: 3rd-6th Academic Intervention Teacher Math
company: Bronx Academy of Promise Charter School
description:
**Academic Intervention Teacher – Math**

The mission of the Bronx Academy of Promise Charter School is to educate each student to high learning standards using a standards based curriculum that emphasizes information about the various career choices available to them. The school provides comprehensive academic curriculum with character and career education integrated into the subject areas.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

 Offering remediation services to students in grades K-8 in math

 Determining student eligibility based on NYS assessment scores.

 Preparing daily lessons plans.  
 Keeping data regarding attendance and progress.  
 Completing quarterly progress reports and mail out to parents.  
 Consulting with classroom teachers on material being taught and student progress.  
 Assisting teachers in long and short range planning and scheduling.  
 Collaborating with classroom teachers within a “push-in” model to promote academic growth.  
 Keeping the Principal updated on progress of students.

Qualified Applicants must be:

 NYS certified. (Math or Special Education a plus)  
 Experienced in providing small group instruction to struggling students  
 Experienced in creating a curriculum that attends to the individual needs of students  
 Experienced with differentiated instruction and using data to help support that instruction.  
 Experienced with common core standards and NYS assessments.
