title: Project Manager
description:
Job Summary:

Memor NYC (Memor Museum), a company specializing in the promotion and exhibition

of Asian art and cultures, is seeking a skilled Project Manager to join the team. In this

role, you will serve as a strategic partner to the President of the company on project-

based planning, strategies and implementation. You will collaborate closely with

management and other staff personnel to lead museum project and event initiatives,

support start-up company development and ensure alignment with budgetary and

resource goals and values. This position is on-site at our New York City office with

occasional opportunity for remote work. This position requires full professional working

proficiency in Mandarin.

Project Manager Responsibilities:

 Lead planning, design, development and implementation of on-site Museum

projects, events and activities in collaboration with local and international teams

 Build and manage the relationships with cultural organizations, artists and

vendors

 Manage and present project budgets with understanding of risk and resource

management

 Serve as communicator and liaison between museum president and other team

members regarding project progress, vendor collaboration and logistic details

 Oversee related staff members in allocating tasks and ensuring deadline adherence

 Conduct internal assessments of project organizational and resource development

needs; put forth solution-oriented proposals to ensure smooth project delivery

 Deliver results on timely basis and respond to upper management with sense of

urgency and appropriate follow-through

Required Qualifications & Skills

 Minimum of a BS/BA and minimum 3-5 years overall experience in a Project

Management/Event Planning role

 Excellent communication, leadership and interpersonal skills to reach short and

long-term goals in project success and annual company growth

 Experience in leading a diverse team with broad and detailed perspectives on

project scope and logistic implementation

 General understanding or experience in social media, PR and event-related

promotional activities in addition to logistic planning, preferred

 Work experiences or knowledge in the museum, entertainment or event planning

industry, preferred

 Work experiences or knowledge in start-up companies, preferred

 Must be proficient in Mandarin

About the Company

Memor NYC is a Manhattan-based company dedicated to sharing and presenting Asian

cultures to the general public through special exhibitions, interactive cultural relic IPs and

community-oriented events. Pioneering local and international museum experiences at

the intersection of art, culture and technology, Memor NYC is currently preparing to

establish Memor Museum on the Upper East Side.

Pay range in New York, NY

Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location..

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Language:

* Mandarin and English (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10028 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Immediate Opening 2024-25 NY Math Teacher Middle School Grade 5-6
description:
**School Year**: 2024-25


**Immediate Opening:**


**Teaching at Achievement First:**



Achievement First invites passionate educators to apply for the Teacher position. Teaching at Achievement First is an ideal position for an educator with deep passion for instruction who is eager to gain rigorous development to help perfect their craft. In addition to participating in weekly professional development and team planning meetings, teachers receive consistent high-impact coaching and feedback from a school administrator or teacher-leader. Furthermore, Achievement First has launched Teacher Career Pathway, a systematic, coordinated approach to recognizing and developing our teachers as they progress through five career stages.



These stages were developed to celebrate excellent teachers and are accompanied by increased compensation, recognition and professional development opportunities. Achievement First is committed to recruiting, developing and retaining excellent teachers.



Here, you will be the driver of high-quality instruction that enables our scholars to develop a lifelong love of learning. You will be your students' champion who believes all students are capable of greatness and achievement far beyond what society has been conditioned to accept. You will be a demander of excellence for yourself, and your students, an educator who helps create a vibrant school community where students have the type of powerful school experience that fosters their best and most thoughtful work.


**Responsibilities of Achievement First Teachers will include but are not limited to:**


**Outstanding academic achievement and personal development**


* Create a positive, achievement-oriented and structured learning environment that excites and invests students to reach ambitious goals.
* Build classroom community by partnering with families to facilitate children's academic success and personal development.
* Utilize data from Achievement First's interim assessments to drive instruction and intervention.
* Design and implement unit and lesson plans in collaboration with grade or subject team.
* Exemplify AF's core values in all interactions with students, families and colleagues.


**Professional learning, development and growth**


* Collaborate with coach, grade-level chair and school team to improve instructional, culture-building and leadership skills.
* Attend all professional development, team planning and data analysis meetings.
* Participate enthusiastically in structured and informal learning and development opportunities.


**Skills and Characteristics**


* Strong instructional and classroom management skills.
* High level of personal organization and planning.
* Team player: maturity, humility, strong work ethic, follow-through, sense of humor, willingness to respond positively to feedback and a "roll-up-my-sleeves" attitude.
* Strong belief in the Achievement First mission, core values, and educational model.
* Mastery of and enthusiasm for subject matter.


**Educational Background and Work Experience**


* Two years of teaching experience preferred with a proven record of high student achievement.
* Bachelor's degree with a GPA of at least 3.0; Master's degree preferred.
	+ *If your GPA is* *between 2.75 and 3.0, you may submit additional recommendations to be considered*.
* New York certified or in process of obtaining a certification.
	+ **NY:** If you are not yet certified, you may learn more about the process at http://eservices.nysed.gov/teach/certhelp/CertRequirementHelp.do

**Compensation & Benefits**


* Employees at Achievement First are provided with a competitive salary. Our salaries are set through a lens of equity, and based on an individual's skills, education, and years of experience relevant to the role. Elementary Teachers' salaries range from $66,000 - $113,198, based on lead teaching experience.
* As a regular full time employee of Achievement First, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as a 403(b) retirement benefit package with match and paid Family Leave.
  


#ZR


Achievement First is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply. Spanish language proficiency is a plus. You can learn more about diversity at Achievement First here: http://achievementfirst.org/about-us/diversity/

title: Retail Store Manager
description:
**Company Overview:** 

Party City Holdco Inc. (PCHI) is a global leader in the celebrations industry, with its offerings spanning more than 70 countries around the world. Party City is the largest retailer of party goods in North America.

PCHI operates across multiple businesses within its Retail Division and Consumer Products Division. On the retail side, Party City (partycity.com) is the leading omnichannel retailer in the celebrations category, operating more than 750 company-owned and franchise stores. The Consumer Products Division includes design and manufacturing entity Amscan, an industry leader in celebration décor, tableware, costumes, and accessories.

PCHI is headquartered in Woodcliff Lake, N.J. with additional locations throughout the Americas and Asia.

**COME JOIN THE PARTY**

At PCHI we create joy for our customers by making it easy to create unforgettable memories. We are C*ustomer Obsessed.* Our Store Team Leader's lead by example and possess the energy and enthusiasm to match our customers excitement while providing an exceptional shopping experience. We are knowledgeable about our products and services because we have the broadest and best selection of party goods in the industry. We ensure we are in-stock and easy to shop. We inspire our customers with exciting concepts, themes, ideas and provide everything they need to bring their party to life.

At PCHI, our promise is *Customer First*, *People Matter*, *It Can Be Done* and *Celebrate*! We live our brand every day and love to party!

**Responsibilities and Duties:**

**CUSTOMER-FIRST! (BRING OUR SERVICE MODEL TO LIFE-FRIENDLY, EASY, ACCURATE)**

* You will deliver an exceptional Customer experience by ensuring we have the right Team Members in place through the selection, training, and development of your team.
* You will cultivate an 'It can be done' attitude with your team when it comes to overcoming obstacles and inspiring joy for our Customers.
* You will be responsible for providing the ultimate balloon experience for our Customers.
* You will be responsible for executing best in class sales and service strategies along with delivering on sales, profit, and service targets, as well as delivering on all key talent strategies.
* You will reinforce exceptional Customer service behaviors delivered by your team through accountability, recognition, and praise.
* You will provide value to Customers by delivering a Customer friendly in-store and curbside shopping experience.
* You will leverage technology to enhance the Customer service experience for both our internal and external Customers.
* You will enable the store team to thrive in an environment of frequent change through establishing a culture of inspiration and commitment to the organization's goals and strategies.

**Leadership Influence:**

**DRIVE SALES AND OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY**

* You will lead an operationally efficient store, enabling a sales and service culture.
* You will provide services and solutions that drive Customer loyalty.
* You will deliver an outstanding Customer experience by focusing on our service model (Friendly, Easy and Accurate).
* You will always prioritize Customer interactions over tasks.

**Skills Required:**

**CULTIVATE A CUSTOMER CENTRIC/ENGAGED TEAM**

* You have full accountability for hiring, training, coaching, and developing the store team to ensure they do what's right for our Customers.
* You are responsible for creating an environment that promotes Team Member engagement and retention.
* You will invest in training strategies/initiatives to enhance skill and capabilities.
* You will create sustainable Talent Plans to fuel continued team growth.
* Your role is critical in executing our company's purpose, promise and priorities that are focused on our internal and external Customers!

**Business Acumen:**

**RESULTS MATTER!**

* You will leverage and understand all your business reports to make daily decisions.
* You will drive sales growth in core businesses, balloons and omni services.
* You will oversee all aspects of merchandising and inventory replenishment.
* You are responsible for managing payroll and store profitability.
* You are responsible for store planning, scheduling, and task prioritization.

**Qualifications:**

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* The replenishment process will require you to lift, push and pull up to 25lbs daily.
* Cleaning, store recovery, setting plan-o-grams and endcap maintenance is required.
* Climbing ladders is required to re-stock and obtain merchandise for our customers.
* Ringing transactions on a register is required.
* Utilization of our helium system to fulfill customer orders is required.

**Expected Salary Range: $70,000 to $87,000**

**The salary range offered for this position is a good faith description of the expected salary range this role will pay. PCHI reserves the right to pay more or less than the stated range based on a variety of factors such as experience, geography, etc.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $87,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

description:

description:

title: Gelato / Ice Cream Chef
description:
**Position: Gelato Chef/Ice Cream Maker for Venchi Store at Roosevelt Field Mall**

**Salary: $17.50/hr +$5-$10 tips** 

Venchi has grown to be a ‘premium Italian Chocolate and gelato brand’ with over 130 stores worldwide. We have an ambitious plan to continue this growth story and invite you to join us on our journey...

**Our mission:**

‘To bring the flavor of the Italian Allegria to the world, creating every day unforgettable moments of sharing and celebration’

We feature fresh, daily made gelato, lavish and natural chocolates, skilfully crafted coffees, and many other treats. Our attention to detail, and personal touch is what makes our chocolate so important.

**Our Values:**

Heritage – 100% Italian 100% Global

Allegria – Live the Italian Way

Balance – Unwarp positivity

**Your role:**

The **Gelato / Ice Cream Maker** works as part of a team to ensure all gelato meets Venchi standards and is consistently delicious. The Gelato Maker is responsible for producing and maintaining the standard of gelato in the shop. **You are an integral part of the shop team**. We are seeking a Gelato / Ice Cream Maker who is motivated to work in a fast paced, busy environment; ideally, someone who is comfortable working in a kitchen and being around food. This job requires a lot of attention to detail.

**In Summary**

* Ensure all gelato is prepared, displayed, and sold according to Venchi standards
* You must ensure that the maintenance of the gelato equipment is to the required Health and Safety standards.
* Work with Store Manager to coordinate ordering ingredients, stock control, and rotation.
* Follow up on orders and stock, adjusting orders if required before the deadlines.
* Report any issues to the Store and Area Manager.
* Be aware of gelato sales within your shop.
* Test, clean, and order the required parts when needed.
* Take ownership of the compilation of the HACCP manual, temperature, lotto records, and stock rotation following the FIFO principle.
* Ensure all deliveries are checked correctly and all discrepancies are being notified and reported.
* Follow the gelato production setting standards and guidelines

**A few key skills that the role requires…**

* Knowledge of Food and Safety regulations or certification preferred
* Comfortable working Back of House / Kitchen area
* Ability to work independently and be self-motivated
* Must be a quick learner, have a positive can-do attitude
* Ability to multitask
* Organized
* Friendly and Energetic
* Willing to be a team player

**Benefits**

At Venchi, we recognize the hard work and commitment that is required to succeed in your role, which is why we pride ourselves in offering the following benefits to all of our employees;

* $5-$10 tips on average earned per hour (\\*Tips not guaranteed, subject to vary)
* Employee incentive program that rewards hard work, support, and commitment
* Flexible working schedule to match your commitments
* Employee Discounts: Free gelato, coffee, or crepe during shift & 30% off Venchi products. Additional discounts are offered through ‘ADP Workforce Now’, including fitness, cellular, travel, electronics, and many more…
* ‘Let’s Grow Together’, we always seek first to promote from within
* Fun, fast-paced, and employee-focused environment
* 401k matching
* Paid time off and holidays
* Fortune 500 health and wealth benefits, including comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance packages

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.50 per hour

title: PRN / As Needed Nurse Practitioner
description:
Crossover Health is seeking a PRN Nurse Practitioner for our Midtown and Flatiron clinic locations. We are open Monday -Friday 8am-5pm so must have availability to cover shifts during this time

**About Crossover Health**

Crossover makes remarkable health possible by bringing people, their doctors, data, and benefits together under one connected system of health. We’ve built an entirely new category of primary care providing one simple place to go for trusted care—in person, online, anytime. We are working with the most innovative employer partners to integrate disconnected health and wellness benefits with tech-enabled services which allows our partners to increase access to care, decrease spending, and deliver an unrivaled experience for employees near and far.

**Job Responsibilities**

The Nurse Practitioner is responsible for meeting all clinical, administrative, and financial performance metrics. This position is responsible for implementing, delivering, and ensuring that the highest quality of patient-centered care is delivered.

* Provides patient centered, comprehensive primary care services
* Participate in the selection of suitable treatment plans for all patients
* Supervise staff to ensure the care team is providing appropriate care in accordance with their duties and obligations
* Assist other care providers and extended care teams
* Provide continuous availability for medical and technical questions to the employees, patient care staff, and ancillary care providers including after hours coverage
* Actively participate in quality improvement programs, as well as participate in multidisciplinary quality assurance programs
* Collaborate with the management team as needed to ensure improvement of patient care
* Cooperate with clinical outcome reviews and measurements
* Comply with all policies, procedures, and protocols
* Provide general medical care and treatment to patients in the health center under the direction of a physician (depending on state)
* Submits health care plan and goals of individual patients for periodic review and evaluation by physician.
* Provides after-hours coverage in rotation with other market clinicians.
* Prescribes or recommends drugs or other forms of treatment such as physical therapy, inhalation therapy, or related therapeutic procedures
* May refer patients to physician for consultation or to specialized health resources for treatment.
* May provide occupational health services (i.e., post-offer physicals, occupational surveillance exams, medical monitoring, return to work exams and Worker’s Compensation medical guidance) in some health centers
* May need to perform therapeutic procedures such as injections, immunizations, suturing and wound care as necessary.
* If applicable, delivers care at any clinic during scheduled work hours when necessary
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Required Qualifications** 

* Minimum of 3 years of clinical experience in Internal Medicine, Family Practice
* Must be Board Certified
* Must be licensed to practice in appropriate state
* BLS (Basic Life Support) certification required

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Proficient in promoting the clinic
* Knowledge of workplace health and safety concepts and OSHA regulations preferred.
* Strong Communication skills
* Patient communication skills

Pay: $72.00 - $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 20 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

title: Group Class Fitness Instructor
description:
**About Us:**  
At Oasis, we believe in offering a diverse range of fitness experiences to our members. We pride ourselves on fostering a welcoming and energetic environment where people of all fitness levels can thrive. To continue delivering exceptional service, we're seeking a passionate and versatile Interdisciplinary Group Class Instructor to join our team.

**Position Overview:**  
We're looking for an enthusiastic instructor who can lead a variety of classes, including yoga, boxing, and/or cardio. The ideal candidate is well-rounded in their fitness expertise, up to date with the latest industry trends, and able to bring a positive, uplifting energy to every class. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys variety in their teaching and is committed to helping others achieve their fitness goals.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead engaging and effective yoga, boxing, and cardio classes tailored to various skill levels.
* Stay informed about the latest fitness trends and techniques to ensure classes are current and innovative.
* Create a motivating and inclusive atmosphere that encourages participation and growth.
* Provide personalized feedback and support to class participants to help them meet their individual goals.
* Maintain a safe and clean environment for all class activities.

**Qualifications:**

* Certified in yoga, boxing, and/or cardio instruction (or relevant equivalent certifications).
* Demonstrated experience in leading group fitness classes across multiple disciplines.
* Up-to-date knowledge of fitness industry trends and best practices.
* A positive, energetic, and approachable demeanor with a passion for teaching.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to connect with diverse groups of people.
* High School diploma or equivalent

**Why Join Us?**

* Opportunity to work in a dynamic and supportive team environment.
* Flexible scheduling to accommodate other commitments.

**How to Apply:**  
If you’re a fitness enthusiast who enjoys variety in your teaching and wants to make a positive impact, we’d love to hear from you!

**Application Deadline:** September 19th, 2024.

Join us at Oasis and be a part of a community that inspires and empowers others to live healthier, happier lives!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Group fitness: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Certified Fitness Instructor (Required)

*Due to growth , Crossover Health is seeking a PRN/ As Needed LPN for our Pepsico clinic located in Purchase / Westchester NY . Our clinic is open M-F 8am-5pm so must have availability at that time to cover full 8-5 shift* 

**About Crossover Health**

Crossover makes remarkable health possible by bringing people, their doctors, data, and benefits together under one connected system of health. We’ve built an entirely new category of primary care providing one simple place to go for trusted care—in person, online, anytime. We are working with the most innovative employer partners to integrate disconnected health and wellness benefits with tech-enabled services which allows our partners to increase access to care, decrease spending, and deliver an unrivaled experience for employees near and far.

**Job Responsibilities**

The Crossover Nurse is central and a key partner in creating a strong patient experience. This position actively manages patient care by coordinating and connecting patients with specialists and their facilities. This position follows up with patients, guides them through the process, and while modeling Crossover’s values. The environment is fast-paced and rapidly changing and the philosophy revolves around primary care as the patient centered home and evidence-based medicine guidelines.

* Delivers patient care, practicing under the oversight of an RN or clinic supervisor
* Collaborates with patient and care team to facilitate a patient-centered medical home
* Provides evidence-based nursing care at the highest community standard
* Coordinates and connects the patient with specialists and their facilities
* Provides phlebotomy services and immunization services
* Performs other duties as assigned

**Required Qualifications** 

* Licensed Vocational Nurse from an accredited school with a minimum of 3 years of clinical experience
* Current BLS (Basic Life Support) certification

title: School Year Activity Specialist
Office Manager
description:
**Job Title: Office Manager**

**Location:** Sound Recovery **Reports to:** Clinical Director

**Job Summary:**

The Office Manager at Sound Recovery plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of the treatment center by handling administrative tasks, supporting clinical staff, and maintaining a safe and organized environment for clients. This position requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a dynamic and sensitive healthcare setting.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Daily Operations:**
* Greet all staff, clients, and guests in a friendly and warm demeanor each day.
* Check and restock daily supplies as needed.
* Maintain logs and file all receipts for client transportation (gas/mileage), activities (gym, off-site activities, meetings, etc).
* Assist clinicians with updating daily schedules as needed (cancellations, intake appointments, rescheduling).
* Ensure treatment spaces are ready for clients prior to their arrival (lights, doors, coffee/tea/water, music, housekeeping, etc).
* Restock treatment spaces with necessary items (paper, pens/pencils, necessary items for group activities, etc) and order supplies as needed.
* **Client Interaction:**
* Answer/return phone calls at the front desk. Forward voicemails and calls to the applicable provider/clinician.
* Forward prospective client phone calls to the case manager to conduct a prescreen for treatment.
* Assist program director with the organization and transport of clients from treatment center to housing on a daily basis.
* Contact clinicians when clients arrive for appointments.
* Schedule urine drug screens and add results to client charts. Notify staff of positive drug screen results upon receipt.
* Breathalyze clients upon arrival for appointments and document results in the correct client charts.
* Collect copays for client appointments and document in client’s charts for billing review.
* Greet new clients and prepare documentation for intake appointments.
* **Scheduling and Documentation:**
* Schedule clients for follow-up appointments/rescheduling, and send out daily census reports (PHP/IOP) to all clinical/administrative staff.
* Maintain communication with the APRN to schedule appointments for MAT injections.
* Review incoming faxes and notify staff as needed/document in charts.
* Update the daily schedule for the next day.
* **Financial Coordination:**
* Maintain communication with the billing team and assist with missed payments as needed.
* When payment is made: enter amount paid, reason of payment, (deductible, copayment, payment), document the payment with the date of service and how the payment was made (cash, check, credit). Document in client chart and notify billing.
* Obtain verification of benefits (VOB) from the billing team prior to scheduling an intake appointment for a new client.
* **Pharmacy Coordination:**
* Communicate with specialty pharmacies as needed and order injections (MAT).
* Work closely with APRN/MD to assist with the deliveries of medications and verifying orders are correct prior to being distributed to staff/clients.
* **Mail and Correspondence:**
* Check mail on a daily basis and organize into staff mailboxes.
* Receive and log packages entering the facility and distribute to appropriate staff.
* Mail letters to clients per clinician's request.
* Review UA cups prior to being sent to the lab for further testing.
* **Safety and Compliance:**
* Complete all staff assessments and trainings during the onboarding process prior to meeting with any clients (workplace violence training, sexual harassment training, HIPPA compliance, etc). Assist HR with filing all completed training/assessments into employees files.
* Complete all tasks for the monthly audits, including inspecting emergency lights, fire alarms, first aid box inventory, exam room inventory, and inspecting the AED. Order supplies as needed.
* Launch quarterly fire drills and document staff involvement. Maintain necessary documentation for annual reviews and update fire evacuation plans as needed.
* Ensure the building is secure before, during, and after programming hours (check all doors/areas of access are locked, check IDs as needed to protect client privacy/prevent unauthorized persons from accessing treatment areas).
* Keep all client documentation/PHI (electronic or paper) locked and inaccessible to unauthorized persons.
* Notify appropriate staff (executive director, clinical director, program director) of any and all safety concerns/maintenance issues within the facility.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in healthcare administration is a plus.
* Proven experience in an administrative or office management role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality.
* Proficiency in using office software, including scheduling systems and electronic health records.
* Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

**Working Conditions/Benefits:**

* Full-time position - Monday through Friday.
* Requires the ability to stand or sit for extended periods, as well as lift supplies or equipment as needed.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment.
* Commitment to work-life balance.

**Application Process:**

Interested candidates should submit a resume detailing their relevant experience and qualifications.

Sound Recovery is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Join Sound Recovery and make a meaningful impact on the lives of individuals in our community. We look forward to welcoming a new member to our team who shares our dedication to compassionate and comprehensive care.

title: Clinical Instructor Position - RN (Bilingual Preferred) Day Shift
description:
***This position is to shadow the students and watch while grading and documenting their tasks. We need to stress that you will NOT be performing any nursing skills - you are only there to monitor the student during their clinical rotation.***

The ideal candidate will be responsible for supervising the student's clinical rotation for our students while adhering to BPSS standards. New York's Bureau of Proprietary School Supervision (BPSS) oversees and monitors non-degree granting proprietary schools in New York. The Bureau of Proprietary School Supervision is part of the New York State Education Department.

Every student must complete a checklist of hands on skills in an actual licensed facility in order to complete their program here at ABC Training Center. This position is to shadow the students and watch while grading and documenting their tasks. We need to stress that you will NOT be performing any nursing skills - you are only there to monitor the student during their clinical rotation.

This is Part Time however our last few part time employees have loved it so much they asked if we had availability for more consistent FT work as in in person instructor. All Full time employees will be entitled to health benefits (medical, dental, and vision), life insurance and have 401K options.

Responsibilities

· Monitor students from the approved BPSS clinical curriculum in the following course subjects: HHA (HHA is approved in English & Spanish)

· Keep immaculate records for each student

· Work hand in hand with the Director of Education and the Director of Student Services

· Provide compassionate education and understand not every student is at the same learning level

Qualifications

· Must be a RN

· Must have at least 2 year’s experience

· Must have patience and work well with people

title: Assistant Principal - AHRC Middle/HS
description:
**Company Description** **AHRC New York City is one of the largest providers of services for children and adults with developmental disabilities in New York City. Our mission is to advocate for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to lead full and equitable lives.**

  

  

**Job Description**  

**AHRC NYC is seeking an Assistant Principal to join their team at Brooklyn Blue Feather Elementary School.**

**Address: 1201 66th Street Brooklyn NY 11219**


The Assistant Principal provides administrative and curriculum support to the Principal to ensure that the school provides a safe, productive learning environment of the highest quality and is aligned with NYS Learning Standards and Individual Educational Program mandates. In particular, the Assistant Principal participates in implementing policies, programs, and curriculum activities in a manner that promotes individualized educational development of each student; engages actively in guiding the professional development of teaching staff; and facilitates effective partnering and communication with parents/family members, Department of Education liaisons, and other educational service providers. The Assistant Principal also takes on the operations of the school in the Principal’s absence when necessary.

***Salary range: $91-$95k Annual***

**Essential Responsibilities**

* Works collaboratively with Principal to develop and implement curricula that fully meets NYS Learning Standards.
* Assists with evaluating and selecting curriculum materials and equipment, as well as meeting regularly with Principal to assess implementation and innovation of teaching methods.
* Actively monitors delivery of all educational and related services as prescribed in each student’s Individualized Education Plan.
* Participates in overseeing scheduling of related therapeutic services and in reviewing service-related notes for quality, accuracy, and timeliness.
* Provides coverage of classrooms when certified staff members are not present, as necessary.
* Participates in mentoring/coaching of teaching staff.
* Conducts classroom observations and provides appropriate coaching feedback to teaching staff based on these observations, as applicable.
* Assists with coordinating on-site orientation for substitutes, student interns and volunteers and facilitates appropriate assignments of these staff on ongoing basis.
* Coordinates in-service programs to ensure appropriate expertise in meeting student needs and contributes technical assistance to teaching staff in implementing curriculum material and equipment.
* Contributes to drafting of performance evaluations in accordance with agency and Department of Education requirements.
* Participates in managing communications with parents/family members, as needed.
* Assists with interactions with school district administrators, community groups, special education-related committees, Office of Pupil Transportation, and others to support and facilitate quality service provision in the school.
* Participates in CPSE/CSE/IFSP meetings, as well as interdisciplinary treatment meetings.
* Ensures that school attendance records/staff attendance records are accurately maintained.
* Helps with coordinating oversight of safety and building maintenance operations of school.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Masters in Special Education, Permanent NYS Certification in Special Education, and Certification as a School Administrator and Supervisor (SAS) required.
* Programmatic experience in special education school settings and knowledge of state and local regulations required.
* Proven ability to communicate effectively with students, family members, school district administrators and other external professional staff and demonstration of strong writing skills.
* Must have solid organizational and multi-tasking skills and proven ability to handle sensitive and/or stressful situations.
* Experience with children with autism highly preferred.

  

**Additional Information**  

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Health, Dental and Vision insurance
* Developmental Training Program
* 403b Retirement Plan with employer match
* Tuition Assistance
* Qualified Employer for the Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program
* Full Time | Monday-Friday
* Hours: 8:00 A.M-4:00 P.M

**Learn more about us:** www.ahrcnyc.org/about/careers


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

***We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.***

title: Digital Resources, Products, and Engagement Manager (non-supervisory)
description:
**Opportunity**  

The International Refugee Assistance Project (IRAP) seeks a Digital Resources, Products, and Engagement Manager to join an innovative, dynamic, and growing legal aid and advocacy organization that advances the rights of people seeking safety around the world. Making it easier for displaced people to understand their rights and legal options is a critical part of IRAP’s mandate, and this role will work across departments to simplify complex information and make it actionable for those who need it most.  

The Digital Resources, Products, and Engagement Team focuses on developing and disseminating legal information resources for refugees and other displaced persons. This role will involve duties that cross the department’s work, including user research, content strategy and design for diverse audiences (such as non-English speakers, users with limited literacy, and people with disabilities), managing our legal information site, and liaising with internal and external stakeholders to ensure that our content remains accurate and relevant. This is an exciting position that will provide the right candidate with the opportunity to grow their skills in making complex content accessible and engaging for a wide range of audiences.  

The ideal candidate for this role will have strong project management experience, as well as experience developing content for a wide range of audiences across multiple platforms, preferably in an international context. They will be able to clearly communicate user needs and audience information to internal and external stakeholders. Familiarity with accessibility guidelines (such as US Section 508) is required, with direct experience working on communications for displaced populations, people with disabilities, people in low-connectivity areas, and/or people with limited literacy and limited English proficiency preferred. They must have demonstrated experience collaborating across teams and functions, as well as a commitment to IRAP’s core mission and values.
### **Responsibilities**

* Alongside other DRPE staff, design strategy and coordinate production of multimedia content on a variety of legal topics and work with partners to ensure that content is aggregated and shared with target audiences
* Develop and/or manage internal systems related to content updates and resource accessibility
* Oversee day-to-day management of one or more of IRAP’s online platforms targeted towards displaced persons and related stakeholders
* Support efforts to make IRAP’s legal information channels more accessible in terms of both disability inclusion (e.g. compliance with Section 508) and language diversity
* Support departmental and cross-departmental efforts focused on audience research
* In conjunction with Evaluation and Learning team, monitor key analytics and utilize data to improve campaign performance
* Other duties as assigned

### **Qualifications**

* **Required:**
* Minimum of 3 years experience in digital content design and project management
* Demonstrated experience coordinating with partners for content development and dissemination
* Demonstrated experience with marketing and/or behavior change communications
* Familiarity with accessibility guidelines and best practices
* Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and/or Premiere Pro
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Fluency in English
* A sense of curiosity, a desire to learn, and a commitment to IRAP’s mission and values

* **Preferred:**
* Experience conducting UX/UI and other forms of user research, ideally in low-connectivity contexts
* Product management experience
* General experience working in low-connectivity environments, with users with limited literacy, and/or users with limited English proficiency
* Fluency in a language spoken by one or more of our client groups (such as Spanish, Arabic, French, Pashto, Dari, Kreyol, or Tigrinya)

  

* Applicants with lived experience with displacement and/or digital accessibility issues are strongly encouraged to apply.

**Location:** The candidate will be US-based, with the option to work remotely, hybrid, or in one of IRAP’s offices in New York City or Washington, DC. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. **Compensation**  

The annual full-time equivalent salary range for this position is $80,083 - $90,134 commensurate with experience and office location. May be subject to a collective bargaining agreement.
**Benefits**  

IRAP’s benefits vary across office locations, and IRAP seeks to offer equitable and generous benefits to all employees. IRAP’s US benefits include:* Fully paid family health insurance
* Retirement options
* Extensive PTO (20 or more vacation days & 19 org-wide holidays)
* Comprehensive leave time for sickness
* Disability and parenting (4 months of parental leave)
* Reimbursement for work from home equipment
* Generous opportunities for professional development

  

IRAP is an equal-opportunity employer; people of color and individuals from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. IRAP does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, citizenship status, ethnic background, religion, political orientation, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or any other protected class. We consider all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all local, state, and federal laws related to the Fair Chance Act.

title: Director of Strategic Initiatives
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled Director of Strategic Research to lead our research efforts and drive strategic decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in research and analysis, with a proven track record of developing and implementing research strategies to support business objectives. The Director of Strategic Research will be responsible for managing a team of researchers and collaborating with other departments to ensure the success of our research initiatives.

Responsibilities:  
- Oversee the development and implementation of research strategies and plans to support business objectives.  
- Lead a team of researchers in conducting research projects and providing research support to various departments.  
- Collaborate with other departments to ensure research initiatives align with business goals.  
- Analyze research data and provide insights to senior management to inform strategic decisions.  
- Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including vendors and external Are you searching for a sense of purpose and a career that is rewarding in itself? Let Collier Youth Services be the intersection of meaning and fulfillment in your career. Join our community and transform the lives of at-risk children!

Since 1927, Collier Youth Services has been devoted to the mission of serving at-risk and PROMISING children, youth, and families. Our programs have developed over the years in response to the changing needs of the young people and families we serve. Today, Collier Youth Services is a non-profit that addresses the therapeutic and social issues of our youngsters through educational, residential, and recreational programs of the highest quality. Using a holistic approach, Collier provides at-risk youth support and care. While our services continue to evolve, one thing remains constant: our commitment to nurturing the potential of each person and honoring their individual worth.

~~~

* Advance the mission of Collier Youth Services in all aspects of the agency and across all programs with all employees
* Oversee the CARF Accreditation and Re-Accreditation Process including but not limited to:

a. Development, implementation, review and compliance with Agency-Wide Plans  
b. Training on Agency-Wide Plans  
c. Accreditation and re-accreditation of the residential programs  
**d.** Monitor standards for any needed updates or changes based on CARF annual updated Manual  
e. Work with each program to ensure performance measurements are reflective of client and program needs  
f. Oversee the day-to-day operations and implementation of agency wide CARF standards applicable for accreditation  
g. Responsible for developing agency-wide CARF calendar and working with the QIC coordinator to monitor operational  
performance through KPI’s and other metrics to drive continuous improvement and innovation in operational processes

* Serve as Corporate Compliance Officer to ensure that all corporate processes and procedures comply with internal, accreditation, legal and regulatory standards
* Oversee all reporting requirements to ensure compliance with the Department of Education, the Department of Children, Youth and Families, NJ Lunch Program and all other governing bodies applicable to CYS programs
* Assist in reviewing, developing and implementing policies and procedures aligned with CYS’ strategic objectives and state contracts and regulations
* Oversee PMIS plan to include: Work with Program Directors on Trend Analysis, Benchmarking and Root Cause Analysis. Adjust KPI’s and implement changes as indicated to improve efficiency and effectiveness
* Work with Program Directors and Development Department to assist with grants and the development of logic models and relevant KPI’s for reporting on outcomes
* Work with leadership team in analyzing trends and outcomes related to standards of care of each program
* Actively participate as a member of the CYS Executive Leadership Team, reviewing and developing strategic initiatives for the agency, identify and work to minimize risk and propose opportunities for growth and improvement
* Work with Program Directors regarding new initiatives and program development to determine need, mission fit, and sustainability, including the development of a business plan, research all funding sources, regulatory requirements, and review and complete applications as needed
* Identify areas for process improvement and streamlining, implement solutions
* Utilize technology and data analytics to enhance operational efficiency
* Assist in other various tasks and projects as requested

**SKILLS/ABILITIES**

● High degree of initiative, independent thinking

● High level organizational skills and detail orientation

● Strong leadership abilities to inspire and guide

● Ability to create a positive and productive work environment

● Ability to effect change through Influence

● Ability to develop and implement long-term operational strategies

● Demonstrates flexible and efficient time management and prioritization of workload

● Excellent communication skills both verbal and written

● Proficiency in using technology and data analytics to enhance operations

● Strong interpersonal skills for building positive relationships, foster team building, resolve conflict and problem solve

● Excellent facilitation, training, public speaking and organizational skills

● Effective supervisory and coaching skills

● Financial acumen and understating of financial metrics and their impact on operational decisions

● Expertise in planning, executing and overseeing projects

● Strategic planning

● Skill in leading teams through transitions and ensuring smooth implementation of new processes

● Competence in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation

● Experience and knowledge of working within the non- profit sector

● Culturally competent/responsive, with the training and experience necessary to manage complex personnel situations at times; as well as, working with a diverse population within all of CYS programs

● Exhibits high degree of confidentiality

Collier Youth Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, carrier status, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Collier Youth Services is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact HR (732-946-4771 Ext. 269).

To learn more about us, please visit our website at https://www.collieryouthservices.org/.

Collier High School is a fully accredited non-profit, private school that serves students with disabilities. Since 1927, Collier Youth Services has been devoted to the mission of serving at-risk and PROMISING children, youth, and families. Our programs have developed over the years in response to the changing needs of the young people and families we serve. Today, Collier Youth Services is a non-profit that addresses the therapeutic and social issues of our youngsters through educational, residential, and recreational programs of the highest quality. Using a holistic approach, Collier provides at-risk youth support and care. While our services continue to evolve, one thing remains constant: our commitment to nurturing the potential of each person and honoring their individual worth. Through quality education, specialized instruction, and therapeutic support, students come to experience themselves as caring, talented, and high-achieving individuals. We provide students with individual and group counseling.

OneSchool Global is seeking a dynamic and creative High School Math Teacher for our New York Campus in Airmont, NY. The scope of this role will encompass advanced mathematics on grade levels 7-12 using the Self Directed Learning model to ensure our incredible students develop their full potential with “Learning To Learn.”

* A valid teaching license for New York
* Willingness to be part of a collaborative educational team
* Effective communication skills, both oral and written

***History of our School:***

OneSchool North America, founded in 2005, is a school system of excellence, comprised of 36 private schools located across Canada, the United States, and the Caribbean. Currently, the system provides over 1,100 students aged 8-18 with an outstanding and challenging education, using the latest in technology and teaching pedagogy. Staff have the opportunity to travel and collaborate with like-minded professionals from across the continent. OneSchool is one of the world’s largest and most comprehensive, truly global schools. With nearly 10,000 students, over 130 campuses, and approximately 2,500 staff operating across 20 countries, OneSchool’s global education ecosystem provides an environment in which our staff and students thrive. Over 200 of these staff work in the U.S., Canada, and the Caribbean in close cooperation, sharing best practices, professional learning opportunities, and resources.

title: 2025 Client Group Graduate Program
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our 2025 Client Group Grad be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a global Marketing and Comms function at a global asset management firm.

  

**The Program**



As part of the Graduate Program, you’ll be given training to help you perform to the best of your abilities. Rotations will take place across our Client Group department in your first two years, so you’ll need to be flexible and open-minded. We encourage our graduates to get as broad an experience as possible so that they choose their career path well. No matter where you are placed, you will be working in teams that are collaborative and supportive.

  

**What the ideal candidate is like**


* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Innovative and analytical – you’re happy to think outside the box and look for a fresh perspective
* Intellectually inquisitive - be passionate about financial markets, global trends and economics and beyond
* Open minded to rotate across different teams
* Collaborative and flexible - happy to get involved in variety of tasks and projects
* A growth mindset: we understand you may make mistakes, and when you do, we are looking for you to learn from these.

  

  

**The knowledge, skills and qualifications we’re looking for**


* 2025 graduate
* Working knowledge of financial markets and concepts
* Proficient in Office Suite

  

  

**Recruitment process**



* Online application


* Online assessments


* Online video and/or in-person interview


* Final round interview with senior member of the business



Candidates should be available to start the graduate program in September 2025.

  

**Compensation**  

  

Schroders offers a base salary of $80,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

  

**ADA**



Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

  

**We recognize potential, whoever you are**



Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics.

description:
**Vitality Hospice & Palliative Care is seeking an exceptional Registered Nurse to join our team!** This is a terrific opportunity to work for a clinician-owned and operated hospice agency that cares about its patients, and its employees. We offer a positive, upbeat work environment where the interdisciplinary team works together to improve symptom burden and quality of life for patients and caregivers. If caring for those on their end-of-life journey speaks to you, we would love to have you on our team!

**Responsibilities:**

* Working collaboratively with the hospice physician and Interdisciplinary Team to carry out appropriate interventions.
* Managing and supervising the combined efforts of home health aides, social workers, and chaplains.
* Educate patients and caregivers as appropriate.
* Upholding high standards of compliance regarding documentation and patient care requirements.
* Helping the agency to continuously increase the quality of care.

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills

description:

title: Front Desk Associate
description:
Join the Nios team! We are seeking a dynamic, full-time Front Desk Representative to join our team at Nios. We stand out as a premier electrolysis permanent hair removal center and spa, with locations in Columbus Circle (Manhattan) and Barclay's Center (Downtown Brooklyn). Here at Nios, we’re passionate about helping people look and feel their very best – and we love to transcend expectations and offer unparalleled service that sets the bar high. Our workplace isn't just about professionalism; it's about fostering a friendly, organized environment that's dedicated to exceptional customer care, with a bit of quirkiness thrown in for good measure :)

**Note: This role will require working at both our Downtown Brooklyn & Midtown Manhattan locations.**

**To apply, please include:**

* A brief cover letter/email to introduce yourself.
* An updated resume featuring your personal email address and phone number.

**Essential Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Customer Service: Be the face of Nios! From greeting clients to handling calls, answering queries, scheduling appointments, and managing emails, you'll ensure our clients feel valued and cared for every step of the way. You will also assist with insurance authorizations and billing.
* Office Admin: Keep things running smoothly by managing inventory, coordinating staff schedules, and maintaining a tidy workspace (around 5 minutes of light cleaning each day).

**About You - The ideal candidate:**

* You're a people person, exuding warmth and professionalism both in person and over the phone.
* You’re trustworthy, confidential, and personable - you're the epitome of professionalism.
* You like to go the extra mile to give clients the best possible experience.
* You cross all your T’s & dot all your I’s – you’re proficient in written and verbal English, with impeccable grammar and communication skills.
* You have a cheery disposition and a good sense of humor!
* You thrive in an organized, multitasking environment and stay cool under pressure.
* You’re available for a 5-day workweek (either 9am-6pm or 11am-8pm, including one weekend day), **with flexibility to rotate between our Manhattan and Brooklyn locations as needed.**
* You have experience with customer service - familiarity with spa software or medical office procedures is a huge plus.
* You want to work somewhere for the long-term – at least a year (hopefully more), and grow your career along with our business.

**What Do You Get?**

* Medical, Dental, & Vision insurance after 90 days (60% employer paid)
* 401k with employer match
* Generous vacation policy
* Commuter Benefits
* Free complementary electrolysis & facial services, and 25% friends and family discount
* $300 of free cosmetics per year
* Free massages every quarter
* A robust employee assistance program that offers unlimited free counseling, coaching, and trainings, legal assistance, discounts, and more
* Free coffee and snacks!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

title: Assistant Store Manager
description:
**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*NEW STORE OPENING\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

**COME JOIN THE PARTY**

At PCHI, we create joy for our customers by making it easy to create unforgettable memories. We are C*ustomer Obsessed.* Our Team Leads lead by example and possess the energy and enthusiasm to match our customers excitement while providing an exceptional shopping experience. We are knowledgeable about our products and services because we have the broadest and best selection of party goods in the industry. We ensure we are in-stock and easy to shop. We inspireourcustomers with exciting concepts, themes, ideas and provide everything they need to bring their party to life.

*At PCHI, o*ur promise is *Customer First*, *People Matter*, *It Can Be Done* and *Celebrate*! We live our brand every day and love to party!

**ARE YOU CUSTOMER OBSESSED?**

* You are responsible for executing best in class sales and service strategies.
* Team Leads reinforce exceptional customer service behaviors delivered by the store team through accountability, reinforcement, recognition, and praise.
* Teams Leads provide value to our guest by delivering a customer friendly in-store and curbside shopping experience
* You will leverage technology to enhance the customer service experience for our internal and external customers.
* You will cultivate an “It can be done” attitude with your team when it comes to overcoming obstacles and bringing joy to our customers.
* Team Leads are responsible for helping deliver on sales, profit, and service targets, as well as delivering on all key Omni strategies and metrics

**WHAT DO YOU BRING TO THE PARTY?**

* Do you possess prior retail management experience?
* Are you obsessed with ensuring that your customers are beyond satisfied?
* Are you adaptable and able to manage change daily through your team?
* Do you possess strong communication skills and the ability to build relationships with your staff and customers?

**RESULTS MATTER!** 

* Team Leads will master all OMNI channel service platforms, including in-store pickup, delivery, curbside pickup, and others.
* You will manage and plan the daily and weekly workload to deliver on store sales goals and customer engagement.
* You will assist the Store Team Leader with team onboarding and learning.
* You will continuously direct and coach store team members.
* You will support the Store Team Leader in holding associates accountable to expectations.
* Team Leads are expected to work a schedule that aligns to customer and business needs (this includes early morning, evening, overnight shifts, and weekends).
* Team leads are responsible for creating an environment that promotes associate engagement and retention.
* As part of the Leader on Duty (LOD) team, you are responsible for other various processes and procedures to ensure an efficiently operating store.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**The replenishment process will require you to lift, push and pull up to 25lbs daily.

* Cleaning, store recovery, setting plan-o-grams and endcap maintenance is required.
* Climbing ladders is required to re-stock and obtain merchandise for our customers.
* Ringing transactions on a register is required.
* Utilization of our helium system to fulfill customer orders is required.

**PARTY PERKS AND REWARDS**

* Comprehensive Benefit Plan
* 401(K) Program

* Generous associate discount

title: Regional Director of Career Services - Hybrid remote
description:
**OVERVIEW:**

We are a market leader in the for-profit postsecondary career education. Working at our colleges is more than simply a rewarding job; it is also an investment in yourself. Our purpose is to create personal and community transformation by inspiring students to achieve beneficial and long-term life changes. We are always looking for like-minded, ambitious people who want to be the greatest in their professions. Our best applicants share our dedication to assisting students in developing the skills necessary to establish a future for which they can be proud.

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

We’re seeking a dynamic candidate to provide leadership as the Regional Director of Career Services. This vital role will support campus locations in CT, NJ & NY. At the core of this role is the implementation and management of a career placement model that provides the foundation for connecting students and graduates to employers, directly impacting our college's ability to exceed graduate placement goals. Under the leadership of the school-system Vice President of Career Services, the Regional Director of Career Services functions as a leader within the Career Services vertical, ensuring the achievement of objectives for the regional career services team. Among the most important goals are the extern-to-hire ratios, achieving placement targets mandated by accreditors on a monthly basis, steady and consistent improvements in extern-to-hire performance, and the overall productivity at each of the campus locations within the region. The Regional Director of Career Services is a key contributor to the school system career services special projects and initiatives, and serves as a mentor, training and coaching the region’s career services management and staff.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* 5 years of experience in college-level career services.
* 3 years of experience as a Director of Career Services, working in a supervisory role, leading the work of others, which includes most recent position.
* Working with a diverse population of employees.
* Effective leadership skills.
* Strong interpersonal and written communication abilities.
* Demonstrates initiative and resourcefulness for planning and implementing long-term improvements.
* Demonstrates strong counseling skills and understanding of individual and group behavior principles.
* Proficient in establishing processes and creating business guides to explain routine procedures.
* Creates and sustains constructive working relationships.
* Provides effective responses to inquiries.
* Resolves complex situations without clear rules or precedents, interpreting and implementing policies and procedures.
* Demonstrates interest and passion for working in a multicultural/multiethnic environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year

Experience:

* college-level Director of Career Services: 3 years (Required)
* college-level career services: 5 years (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

title: Associate Director, Global Publisher and Partner Strategy
description:
At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It’s why we work with some of the world’s leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.  

  

ABOUT THIS ROLE  

The Associate Director of Global Publisher and Partner Strategy is a crucial role responsible for developing, planning, executing and overseeing, a number of multifaceted projects that have impacts on Audible’s publisher and independent creator relationships. We’re looking for an experienced candidate with a proven ability to develop and bring to execution partnership strategies. You will work with various departments across the business and with multiple teams across all of Audible’s marketplaces to help execute on the strategies you have helped to design. Through your deep knowledge of our business and understanding of partner relationships, the implementation of your strategies will help put in place structures and deals that further our partnerships and content offerings and drive Audible’s growth into the future. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including in publisher and partner strategy.  

  

As an Associate Director Global Publisher and Partner Strategy, you will...  

* Develop the vision and end-to-end global strategy for identifying, establishing, maintaining and growing relationships with publishers, authors, and content creators worldwide
* Be accountable for the delivery of the annual Global Publisher and Partner three-year plan
* Align on the Audiobook Creation Exchange (ACX) service model; who we serve, what service is provided to achieve growth and how partners are incentivized
* Establish consistent processes globally by collaborating with regional teams to ensure consistent global strategies and deal making, while adapting to local market dynamics and cultural nuances
* Be responsible for developing and implementing Global Publisher performance metrics, OKRs, MBRs and reporting
* Serve as a partner and trusted consultant to cross-functional teams in areas including Content, Product, Marketing, Insights, Finance & Strategy
* Drive the growth of Audible’s business on behalf of publishers, including business management in support of Audible org goals around revenue and engagement
* Produce stack-ranked set of publisher priorities to influence product requirements, roadmap decisions and trade-offs
* Track and monitor new Audible features and offerings that drive partner opportunities, and package for external talking points

  

ABOUT AUDIBLE  

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners’ imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. Our Hub+Home hybrid workplace model gives employees the flexibility between gathering in a common office space (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). For more information, please visit adbl.co/hybrid.  

  

Basic Qualifications  

  

* Bachelor's degree
* 5+ years of experience in a strategy and planning role

  

Preferred Qualifications  

  

* Extensive knowledge of the global publishing landscape, including key players, trends, and industry dynamics
* Demonstrated leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
* Proven analytical, financial and strategic thinking abilities, with a talent for identifying opportunities and developing innovative solutions
* Proven writing capabilities for creating written reports and presentation materials for senior executives which communicate financial analysis, strategic perspective, and drive toward a recommendation
* Willingness to travel and attend industry events
* Proven success in strategy and business development

  

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Pre-Kindergarten Teacher
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is one of the North East’s largest providers of Early Learning, Before and After School and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations. We are reinventing accessible and affordable child care for today’s families and creating opportunities for caregivers to do what they love (and feel valued while they’re doing it). Join our community to provide the quality program children deserve while pursuing your own professional growth and development.

**We are currently looking for a Pre-Kindergarten Teacher for our classroom at Mamaroneck Union Free School District.**

**Status: Part-time, non-exempt**

**Pay: $25 - $28 per hour (based on qualifications and experience)**


The Pre-K program provides four-year-old children with a universal opportunity to access high-quality pre-kindergarten programs that prepare them for future school success. This position will require a high degree of creativity, cultural awareness and problem-solving capabilities. The program focuses on child-centered activities, development of strong foundational skills in early literacy and numeracy, social interactions and Kindergarten readiness skills. The successful candidate should possess experience with early literacy, multi-disciplinary approaches and strategies for meeting the needs of diverse learners.

**Responsibilities will always include but are not limited to:**

* Plan and implement a developmentally appropriate program for PreK students, meeting UPK School District requirements.
* Plan, prepare and teach well developed culturally responsive lessons.
* Assess, track, and provide relevant and timely feedback on the achievement and developmental needs of students.
* Use age-appropriate and positive guidance strategies to teach, encourage, and redirect inappropriate classroom behavior.
* Build relationships with staff and families through positive and professional communication, creating a welcoming environment, respecting diversity, and encouraging parent participation in the program.
* Work collaboratively with teacher assistants
* Design the room layout for success using ECERS (Early Childhood Environment Rating Scale)
* Developing activities that promote literacy and math concepts – following the Creative Curriculum
* Participating in on-going in-service and education development opportunities, and participating in the ongoing development and evaluation of the program’s goals and objectives


Requirements:
**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Current NYS teaching certificate valid for service in the early childhood grades
* Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred)
* Experience teaching preschool-age children

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


To be qualified as a Pre-K teacher, a person must possess either:


(a) New York State Certification Birth – Grade 2 OR


(b) New York State Certification N-6 OR


(c) New York State Certification P, K, 1-6 OR


(d) Bachelor’s Degree & 5-Year Plan

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Please note applicants for this position will be required to complete standard background screenings which include fingerprinting, NYS child abuse clearance, physical & TB test
* Must pass a full background check, including fingerprinting, references,
* Warm, friendly, caring, upbeat personality. Exceptional people skills in dealing with young children, parents and staff. Professional, reliable and prompt.
* Must have the stamina and physical flexibility (walking, sitting, standing, bending, kneeling, pulling, running, reaching, climbing, lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs.) without assistance to participate in children’s activities.

**BENEFITS:**


Telehealth Benefits


On Demand Pay


401(k) for eligible employees


Sick Time Off


Career Development


Certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance, get in touch for more details.


In addition, we offer competitive benefits for our full time employees including:


Paid Holidays


Health, Dental and Vision Insurance


Life Insurance


Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance


AFLAC Supplemental Plans


Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com

title: Before and/or After School Program Staff
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is not just another childcare provider. We are Inc. 5,000's fastest-growing provider of Early Learning, Before and After School, and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations and growing. We are a certified benefit corporation on a mission to reinvent accessible and affordable childcare for today’s families and create opportunities for our team to do what they love (and feel valued while doing it). Join our award-winning community and dive into a world of excitement, growth, and endless possibilities. Check out what it's like to work with us at https://www.healthykidsprograms.com/workwithus.

**We are hiring for multiple positions for our Before and/or After School Program for the 2024-25 school year at Roaring Brook School, Chappaqua, NY.**

**JOB STATUS:** Part-time, non-exempt

**POSITIONS AVAILABLE:** Substitutes, Assistants, Group Leaders, Supervisors, Directors

**The Before and After-School Program team is responsible for:**

* Facilitating hands-on activities following the Healthy Kids Curriculum which includes fitness, STEAM, academic, art, and other group activities as well as homework completion.
